Title: Unique ways to celebrate New Year Eve
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Nashik: People across Nashik city celebrated the New Year Eve in unique ways.

Fun, food and friends

Most youths were out on the streets to welcome the new year and visit decked-up shops and restaurants that were kept open until midnight. Most students were seen in the College Road and Gangapur Road areas.

Aniket Deshmukh, a restaurant owner, said “My restaurant is full of families and friends out to have a good time on the last night of the year.”

Cozy at home with books

Some book lovers bought meaningful books to read at midnight. Prerana Deshmukh, a book lover, said “I am going to read ‘Postscript’, a book by Cecelia Ahern and go to sleep. This is my way of celebrating cozily in my bed.”

Western festival, Indian feel

In the Ramkund area , thousands of youths lit 2020 lamps to welcome the new year. Sahasra Deep Prajjwalan Shala has been organized by the Mitra Mela for the past 18 years. “The idea is to celebrate a Western festival with Indian flavour,” said Sachin Dhikle, the organiser of the event.

Religious welcome

Over 250 youngsters from across the country and abroad participated in three-day International Youth Convention organised at Pujya Shri Kanji Swami Smarak Trust in Deolali area. The IYC had invited nine young Jain scholars. Devang Gala, the organiser of the convention, said “While the world is partying, these youngsters are welcoming the year in a religious way.”

Title: Researcher scripts Chaudhari proverbs, riddles in a book
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Vadodara: ‘Khede tiyaay fuy’ is the commonly used proverb to explain land reforms in the tribal Chaudhari community in Surat and Tapi districts. The proverb that roughly translates as ‘land to the tiller’ got popularized when land reforms were introduced by former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

Some 395 proverbs like this, which would have otherwise become extinct, have, for the first time been compiled and published as a book. A professor of Gujarati literature Vikram Chaudhari has come out with the book having not only list of proverbs but also 174 riddles of the Chaudhari language.

“There is a population of five to six lakh people in Chaudhari community but the language is among those Indian languages that may get extinct. This book will help in not only protecting but also conserving the language,” said Chaudhari. He is a professor of Gujarati at an arts and commerce college in Bardoli in Surat district.

Chaudhari said that proverbs and riddles that have travelled over generations within the community highlight the history and culture. “The proverbs and riddles are about the culture, struggle, lifestyle, celebrations, nature, agricultural methods of the community,” he added.

The language’s prominence among the younger generation is slowly decreasing as other languages like Hindi and English are being widely used. Giving an example of it, Chaudhari said that after the book was unveiled, it was shared to youth of the community. “But many of them were unaware about these proverbs. I saw them asking their grandparents what the proverbs and riddles meant,” Chaudhari said.

He believes that the book will act as a bridge between the younger generation and the language.

Title: 2,400 tonnes of naphtha taken out of Goa, shipped to Gulf
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The high court of Bombay at Goa made it clear in its order that the entire responsibility of ensuring safety a... Read More

PANAJI: The 2,400 tonnes of naphtha stored at Ganesh Benzoplast left Mormugao Port at 11.36pm on Tuesday, said South Goa collector Ajit Roy. The chemical is being shifted out of India by MT Global Peak to the Gulf at not cost to the state. It was initially aboard the grounded vessel Nu-Shi Nalini, off Dona Paula.

Chief minister Pramod Sawant said that the vessel and naphtha has been cleared “without spending a single paise from the state treasury within one and a half month”. The chief minister had initially said the state government was searching for a new vessel to transport the naphtha that it would not be transported by road.

“I reiterate that the safety and well-being of Goans is our top priority and our government remains committed to protecting the interest of Goa,” Sawant said.

The high court of Bombay at Goa made it clear in its order that the entire responsibility of ensuring safety at the tanks storing naphtha from the ill-fated Nu Shi Nalini will be that of Ganesh Benzoplast in the first instance and MPT in the second instance.

After it came on record that Ganesh Benzoplast is storing naphtha at Vasco without consent to operate from the Goa Pollution Control Board, the high court had observed that it is “virtually holding a gun to the entire state”.

Congress had submitted a memorandum demanding a high-level inquiry on the grounded vessel Nu-Shi Nalini carrying highly explosive naphtha from Pakistan at Mormugao Port Trust. Congress had also demanded that naphtha not be transported through tankers.

On October 24, due to strong winds and cyclone Kyarr, chemical tanker Nu-Shi Nalini drifted from outer anchorage and ran aground near Dona Paula.

Nearly a month later, on November 21, Marine Masters B V was given the job of salvaging the vessel. The naphtha aboard the vessel has already been sold to a Baroda-based firm that emerged as the highest bidder in the auction process.

MSTC (a government of India’s public-sector unit, earlier known as Metal Scrap Trade Corporation Ltd) conducted the auction through online bidding.

Title: GST: Kiran Bedi promulgates ordinance
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kiran Bedi

PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor-cum-administrator Kiran Bedi on Mondaypromulgated Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Ordinance 2019.

The council of ministers resolved to get the ordinance promulgated since the legislative assembly is not in session, said a release from the lieutenant governor’s secretariat. The ordinance is to amend the Union territory of Puducherry ’s GST law with effect from January 1, 2020. The ordinance will remain in force for six months or till the assembly passes an appropriate bill, whichever is early. The release said Bedi had obtained the approval of the Union government and instructions of the President for the promulgation of the ordinance. The Union government has amended Central GST law with effect from August 1, 2019, following the recommendation of the 35th meeting of the GST council on June 21.

Title: Education minister meets West Bengal governor at Raj Bhavan
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Jagdeep Dhankhar (Photo: ANI)

KOLKATA: The state education minister has finally called on the West Bengal governor on the last day of the year, throwing up signs of a let up in the continuing battle of nerves between the government and the constitutional head of the state.

Education minister Partha Chatterjee is the first minister in the Mamata Banerjee cabinet to have paid a visit to Raj Bhavan on Tuesday, five months after Jagdeep Dhankhar took office as governor of West Bengal in July 2019. Chatterjee did it after the chief minister forwarded a letter from the governor on education matters to the minister with a direction “to discuss all the issues at a convenient time”.

The minister’s visit came nearly a fortnight after chief secretary and director general of police called on the governor at Raj Bhavan.

The governor was probably waiting for the meeting to build bridges with the government.

“Had extremely involved pleasant and cordial meeting with Partha Chatterjee, the honourable education minister. Best wishes for 2020 for the honourable chief minister and all the members,” Dhankhar tweeted after the meeting. The governor also told the minister that he wanted to visit the cyclone-hit districts in 2020. The governor also put his signature on the West Bengal Municipal (Amendment) Bill, lying with him after being passed in the Assembly.

Neither the governor nor the education minister did divulge the details of the discussion and how the governor’s concern over the running of the state universities was addressed by the minister.

Chatterjee only indicated after the meeting that the state government didn’t like the way the governor has been using his twitter handle on various issues and has recently uploaded the CM’s letter addressed to him. “I requested the governor against making comments in the social media too often,” Chatterjee said.

This apart, the governor “embarrassed” the government by making tweets on each and every occasion he met with hurdles. The governor also told the media that he has to use the ‘ Didi ke Bolo ’ platform to call attention of the chief minister to sit with him and carve out the development path for the state.

The governor wants to make a “fresh start” from New Year though the flashpoints in the “walking together” remain. The governor in his New Year message has made certain points such as “abrogation of Article 370 is epochal”, “Lok Sabha elections signalled political stability in a row” that the chief minister may not agree to.

The governor, who is the chancellor of state universities, was peeved with “the temples of education in political cage”. The governor’s remarks fueled similar reactions in Trinamool ranks while ministers kept blaming the governor for his taking a partisan stand.

The state education minister told the governor’s not being able to attend the Jadavpur University convocation programme was “unfortunate” but didn’t give indications of taking back the new university rules that plugs any direct communication between the governor and the vice-chancellor.

Political observers would rather wait till January 13 and see the outcome of the governor’s calling a meeting of the vice-chancellors in presence of the education before they conclude that things have started looking up.

Title: Leopard killed in accident on Nashik-Pune highway
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Nashik: A four-year-old male leopard was killed in an accident after being knocked down by a speeding vehicle on the Nashik-Pune highway in Sangamner taluka of Ahmednagar district.

The incident took place at around 6.45 pm on Monday at the Saraldhavawadi village, near Chandanapuri ghat in the Sangamner taluka.

On receiving the information, forest department officials immediately rushed to the spot. They then sent the animal’s body for post-mortem. The body was subsequently cremated on Tuesday.

This is the 10th incident of a leopard being killed after being knocked down by the unidentified vehicles in the past year in this section of the Nashik-Pune highway.

The forest department said there are several leopards in the forests along the Chandanapuri ghat area. The accidents often take place when the leopards try to cross the roads, added an official from the forest department.

A few months ago, two eight-month-old male leopard cubs were killed in an accident after being knocked down by a speeding vehicle on the Dubere-Sonari Road, near the Sinnar tehsil town of Nashik district.

Around four incidents have occurred in the area in the past year alone.

Meanwhile, there have been several incidents of leopards being spotted in different parts of Dindori taluka over the past month. Forest officials said they have erected a total of 14 cages in different parts of the Dindori taluka to trap the big cats.

Title: Fewer deaths, but cops fail to curb property offences in ’19
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Nashik: House break-ins continued to be the thorn in the city police’s side 2019. The number of house break-ins in 2019 almost matched the number in 2018, showing that the police were unable to bring this category of offence under control.

However, controlling street robberies proved to be even harder, as the number of chain-snatchings and robberies, in general, went up in 2019 in comparison to the previous year. On a brighter note, there were fewer murders and road deaths in 2019.

Over the past year, the city has seen some grievous crimes, including the murder of a trader in Indiranagar and the murder of an IT engineer during an armed dacoity attempt at Muthoot among others. The police were praised by all quarters for their swift action in nabbing the culprits involved.

However, offences like robberies, house break-ins, vehicle thefts, thefts etc continued unabated despite strict policing planned with the aim to increase police visibility on the city streets.

In 2018, there were 254 house break-in cases registered in the city. In 2019, the police had registered 255 cases till December 29.

Further, as against 71 chain-snatchings registered in 2018, in 2019, there were 87 chain-snatching cases. Other robberies too increased to 147 in 2019, up from 139 in 2018.

Police commissioner Vishwas Nangare-Patil said, “Thefts and robberies are a menace and the police personnel are doing everything in their capacity to control them. Since the beginning of the year, we have been appealing to the people to deploy security guards and set up surveillance cameras on their respective premises to prevent robberies and thefts. Now we have also decided to come out with a notification to make it compulsory for all private entities to take security measures at their own level that would safeguard life and property.”

The police commissioner also said that soon, under the Smart City project, Nashik would get as many as 800 CCTV cameras. After the camera network is installed, the menace of thefts and robberies would come under control, he said.

Meanwhile, there were fewer murders in 2019 when compared to the crime data of 2018. According to the police data in 2019, there were a total 23 murder cases registered in the city. A year prior to that, the total figure of murders in the city stood at 35.

Senior police officials attributed this drop in number of murder cases to the large-scale externment of criminals that were effected in 2019. Police officers said that 2019 saw externment of 136 criminals. Further, Maharashtra Prevention of Dangerous Activities (MPDA) Act was invoked upon 12 criminals.

Fatal accidents too dropped by almost 24%. Police officials said that from the beginning of the year, they have been insisting on people wearing helmets. By the end of the year, 90% of the bikers are seen wearing helmets. The police presence on the city streets — to take action against erring motorists and bikers not wearing helmets — has resulted in cases of causing death due to negligence to 176 from 2018’s 230 cases, said the police data.

Title: Barodians ring in 2020 amid bonhomie
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Dance party at M S University in Vadodara on Tuesday

Vadodara: It was the usual festivities on New Year’s Eve where Barodians welcomed the new decade amid music and fireworks on Tuesday midnight.

With many party plots and hotels hosting disco and musical nights on the occasion, revellers had multiple options to shake a leg even amid the biting cold.

All the roads led to the farmhouses on the outskirts of the city where the private parties were organized. But the cops were ready to nab anybody flouting prohibition laws and had deployed stringent security across the city. It also conducted checking of party revellers for drunk driving. Policemen in plain clothes also kept a watch on eve-teasers and miscreants at different party venues. While a group of young girls got tattoos welcoming 2020, some others preferred to spread awareness against smoking.

A flash mob in Fatehgunj on Tuesday by a group of youngsters urged people to stay away from tobacco and drug addiction and was a huge attraction. All the restaurants and hotels were packed till late on the night, while the roadside stalls too did brisk business.

Title: GST council to waive late fee
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Puducherry: The GST council has decided to waive off late fee for defaulters , who failed to furnish details of their monthly and quarterly outward supplies from July 2017 to November 2019 if they furnish the details before January 10.

Puducherry sales tax commissioner L Kumar said the government has issued a notification in this regard. He appealed to all dealers, traders and industries to utilise the opportunity and avoid paying ‘late fee’. TNN

Title: Madras HC sets aside dismissal of co-operative society employee
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Setting aside the dismissal order of a saleswoman at a co-operative society, the Madras high court directed the authorities concerned to reinstate the petitioner, who was dismissed on charges of misappropriation, citing that the co-delinquent in the case was reinstated back in service based on the earlier order of this court.

The petitioner, Jeyachitra, and another woman Sheela Devi were working as sales women at the Pullampadi primary agricultural cooperative credit society (PACCS) limited in Trichy. They were placed under suspension for misappropriation from the cooperative society and a criminal case was also registered against them in 2016.

Following these charges, the president of the society imposed a punishment of stoppage of increment for one year on the duo. After remitting back the amount which was misappropriated, the petitioner submitted a representation to the authorities concerned seeking to revoke her suspension. However, an order dated June 16, 2017, dismissed her from service. In the meantime, both were acquitted from the criminal case by a lower court.

On perusal of submissions made by either side, Justice M S Ramesh observed that since Sheela was reinstated by a court order in 2018, the same would squarely apply for the petitioner.

“Originally the petitioner was imposed with the punishment of stoppage of increment for the period of one year and subsequently the order of dismissal was passed. A perusal of the dismissal order does not reveal the fact that the earlier punishment of stoppage of increment for a period of one year was recalled or set aside. Without doing so, the petitioner cannot be subjected to two punishments and the same is illegal,” observed the judge.

Hence, the judge set aside the dismissal order and directed the authorities concerned to reinstate the petitioner to service with all consequential and monetary benefits.

Title: CAA: Madras HC seeks government reply to plea seeking permission to protest
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Madras high court

MADURAI: The Madras high court directed the state government to respond to a plea seeking permission to take out a special procession against CAA in Dindigul district.

The petitioner, A Abdul Rahman, who is the president of Jumma Periya Pallivasal Wakf, stated that they had sent a representation to the authorities concerned on December 24 seeking permission to organise the special prayer and procession in a peaceful manner on January 3 without causing any hindrance to public peace.

There was no reply from the officials.

He stated all arrangements have been made and had issued pamphlets at Batlagudu and nearby villages.

Justice T Krishnavalli directed the state government to file a counter and adjourned the case to January 2.

Title: T gained 163 sq km forest cover
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Hyderabad: Telangana lost 155 sq km of tree cover, as per the data presented in the Indian State of Forest Report 2019 compared to the last assessment in 2017. This figure represents trees occurring in patches of less than one hectare, including scattered trees. The report however stated that the state has gained forest cover to the tune of 163.31 sq km.

The report presented on Monday comes in the backdrop of repeated protests by city-based activists and environmentalists against the felling of trees across the state for various projects. The report says the state’s tree cover stands at 2,514 sq km.

The forest cover for the state stands at 20,582.31 sq km, which is 18.36 per cent of the state’s geographical area, said the report. Forest cover represents trees spread over more than one hectare with a tree canopy density of more than 10 per cent. The report said that the main reasons for this are “plantation and conservation activities as well as improvement in interpretation”.

Among the districts, Adilabad has 35.53 per cent forest cover in proportion to its geographical area, the report said. Followed by Khammam with 33.76 per cent, and Warangal with 22.99 per cent. The worst performing districts were Nalgonda with 2.91 per cent, Medak with 7.62 per cent and Hyderabad with 8.61 per cent. Medak was the only district to see a loss of forest cover from the previous assessment to the tune of 6.69 sq km.

The figures are based on the interpretation of IRS Resourcesat-2 LISS III satellite data of the period November 2017 to January 2018.

Among trees outside forests in urban spaces, Neem had maximum presence with 18.94 per cent, followed by Mango trees at 8.84 per cent and Leucaena leucocephala 7.04 per cent. Mango trees had the most presence in rural areas (41.63 per cent). Among invasive species, Lantana camara had the maximum spread of 259 sq km.

In terms of forest canopy density classes, the state has 1,608.24 sq km under Very Dense Forest (VDF), 8,787.13 sq km under Moderately Dense Forest (MDF) and 10,186.94 sq km under Open Forest (OF). Interestingly, in Telangana, from January 1, 2015 to February 2, 2019, a total of 9,420 hectares of forest land was diverted for non-forestry purposes under Forest Conservation Act, 1980.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: SIT probing anti-Sikh riots to get police station
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: The state cabinet on Tuesday gave its nod to constitution of a police station for the special investigation team (SIT) which has been set up to probe the 1984 anti-Sikh riots in Kanpur.

This, said government spokesperson, will expedite the investigation into the riots that broke out after the assassination of then PM Indira Gandhi.

Special investigation team was constituted on February 5, 2019.

In a bid to strengthen health facilities under state insurance scheme, the cabinet approved a private practice allowance to doctors of state insurance scheme, under labour healthcare services.

The allowance will be 20% of the basic salary structure, but basic salary and private practice allowance taken together should not be more than Rs 2,37,502.

The cabinet also increased the last rites allowance for freedom fighters from Rs 5,000 to Rs 12,000.

The Governor’s fleet will get four new Mahindra Scorpio vehicles.

The cabinet cleared a proposal to replace the existing Maruti Gypsies with the new SUVs.

The cabinet also approved promulgation of the UP Vidhan Parishad Sachivalaya Services (Induction and Services Conditions) (Fourth Amendment) Rules, 2019.

The new rules have formalised the Chairperson’s role in appointment of staff to Parishad.

Title: Vacant land at Mattuthavani likely to be an alternative for Thamukkam ground
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Madurai: Madurai Municipal Corporation is planning to conduct fairs and exhibitions at a vacant land between MGR bus terminal and the flower market at Mattuthavani as an alternative to Thamukkam ground where a convention centre spending Rs 46 crore is coming up.

Officials said that there is a land measuring more than five acres lying vacant next to the truck parking space at Mattuthavani.

The convention centre, which was recently proposed by the corporation, has obtained all clearances from the required agencies. Preliminary works on preparing tender documents are on. Officials expressed confidence that the tender process can be finalized in a couple of months, and start the work in March or April. “However, it may get delayed if election to the urban local bodies is announced in between,” a corporation official said.

It will take 18 to 24 months to finish the construction work. Once the work is started, the rest of the space on the ground will not be available to conduct exhibitions and fairs including the annual Chithirai festival, which used to be conducted in April, he added.

Another official said that the vacant space is sufficient and is a viable option to conduct fairs and exhibitions. It is easy to access from the main road and is well connected by public transportation system with the rest of the city. Its only flip side is its location. Compared to the Thamukkam, which is located in the heart of the city, Mattuthavani is located in one corner of the city, he said.

Officials have promised that the convention centre is planned in less than four acres and a part of land measuring 5.6 acres will be left untouched, where Chithirai festival and other fairs can be organized normally.

Title: Man cheats bakery owner by subletting his mini bus
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: A resident of Manjalpur was booked for cheating a bakery owner by subletting his mini bus and not paying him rent for five months.

The complainant Mahendra Vaishnav had rented out his minibus to the Ashwin Patel in July 2017 for a monthly rent of Rs 23,000 through a friend. Vaishnav had bought the used mini bus from a man in Anand in January. According to the agreement between Vaishnav and Patel, the latter was to pay him the rent before 10th day of each month.

In July, Patel paid him Rs 10,000 as advance and later gave Rs 22,000 as July’s rent. After that, he then stopped paying rent to Vaishnav. “Whenever the Vaishnav asked for rent money, he would make some or the other excuse and kept dilly-dallying,” said a police official.

Around a fortnight back, when Vaishnav again contacted him for rent, Patel flatly refused to pay and told him that he had let out the mini bus to some other person in Godhra . Vaishnav stated in his complaint that Patel even told him to go ahead and lodge a police complaint as he is not afraid of the law.

Even then when Vaishnav did not get his money, he lodged a complaint based on which an FIR was registered against Patel at Makarpura police station on Monday.

Title: Kolkata's Tallah Bridge demolition to start on January 5
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

A signboard displaying the new speed limit imposed on vehicles plying on the bridge

KOLKATA: The state public works department ( PWD ) is gearing up to start dismantling the Tallah Bridge from January 5. They have planned to close the bridge from January 3 night. Around Rs 2 crore will be spent to demolish the bridge.

It has been decided at the meeting, held by PWD director and several transport operators , on Monday that the autos plying on Tallah Bridge will be asked to follow original routes. They will not be able to take the new routes decided for the buses.

Light and small vehicles have the options of three different routes like Belgachhia bridge , Chitpore Lock Gate and Khagen Chatterjee Road-Cossipore Road.

The buses of 15 different routes, which used to ply on the Tallah Bridge, will follow a simpler diversion pattern now. Most of these buses, except for the ones on four routes, will use Belgachhia bridge to move towards the south. They will be diverted through Chitpore Lock Gate while returning.

However, the present bus services via Belgachhia bridge will remain unaffected. A few buses that have already been diverted towards EM Bypass will continue to follow the diversion.

After the Tallah Bridge’s structure was found to be in a dangerous state, the government had announced on September 28 the ban on vehicles having gross weight of over 3 tonnes to move on the bridge. Heavy vehicles stopped plying on the bridge from the next day.

Title: Dengue menace: Minor girl dies, 1,269 cases in 2019
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: An 11-year-old girl in Tarsali area died from dengue at the state-run SSG Hospital (SSGH) on December 11, confirmed the results of the dengue tests conducted on her which were furnished to the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) on Tuesday. This is the first death due from the vector-borne disease this year after dengue kept the city in its grip in 2019.

Ruchita Bariya’s blood sample report which came posthumously confirmed her death as due to dengue virus . VMC officials said that Ruchita died from dengue shock syndrome with multiorgan failure.

The city registered 6,153 suspected dengue cases in 2019, of which 1,269 were confirmed as dengue. The total number of cases reported in 2016 was 1,514.

VMC officials, however, said that the number of deaths could be considered on the lower side. “In 2016, 14 persons had died due to dengue. This year, the symptoms of the disease were much milder. Physicians managed to treat some patients even without admitting them in hospitals,” said an official.

A concern, however, is that several private hospitals treated dengue patients after performing the rapid card test for dengue.

The civic body is considering such private treatment as well as indicative tests not confirmatory. Officials confirm a dengue case only if the ELISA test is positive for the NS1 antigen and IgM antibodies. This had led to around 10 unconfirmed dengue deaths in the city during the year.

Title: Police to raise spl security force for fortifying courts
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Lucknow: Acting on directives of Allahabad High Court amid incidence of violence in courtrooms, Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police on Tuesday proposed formation of an exclusive Uttar Pradesh Special Security Force (UPSSF) for security on court premises. On December 20, the high court directed the state government to build boundary walls around all district court premises, install CCTV cameras and deploy special police force by January 15.

Earlier in the day, the UP cabinet gave its nod to nominate a private firm to audit security of courts in the state and approved nomination of ESIL to audit functioning of CCTV rooms in courts and other security arrangements.

Inspector general of police (law and order) Praveen Kumar told TOI the proposal to raise exclusive five battalions of USSF has been prepared. “Training will be done in co-ordination with respective district judges. He also said security equipment like scanners, detectors, CCTVs must be made effective in all districts. Every month, a review of security in courts ought to be done by monitoring committees comprising district police and administration,” said Kumar.

The officer also said, emphasis will be laid on video conferencing during trial and remand. Police and the district administration should get in touch with district judges and bar associations for providing identity cards to petitioners, litigants before entry in courts.

A bench of Justice Sudhir Agarwal and Justice Sunit Kumar had directed the UP government to fortify courts in the aftermath of Bijnor courtroom shooting on December 17. Two persons barged into the court during a hearing of a murder case and shot the murder accused.

Title: Hyderabad: 38-year-old man electrocuted while trying to fix banner
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A driver was electrocuted while trying to fix a New Year celebrations banner in front of a hotel at Kukatpally on Tuesday night.

The victim was a 38-year-old driver named Jhonny from Miyapur who was working at hotel in Satavahana Nagar in Kukatpally. “On Tuesday night, a New year bash was being organised at the hotel. Banners were put up in for the same. Jhonny noticed that one of the banners was hanging very low and tried to move it up. While trying to do so, he accidentally came in contact an with overhead electric line and got electrocuted,” Kukatpally inspector B Laxminarayana Reddy said. Police have booked a case of negligence under Section 304-A of the IPC and shifted the body for post-mortem procedures.

Meanwhile, Taskforce police conducted surprise checks at 32 pubs in Hyderabad with two sniffer dogs on Tuesday evening to prevent any kind of narcotics abuse during New Year celebrations. “We have checked all the pubs to see if anyone was hoarding narcotics. No drugs were found,” Taskforce DCP, P Radhakishan Rao said.

Title: Draft electoral rolls published
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Hyderabad: Draft electoral rolls for elections to 120 municipalities and 10 municipal corporations have been published, said State Election Commissioner Nagi Reddy on Monday. Those who don’t find their names in voters list or have objections can submit their objections and suggestions till January 2. The reservations of wards would be announced on January 4. The reservations would be finalised by the government. Over 40,000 officials are being drafted for election duties.

On allegations from opposition parties that the election schedule suited the TRS and it was announced even before finalisation of reservation of wards, municipal administration director TK Sridevi said as per the new Municipal Act, election schedule has to be announced in consultation with state government. “This new Act was passed in the Assembly. If opposition parties have a problem, they can move the court,” an official said. TNN

Title: Melodious songs of Rafi, Mukesh entertain people
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Nagpur: ‘Melodious Mukesh and Rafi’, a programme of music organized by Kanak Sur Mandir, entertained the people as they got a rare opportunity to listen to distinct styles of these two legends at Sai Sabhagruh, on Sunday.

Distinct styles of Mukesh and Rafi were picked by the singers as hit songs of these legend were sung alternately.

Twenty beautiful songs were presented by 10 singers at the programme conceptualized by Datta Harkare.

The first song, ‘Aaja tujhko pukare mera pyar’, was sung by Suryakant Ambadekar, followed by ‘Kai sadiyon se’ by Praveen Kulkarni. ‘Lakhon hain nigah mein’ and ‘Aa laut ke aaja mere meet’ was presented by Abhijeet Vaidya.

‘Haan deewana hoon main’ by Avinash Shravane and ‘Kaun hai jo sapno mein aaya’ by Prashant Chaudhari were enjoyed by the audience. ‘Sajan re jhoot mat bolo’ was sung by Sushmoy Chatterjee.

‘Aise toh na dekho’ by Kishor Dakhale, ‘Mai toh har mod par’ by Chandrashekhar Desai, ‘Ae husn zara jag’ by Ajay Vaidya, ‘Pukarta chala hoon main’ by Nilay Bannore kept the audience engaged.

Ambadekar performed one more beautiful song, ‘Chand si mehbooba’, followed by ‘Rang aur noor ki baraat’ by Kulkarni. Sushmoy Chatterjee’s ‘Hum tumse juda hoke’ was followed by ‘Chandan sa badan’ by Prashant Chaudhari.

Shravane also presented ‘Jhoomti chali hawa’. ‘Main toh ek khwaab hoon’ was presented by Ajay Vaidya, followed by ‘Meri mohobbat javan rahegi’ by Ambadekar. ‘Gardish mein hon tare’ was performed by Desai.

The programme concluded with a nice rendition of ‘Duniya bananewale’ by Kishor Dakhale.

(Reporting by Rushabh Rathod)

Title: Shiv Sena’s Rajendra Janjal wins deputy mayor election
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Aurangabad: In the first major boost for the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) after forming government in the state, Shiv Sena’s Rajendra Janjal won the Aurangabad deputy mayor’s election by defeating the BJP-backed Independent candidate Gokul Malke by 17 votes on Tuesday.

The election, however, witnessed high drama as senior Congress corporator Afsar Khan resigned from the party membership and MIM suspended six members from the party for skipping the election process.

Khan was upset with the party as he was made to withdraw his nomination papers.

Janjal bagged 51 votes, Malke 34 and MIM candidate Shaikh Zafar Akhtar 13 votes. The election witnessed cross-voting by MIM and Congress corporators.

The election was necessitated following the resignation of BJP’s Vijay Autade in the second week of December.

Additional collector Bhanudas Palve, who was appointed as the returning officer for the poll, said that out of the 115 members of the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation, 100 were present during the election process and two abstained from voting.

Seven candidates had filed nominations for the election. Just before the voting on Tuesday, four candidates — Afsar Khan and Shabnam Kalim Qureshi of Congress, Kailash Gaikwad of RPI-Democratic and Sena’s Surekha Sanap — withdrew their nominations.

Apart from 29 Sena members, five Congress, two NCP, two MIM, five BSP and eight independents voted in favour of Janjal.

Malke bagged the votes of 22 BJP, one Congress, one MIM and 10 Shahar Vikas Aghadi corporators while 13 MIM members voted for Zafar.

Ajju Pahalwan of MIM voted for BJP while the party’s Salima Babubhai Qureshi and Tasneem Abdul Rauf voted for the Sena candidate.

Congress member Vaishali Jadhav voted for BJP while Afsar Khan and Ayyub Khan abstained from voting. Three Congress and two NCP corporators were absent.

The MIM group leader, Gangadhar Dhage, suspended Saira Bano Ajmal Khan, Sangeeta Subhash Waghule, Naseem Bi Sandu Khan, Vikas Yedke, Shaikh Sameena Shaikh Ilyas and Saleema Babubhai Qureshi from primary membership of the party as they either remained deliberately absent or voted against the party candidate .

Title: ‘Million march to be held on Jan 4’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Charminar: Telangana and Andhra Pradesh joint action committee (JAC) against NPR, CAA and NRC announced on Tuesday that it will hold a million march at Necklace Road on January 4. The march was scheduled for December 28 but had to be postponed as cops refused permission. The JAC approach high court on December 27 and put off the agitation till the court delivered its order.

Following a fresh directive from the court, the JAC has decided to hold the march on January 4. It will seek fresh permission from the police.

Tahreek Muslim Shabban president Mushtaq Mallik, who is a convener of the JAC, said that the march will be conducted at 2 pm. “We have held a core committee meeting where it was unanimously decided to conduct the million march peacefully on January 4,” said Mallik. He appealed to the people to participate in large numbers and oppose the “draconian” law. Forty organisations, including few political parties except AIMIM and Tameer e Millat, are part of the JAC. — Omer Bin Taher

Title: Onion price in Hyd dips to Rs 90/kg
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Hyderabad: After reaching a high of Rs 200 a kg and keeping consumers seething with rage for nearly two months, the price of onion is on the decline in Hyderabad. Consumers are breathing easy with the rate dropping to Rs 50-Rs 90 in the retail as well as wholesale markets in the last few days.

With onion arrivals in Malakpet marketyard seeing a spurt, the wholesale price has also seen a big dip. The onions are now sold at Rs 8,500 per quintal — a drop from Rs 13,000 per quintal just days ago.

Traders are hopeful that the price would further come down and onion would be available at affordable rates in next 15 days, once the new crop arrives into the market.

Market analysts said the retail prices are also coming down gradually, thanks to onion arrivals. “Every day, 80 to 100 lorries are arriving with onion load,” a trader said.

The state is getting onions from neighbouring Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Maharashtra. “Once more stocks arrive from Gujarat in another week, the crisis will ease out considerably,” an official said.

Title: ‘Scrapping quota from Parliament & House is discriminatory’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

LUCKNOW: Members of Anglo-Indian community in the city on Tuesday termed the government’s move to scrap provision of nomination to the community in Lok Sabha and state assemblies as “discriminatory” and urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi and chief minister Yogi Adityanath to reconsider the decision.

They said the Constitution (126th) Amendment Bill, ratified by the UP Assembly, provides extension of reservation for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribes for 10 years but scraps special provision of nominating Anglo-Indian members to Lok Sabha and state legislatures.

This means the community will not get benefit of the provision in legislature bodies formed after January 25, 2020.

The term Anglo-Indian can be referred to at least two groups of people – those with mixed Indian and British ancestry and people of British/English descent born or living in India.

Many Anglo-Indian families are living in India for four-five generations and decided to live in the country of their birth after Independence. Seats were reserved for the community in legislatures so that they can get a platform to air their grievances.

Errol Serpis, a 68-year-old retired professional, told TOI: “India is our motherland. We have been loyal to the country and contributed in its development. Abolishing seats will be an injustice to the community.”

“We also contributed in the freedom struggle. The government should acknowledge our needs as it is doing in case of SC/ST category,” he said.

Former president of All India Anglo-Indian Association, Lucknow chapter, Clifford Bond said the government should not scrap the provision. “The community has left an indelible mark in the annals of history of our country as officers in the Indian Air Force, Navy, Army and education. A lot remains to be done for those who are still fighting odds and need assistance and opportunity. We don’t belong to a particular caste, we have been true Indians,” said Bond.

Denzil Godin, nominated member from the community in the state assembly, had on Saturday said: “We are over 50,000 in number across the state and around 300 in Lucknow. As we have no specific provision in the Census form since 1951, the numbers quoted by the government to justify its decision to scrap the special provision for Anglo-Indians is wrong.”

Gordin, who has also written to UP CM and the Governor, to reconsider the decision, said opposition parties were not informed about this move when the Bill was tabled in the Assembly for ratification.

The Anglo-Indian community has a glorious history. Three of its members from Lucknow – flight lieutenant (retd) Alfred Tyron Cooke, Air Marshal (retd) Denzil Keelor and his brother Trevor Keelor – fought in 1965 India-Pakistan war and were conferred gallantry awards.

Title: Visa cheating case: VMC officer named as accused
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) medical officer, Dr Devesh Patel , has landed in a major controversy after he was named as an accused in a US visa cheating case registered at the Kamrej police station in Surat district .

The top official has been accused of accepting money on behalf of the mastermind in the case.

The offence was registered by a resident of Patel Faliya in Kamrej, Nayna Patel who said she was seeking for a visa for her daughter Henal either to the USA or Canada. Patel was then directed to one Manish Patel by a friend.

Henal held a master’s degree in pharmacy and Manish Patel promised the complainant that her daughter would get a job in the US and should therefore migrate to the country. He also claimed that he had a placement agency in Delhi and allegedly told the complainant that she would have to pay Rs 25 lakh as fees. The woman agreed to pay the amount but said that she would pay it in instalments only.

Patel later asked her to consider sending her son Priyank too to the US as someone he knew there was looking to employ youths. The complainant agreed to this offer and between May 25, 2018, to February 17, 2019, she paid Rs 45lakh for the two visas. However, it never got through. The money was not transferred through banks but using ‘angadiyas’ and even as cash payments.

The SMC official got entangled in the issue after he allegedly received Rs 5 lakh through ‘angadiya’ which was meant for Manish. Two others, Krunal Pravinbhai and Urmit Patel, had also received money in a similar fashion and were named in the FIR along with Manish and Dr Devesh Patel.

According to the doctor, he knew Manish since childhood as they belonged to the same village. “I have nothing to do with the case and do not know the complainant either. I came to know about the offence only on Monday. It seems that my relationship with him along with he reputation I have is being used to blackmail me,” he added.

Title: Hyderabad: Woman sets self ablaze at Punjagutta police station, critical
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A 37-year-old woman attempted suicide by setting herself ablaze at Punjagutta police station on Tuesday evening. The woman, who was from Chennai, suffered critical burns. Police said that she was dejected with the behaviour of a 51-year-old mining businessman from the city who she was in love with and, so, resorted to the extreme step.

“Lokeshwari had married a man named Srinivas in 2000. When their daughter was eight-months-old, Srinivas left her,” said Punjagutta ACP Tirupatanna. Her daughter is now 16-years-old.

In 2012, Lokeshwari, a resident of Chennai, met Praveen Kumar, from Bapanna Basti, in Warasiguda, while on a trip to Tirupati. “In 2013, Praveen Kumar had set up a jewellery store in Somajiguda and appointed Lokeshwari as its manager. They were living together in BS Maqta,” said the ACP.

In 2014, Praveen lodged a complaint against Lokeshwari alleging that she stole 23.5 tola gold from the shop. Lokeshwari was arrested and later acquitted.

Lokeshwari then moved back to Chennai. Recently, Lokeshwari tried to contact Praveen who avoided her.

On Friday, Lokeshwari and her landlord, Kannan came to Hyderabad in search of Praveen and checked into a lodge at Nampally.

“On Tuesday evening, Lokeshwari wrote a letter addressing ACP Punjagutta alleging that Praveen Kumar had duped her of Rs 1 crore. She asked Kannan to hold the letter and walked to the police station. She then doused herself with petrol and set herself ablaze,” West Zone DCP A R Srinivas said.

Engulfed in flames, Lokeshwari ran into the police station. Cops doused the flames and rushed her to NIMS hospital. As she had sustained severe burns she was moved to Osmania General Hospital. “Kannan said that Lokeshwari brought him to Hyderabad saying that she has to collect Rs 50 lakh from Praveen. She suffered 78 per cent burns. Her dying declaration is being recorded. We are trying to trace Praveen,” the ACP said.

Lokeshwari had purchased petrol from a filling station in Nampally saying that her scooter stopped in the middle of the road. She showed her Aadhar card to make the purchase, the ACP said.

Title: Cong leaders meet governor Tamilisai Soundararajan, seek probe against Anjani Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Hyderabad police commissioner Anjani Kumar

HYDERABAD: Congress on Tuesday petitioned governor Tamilisai Soundararajan, urging her to order an inquiry against Hyderabad police commissioner Anjani Kumar for his high-handed behaviour and denial of permission to take out ‘Save India, save Constitution’ rally in protest against CAA, NPR and NRC on December 28.

“Police gave permission to lathi-wielding RSS members to march on the roads. Consent was given to MIM public meeting in Darussalam. But, police not only denied permission to our rally but also arrested hundreds of party workers. Is Congress a banned organisation or an illegal outfit?” Telangana Congress president and Nalgonda MP N Uttam Kumar Reddy said.

A delegation of Congress members comprising Uttam, working president A Revanth Reddy, former minister Mohammed Ali Shabbir, among others, submitted a memorandum to the governor. “There are allegations of corruption and misconduct against Anjani, which needs to be probes,” Uttam said.

Uttam added that all complaints received against Anjani would be forwarded to authorities once an enquiry is ordered. Congress leaders urged the governor to exercise special powers under section 8 of AP Bifurcation Act 2014 and take action against Anjani.

After bifurcation of Andhra Pradesh, Anjani was allocated Andhra state cadre but he continues to serve in Telangana by obtaining a stay order from court. “Has KCR not found an IPS officer from Telangana cadre who is fit enough to head Hyderabad police force? Anjani is doing chamchagiri of the ruling TRS,” Uttam alleged.

Title: Invasive species increasing in Kerala’s core forest areas
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kochi: More than 1,000 invasive species have been identified in the core rainforests of Kerala , according to the latest forest survey report 2019. The common species are chromolaena odorata (siam weed), lantana camara (lantana), ageratum conyzoides (goat weed), ageratina adenophora (sticky snakeroot) and mikania micrantha (Chinese creeper).

Scientists say that the first impact is the displacement of endemic species. “The invasive species can establish themselves faster than the local ones because they are sturdier,” said T V Sajeev, senior scientist, department of forest entomology, Kerala Forest Research Institute (KFRI).

He said that during landslides the top layer of soil slips, which helps the invasive species. “Immediately, the invasive species establish themselves. In canopies, even in a tree branch falls, the invaders occupy the space created,” he said.

Most of these species come into the core forests through what are called linear intrusions by way of roads, electric poles, wiring, etc. “Yet another form is wind pollination where the seeds disburse very fast and in large numbers. There is also a phenomenon of the giant trees being replaced in case they fall. The endemic species are slow to grow while the invasive ones just take over, occupying even the minute space available in the forest,” Sajeev said.

These would soon change the character of the tropical rainforests which are the source of intense rainfall in the state.

Title: BJP ally PMK says no to NRC in Tamil Nadu, ‘will create unwanted fear’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

People protest against CAA near Alundur court in Chennai (File Photo)

CHENNAI: PMK, an ally of the ruling AIADMK and BJP, on Tuesday passed a resolution at its general council meeting in Tindivanam, urging the Centre and the state government not to undertake the National Register of Citizens (NRC) exercise in Tamil Nadu. By opposing the NRC , the PMK has joined the ranks of other BJP allies - JD(U) and SAD - who are also against this exercise.

PMK youth wing leader and Rajya Sabha member Anbumani Ramadoss hadsupported the Centre’s Citizenship Amendment Bill in Parliament. The PMK has also been demanding that Lankan Tamils too should come under the ambit of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act as they were a “persecuted minority” in the island nation. In its current form, CAA only provides for citizenship to “persecuted minorities” in Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh. “Our state does not share its borders with any country and details of Sri Lankan refugees are already available with the government. Hence, there is no need to undertake NRC in Tamil Nadu, since the exercise will create unwanted fear among people,” the PMK resolution said, hinting that the National Population Register ( NPR ) exercise is itself being seen by many as a prelude to NRC.

On a mission to strengthen the party, through the recently formed ‘Brothers’ and ‘Sisters’ wings, PMK hopes to finalize its strategy for the 2021 assembly election.

“The AIADMK government is surviving solely because of our support. We gave them 22 seats for the byelections and ensured the government’s survival. But, AIADMK is not reciprocating the gesture,” said Anbumani at the meeting.

Anbumani, however, sought to downplay his speech on NRC, while addressing the media later. “AIADMK leadership is aware of this. I have not accused the ruling party, but only made a friendly request. This will not create any issue in our alliance with AIADMK,” he said. While adding that CAA is not against anyone and people have not fully understood it, he said it was “wrong”, if people were arrested for drawing ‘kolam’ against CAA.

At the meeting, Anbumani also hit out at DMK president M K Stalin for blaming the PMK for everything. “DMK has employed an agency by spending huge money to malign us as well as other political parties in the social media,” he said.

“In the recently held rural local body polls, AIADMK allocated seats to us piecemeal and we were forced to plead. While we aligned with them, after giving up our avowed principle against aligning with anyone, it hurts when we do not get due recognition,” he leader said.

“At least in the next round of local body polls, including the nine districts where the polls were not held, AIADMK should recognize us properly,” he lamented, while adding that his party will draw up its strategy for the 2021 assembly election soon, a PMK source, privy to the meeting, told TOI.

Read this report in Bengali

Title: SPU-CVM global connect meet on January 11
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA/ ANAND: Education town Vallabh Vidyanagar in Anand district will host Global Connect Meet for the first time next year. To be organized jointly by Sardar Patel University (SPU) and education trust Charutar Vidya Mandal (CVM) the meet intends to act as a platform for all the alumni spread across the globe.

The Alumni Association of SPU and the SPU Alumni USA are supporting the meet which will be held on January 11, 2020.

The global meet will also mark the centenary year celebrations of university’s former vice-chancellor professor Raman D Patel, who had also served as head and pioneer of the chemistry department of V P Science College of CVM.

Eminent alumni in the field of academics, industries, research and development and other sectors are expected to participate in the meet. A committee comprising SPU VC Prof Shirish Kulkarni and CVM chairman Bhikhu Patel among others has been formed to overlook preparations for the forthcoming meet. Varsity has launched a link – https://spualumni.spuportal.in – for alumni to register for the meet.

Title: IMS scam-accused invested Rs 130 crore in FDs & shares: ACB
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: More skeletons are tumbling out of the multi-crore Insurance Medical Services ( IMS ) scam cupboard. ACB officials, who booked a third case against Omni Medi proprietor K Srihari Babu and arrested him, said he had invested Rs 130 crore ill-gotten money in shares and bank deposits.

ACB officials found that Srihari was floating a shell company Legend Enterprises with his associate Krupasagar Reddy as director. IMS joint director K Padma prepared indents to purchase medical kits to count white blood cells from a Swedish firm through Legend Enterprises.

Indents prepared by Padma were approved by IMS director Ch Devika Rani and purchase orders would be issued. “The accused did not make any purchases from the Swedish company. The accused transferred money into the accounts of Legend Enterprises by creating fake documents, including supply bills. From the accounts of Legend, money was routed to Srihari’s account. A part of this was given to Devika and Padma by Srihari,” said an ACB official.

“Srihari invested Rs 99 crore in stock market and Rs 31 crore as fixed deposits,” said an ACB source. Presently, Srihari stands as an accused in three IMS scam cases. Officials said that Srihari would be produced before court on Wednesday for judicial remand.

Title: West Bengal: Notice to Visva-Bharati for Poush Mela rule violation
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

A file photo of Poush Mela in Santiniketan

KOLKATA: West Bengal Pollution Control Board (WBPCB) on Tuesday served a show-cause notice on Visva-Bharati , Santiniketan , threatening to impose on them Rs 10 lakh environmental compensation for alleged violation of three key issues at Poush Mela — stalls using coal-fired ovens, insufficient public toilets and amenities and absence of fire-fighting arrangements in all stalls.

The National Green Tribunal (NGT) formed a three-member observer committee comprising former advocate general Jayanta Mitra, pollution control board chairman Kalyan Rudra and environment crusader Subhas Datta , who had moved NGT in 2016 against gross environmental pollution during Poush Mela. The committee identified these problems on December 24 and 25. Issued by the member secretary of WBPCB, Rajesh Kumar, the notice asked the VB registrar to explain why the environmental compensation should not be imposed on the university.

“My recent case particularly focussed on VB’s failure in managing waste,” said Datta.

The VB public relations officer, Anirban Sarkar, said, “We are yet to receive the notice. We have done everything to comply with the NGT order. WBPCB did not give us any guideline. We will give a reply after receiving the notice.”

Title: ‘Earmark lanes for different vehicles for smooth traffic’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Dignitaries at the meet organized by Institute of Town Planners, India, on Sunday

Nagpur: Policy-makers should concentrate on growth of walkable urban centres that are transit-free and bicycle-friendly for which a proper transportation system should be put in place by earmarking different lanes on wider roads and make commuting easy, said Swati Meshram, senior planner at California, USA, on Sunday.

She was delivering the keynote address on ‘Environment-friendly multimodal mobility — an experience of orange country, California, USA’, organized by the Nagpur chapter of Institute of Town Planners, India (ITPI) at its Trimurti Nagar Ring Road facility.

Swati, who is active in community development planning in California, said people in India drive two, three and four-wheelers on the same roads which causes bottlenecks in the system. In US, a large number of people use four-wheelers for daily commuting that reduces burden on roads.

Americans, she said, are promoting bicycles and bikes. This should be emulated in India too. It will be an ideal situation if transportation system is open to automobiles, pedestrians and cyclists too. For this, different lanes should be earmarked so that road users will not face problems while driving. ‘Smart growth’ will be possible if these factors are taken into account, she added.

Swati’s father DS Meshram, president of Institute of Town Planners, New Delhi, said giving importance to disciplined driving can solve 50% of transportation problems in India. People are not disciplined and are often seen parking vehicles in the areas meant for travelling. This causes hindrances in smooth flow of traffic, he added.

While streets are open to all, and not vehicle-friendly, roads are meant for different types of vehicles. If people understood the difference between the two, conditions might change for better, he said.

Chairman of the institute Sujit Rodge and treasurer Jagdish Rajurkar were seated on the dais. Secretary Pankaj Bahadure proposed a vote of thanks.

(Reporting by Janhavi Dave)

Title: City BJP chief taunts Sena on ‘leaving Hindutva ideology’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Aurangabad: City BJP chief Kishanchand Tanwani hit out at Shiv Sena for not wearing the traditional saffron headgear during the deputy mayor’s election on Tuesday and added that the party has changed its Hindutva ideology.

“Sena’s ideology has changed. They used to wear saffron phetas (headgear) in every election. Now that they have received support from Congress and NCP, they have ditched their tradition,” Tanwani told reporters following the election.

The deputy mayor election had to be held after BJP’s Vijay Autade resigned from the post earlier this month. The BJP had stated that the resignation was against the state government’s stay on Rs 1,680-crore water supply scheme of the state government.

The BJP sought letter from the state government stating that the stay has been lifted from the crucial water supply project.

Earlier, mayor Nandkumar Ghodele, a Sena corporator, had stated that the BJP’s desire for power hasn’t exhausted and if the letter was not received from the state government, why did they support the nominee for deputy mayor.

Tanwani said they supported a candidate because they did not want the election to be without opposition. “We could have given a tough fight to Sena but we did not do that because we wanted people of the city to know the truth,” he said.

Title: Gujarat: Highways, railway tracks turning deadly for crocodiles
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Between 2005 and 2018, the state witnessed 38 instances of collision between crocodiles and vehicle on roads a... Read More

VADODARA: Gujarat is known to be a home to healthy breeding population of muggers. But the otherwise fearsome crocodiles are falling prey to fast-paced development of roads and railway in the state.

Crocodiles enjoy highest protection under the Wildlife (Protection Act) 1972, but a research paper on ‘Mugger crocodile mortality due to roads and railways in Gujarat’ has revealed a disturbing trend.

Between 2005 and 2018, the state witnessed 38 instances of collision between crocodiles and vehicle on roads and railway tracks, which resulted in death of 33 reptiles. Only five were treated and released in the wild again. Of these accidents, 24 happened on the roads while 14 on railway tracks.

“The trend is disturbing considering that there is a rise in number of collisions in the last decade,” said Anirudh Vasava, research coordinator at the Voluntary Nature Conservancy and member of the IUCN-SSC crocodile specialist group.

Also, juvenile and sub-adults (small crocodiles less than seven foot in size) were the ones which met with more accidents – 24 in all - compared to adults (crocodiles more than seven foot long) that met 14 such accidents.

Most of the crocodiles collide with heavy vehicles or trains during the months of monsoon (July to October) while the frequency of such accidents decreases in winter and summer.

“It is during the months of monsoon that babies get hatched. The female crocodiles and the juveniles start dispersing in search of newer and safer areas. But when they try to cross over these areas to reach connecting habitats, they meet with accidents,” he said.

Raju Vyas, the regional joint vice-chair of the IUCN/ SSC crocodile specialist group (South Asia and Iran), said, “Crocodile movement is high during nights when visibility of drivers is less. “For the reptiles, they are just doing a seasonal or food migration. But when they cross the roads or railway tracks, they get victimised. At times, they also get crushed due to fear or just for the sake of fun of the drivers.”

“The road and railway network is expected to expand further due to other proposed transportation projects like dedicated freight corridor and Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project. It is emerging as a threat to otherwise growing mugger population within the state,” said Vyas, who has been researching mugger crocodile for more than three decades in Gujarat.

Title: Happy New Gear: Bulletproof jackets for cops
Content:
File photo used for representational purpose

NEW DELHI: To strengthen its frontline in deployment, Delhi Police is procuring over 5,000 bulletproof jackets for its personnel. The vests will not only be worn by the cops going on raids to catch criminals, but also by the front layer during riots and agitations. The move is being seen as a boost to the force’s ability to fight terrorists and organised crime.The department was expected to complete the procurement in a month, sources said. The jackets being bought are of III+ level and will protect Delhi cops from bullets fired from a range of weapons, such as AK rifles, sten machine guns, MP-5, carbine, etc.The new vests are each likely to cost Rs 1 lakh or above. This is more than double the price of older vests, which cost Rs 40,000. Police commissioner Amulya Patnaik is closely following the procurements.Police sources say the jackets will comply with the American National Institute of Justice standard , taken into consideration by the world’s top forces. At present, the Delhi Police has roughly 2,500 bullet-resistant jackets across units in difference categories. There has been a long-standing demand from the personnel for additional jackets.According to sources, the level III+ armour also has the ability to resist bullets of .357 bore and soft armour piercing rounds, including 7.62x39mm steel-core bullets used in AK series rifles and 7.62x51mm battle rifle rounds used in sniper rifles.Delhi Police has been trying on these jackets for the past two years. Sources say before procurement, the jackets must clear the test parameters fixed by Bureau of Police Research and Development and the police modernisation division of home ministry.Apart from bullets, the jackets will also be able to stop stabs from Swiss knives or ice-picks. As per the specifications of the level-III armour, these jackets will be made of several layers of Kevlar sheets and metallic plates. It will protect the chest, back, ribs, groin and neck and weigh less than 2.5kg, a standard for all kinds of armour.Explaining the features of the new jackets, an officer said the vests would be abrasion-proof, water- and fireproof and treated for protection against ultraviolet ray exposure. The jackets will also be available in extra large sizes, apart from large and standard.Many of the jackets Delhi Police had till a few years ago were not just outdated but were also heavy, weighing around 11kg a piece, an officer recalled, adding that it was extremely difficult to keep them on for hours. In 2013, a Delhi court had expressed concerns at the city’s ill-equipped policemen after which the force began efforts to procure bulletproof jackets for its top-rank officers, those engaged in patrolling and on law and order duty, and commandos handling riots and terror attacks.The absence of bulletproof jackets, or their poor quality, has been the bane of Indian police forces for long. While top Mumbai policeman Hemant Karkare was a victim during 26/11, Delhi cop Mohan Chand Sharma was shot during the 2008 Batla House encounter.

Title: Lucknow freezing at 0.7 degree Celsius; second coldest December in 67 years
Content:
In Lucknow, Wednesday will be partly cloudy with little chances of rainfall. (File photo)

LUCKNOW: Amid an intensifying cold wave, the minimum temperature in the city touched 0.7 degree Celsius, seven notches below normal, making Tuesday the second-most coldest December day in 67 years, precisely since 1952 when the UP Met office was set up in the state capital.Lucknow had recorded the same minimum temperature on December 29, 2012, which makes Tuesday’s reading a new seven-year low. An all-time December low of 0.5 degree Celsius was recorded on 30th of the month in 1973. The current minimum in the city is lower than Shimla (1.2°C), Jammu (2.4°C), Nainital (3°C) and Dehradun (3.1°C). Lucknow is also the third coldest place in the plains of the country after Kanpur (0°C) and Bahraich (0.2°C).A clear night sky allowed ground heat to escape, dragging the mercury down to almost freezing levels, which in Met parlance is a ‘severe cold wave’ condition. The chill led to formation of dense fog in the morning, taking visibility below 25 metre at 8.30am at the state Met headquarters.The fog cleared by 11am and the sun shone bright. As a result, in comparison to Monday’s 12.3 degrees Celsius, the maximum temperature on Tuesday rose to 16.4 degrees Celsius, but it was still five units below normal, which is termed a ‘cold day’. In contrast to temperatures recorded at Amausi on the outskirts, the maximum reading at Lucknow University in the heart of the city was 13.8.The weather is expected to change on the first day of 2020. A western disturbance (WD) that hit the Himalayas on Tuesday will cut off the flow of the North Wind from snow-clad mountains of Himachal Pradesh. The icy winds will be replaced with comparatively warm and moist easterlies from the Bay of Bengal. “Temperatures may also rise by a couple of degrees. However, the WD will cause snow fall in the hills and rain in UP from Wednesday till Sunday,” said state Met director JP Gupta.In Lucknow, Wednesday will be partly cloudy with little chances of rainfall. Probability of showers on Thursday, Friday and Saturday is more. The rainfall activity will decline on Sunday. Icy winds and fog will return next week.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Two years to assembly polls, 2020 brings new challenges for CM Yogi Adityanath
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

UP CM Yogi Adityanath

LUCKNOW: With the BJP losing yet another Hindi heartland state, having ceded Jharkhand to JMM-Congress combine, the new year brings new challenges for UP CM Yogi Adityanath who has to now steer the state towards the 2022 Assembly elections.

With the state occupying nearly eight per cent of the geographical area and housing 17 per cent population of the country, and with the prime minister and defence minister apart from the highest number of party MPs – 63 – from here, the responsibility on Yogi’s shoulders to perform is heavier than perhaps any other state. As state polls inch closer, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has plans to increase his footprint in UP, having already attended two programmes — in Kanpur and Lucknow — and is likely to be here twice in January and then in February.

In January, PM is expected to lay the foundation for the Rs 15,000-crore Bundelkhand Expressway and then attend the Defence Expo in February. He is also expected to inaugurate a cancer hospital in January. Year 2020 is crucial for the Yogi government as it will be hurtling to complete the programmes and projects launched by it in the last three years.

To meet this challenge, the chief minister has put development agenda on fast track by approving 21 new medical colleges, three conventional universities, police and forensic law university, sports and Ayush University, the ambitious defence corridor and the Kanpur Metro . The state government has passed the second supplementary budget in its last assembly session and released over Rs 1,000 crore for expressways only reiterating its commitment to consolidating infrastructure projects.

As the government is aggressively pursuing its development agenda, it faces a political challenge from within with a number of MLAs protesting against their own government in the state assembly last week.

Opposition too, mainly SP and Congress, are upping the ante and gearing up against the BJP government for 2022 polls.

Title: Four more arrested for Hathikhana rioting
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Police step up vigil in the area after the December 20 violence

VADODARA: The detection of crime branch (DCB) arrested four more persons on Tuesday in connection with the rioting that broke out in Hathikhana area on December 20.

The police said that all the four are prime accused and had planned violent protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). The cops had been searching for the accused over last two weeks and had made different teams to track them down. They were arrested from Ahmedabad, Bhavnagar and Godhra. “The four were part of the plan hatched to create trouble in Hathikhana area. They were involved in rioting and instigating the mobs too,” said Jaydeepsinh Jadeja, DCP (crime).

The police said that all the accused have offences registered against them. While 28-year-old Shahrukh Pathan, 36-year-old Sabir Sheikh and 34-year-old Waseem Sheikh were booked for assault by Panigate police in January this year, Javed Pathan was arrested for rioting by the city police in 2017.

The police said that the key accused had planned to create trouble during a rally to protest against CAA in the city. But since the cops didn’t give permission to the rally, they instigated the Hathikhana residents on December 20. The accused, who were arrested earlier, also include a man from West Bengal who settled in the city 20 years ago.

Three cops were injured and several vehicles damaged when rioting broke out in Hathikhana on December 20 over videography being done by the cops. The police had to fire two rounds and lob 30 teargas shells to disperse the rioters who pelted stones at them. The crime branch also seized weapons including swords and daggers from one of the accused in the riots.

The police later identified the accused from the CCTVs installed in the area and formed several teams to nab them. Some of the accused were arrested from a plush flat in Tandalja where they were hiding after the riots.

Title: Exams for sports quota students from Jan 4: SUK
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kolhapur: Students of the Shivaji University, Kolhapur ( SUK ) who were busy in athletic activities during the early academic year will get a chance to appear for semester exams from January 4.

The varsity had issued a circular regarding the same on December 27.

An official from the SUK’s exam department said, “October and November witness a number of athletic competitions. The players who participate in these competition are often busy with preparations due to which they miss their semester examinations. Hence, the initiative will give such students a chance to appear for exams they missed. These exams have a different schedule than that of the regular students.”

The official further said that the respective exam centres from the division have been asked to conduct the exams of such students as per the examination department norms. The department has attached the schedule (in the circular) and examination centre for these students where they can appear for the exams. Students can use the hall tickets that they were given for October/November semester exams.

The exam centres for these students have been already finalised according to their courses. The centres have been decided with respect to the number of students appearing for the said exams.

“For Kolhapur district, city-based New College will host the said exam. For Sangli, Shrimati Kasturbai Walchand College will host the exam, followed by Lal Bahadur Shastri College in Satara,” the circular read.

The varsity’s winter semester examination commenced in October earlier this year and is in the final stage. In fact, the results of most exams are already out. SUK officials said that the admission process of most courses got delayed due to floods in August.

Title: Coimbatore: Father-son duo on police radar for Rs 4.25 crore fraud
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The rural police are on the lookout for a Vadavalli-based father-son duo, who cheated two businessmen of Rs 4.25 crore by promising to arrange loans.

Police identified them as Thangavel, a realtor and his son Praveen, a moneylender, of Thondamuthur Road at Vadavalli . “A Bengaluru-based businessman had approached them a few months ago seeking Rs 100 crore loan to expand his business. The duo promised to arrange the money and demanded Rs 1.25 crore as processing fee. The businessman gave them the money in several instalments. But they went missing two weeks ago,” a police officer said.

A Kerala-based businessman had also filed a complaint against the duo with the Vadavalli police last week. “He had also approached Thangavel and Praveen for Rs 100 crore loan and gave them Rs 3 crore as processing fee,” the officer added.

Thangavel and Praveen have filed petition before the Madras high court seeking anticipatory bail, a police officer said. “The Vadavalli police have filed a counter petition and requested the court not to grant them bail. Most of our personnel are deployed at the vote counting centres in the district. After the election result is announced, police teams will trace their whereabouts.”

The father-son duo had cheated several businessmen in Kerala and Bengaluru, the officer said. “Those who were cheated by them should approach the Vadavalli police.”

Title: Delay in water tax bills irks citizens
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kolhapur: The delay in receiving water tax bills has irked citizens who have complained that they have not received bills for the past two months. Some have complained that they have received a combined bill of previous two months along with the current ones.

, citizens are getting the water tax bills late owing to technical issues related to spot billing machines.

The water supply department of the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) said that there is delay in issuing bills is owing to some technical glitch.

A senior official of water supply department said, “Citizens said that the inflated water tax bills have been issued to them which may be right as the bi-monthly bills for some of them were not issued in time and the cumulative bill has been issued to them. Some are claiming that the fine amount has been included in the bills issued which were delayed earlier. In such cases, we will correct the bills at the time of payment. We have reported issues with over 20 spot billing machines. The printers of some machines are not working properly. We have to cover over 90,000 connections in two months and, with the shortage of machines, the delays may occur.”

The civic body has a total of 60 spot billing machines. A civic official said that the KMC is procuring 25 spot billing machines in addition to the existing 60 that will help cover the delays in issuing of water tax bills. Spot billing technique aims to speed up the process of issuing these bills, especially on a monthly basis. However, the purpose has not yet been served.

“We have now introduced spot collection in some localities so that the residents do not have to rush to the CFC’s every time for paying bills. They now can pay the bills digitally. The meter readers have to do both the tasks — note down the reading for issuing bills on the spot and collect the bill amount,” added the official.

Title: Youth held for 22-year-old’s murder
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kolhapur: The Jaysingpur police have arrested a 19-year-old youth for allegedly murdering a 22-year-old man near a petrol pump in the Chipari village on Sunday night.

The incident has been registered with Jaysingpur police station. The suspect has been identified as Krishna Ramesh Bhojane, a resident of Jaysingpur in Shirol taluka. He was produced in a local court and remanded to four-day police custody.

The deceased, Amir Ibrahim Nadaf, was a resident of Kadage Mala in Shirol taluka.

Title: 58 IPS officers transferred; 12 in Kolkata Police
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: The Mamata Banerjee government on Tuesday made one of its biggest year-end IPS transfers, shuffling 58 senior officers, 12 among them in Kolkata.

Asansol-Durgapur police commissioner Devendra Prakash Singh returned to Kolkata Police as its additional commissioner. V Solomon Nesa Kumar will head the Special Task Force ( STF ) as its joint commissioner. Subhankar Sinha Sarkar, joint CP (STF), will now be the joint CP (headquarters). Santosh Pandey, DCP (traffic), has been promoted as the joint CP (traffic). Akhilesh Kumar Chaturvedi will be the joint CP (armed police) and Ashesh Biswas, Seladah police superintendent, has been promoted as the joint CP (administration).

Debasmita Das will now be the DCP (south east division), while Ajoy Prasad will be DCP (eastern suburban division). Joyeeta Bose, Rupesh Kumar, Biswajit Ghosh and Gaurav Lal will be DCP (north), DCP (traffic), DCP (south west division) and DCP (east division), respectively.
