Kunal Agarwal, DCP (HQ) of Bidhannagar Police has been promoted as a joint commissioner; Dhrubajyoti De, DCP (headquarters) of Barrackpore police has also been promoted as a joint commissioner. A total of 32 senior officers in the transfer list of 58 have been promoted.

The other key transfers include that of Sanjay Singh, who took charge as the ADG (western zone) and Rajeev Mishra as ADG (south Bengal). Sukesh Kumar Jain, DIG (Midnapore range), will now be the Asansol-Durgapur police commissioner. Praveen Kumar Tripathi will leave Kolkata Police after a long stint to take charge as the DIG (presidency range) which will now include the Baruipur, Diamond Harbour, Sunderbans and Howrah (rural) police districts.

The state CID will have a new IGP — Bastab Baidya. While Mitesh Jain will be the DIG (cyber crime), Nilanjan Biswas will be CID’s new special superintendent and Anoop Jaiswal the DIG (CID-special). Sheesh Ram Jhajharia has been made the new DIG of Railway police. Awadesh Pathak will be the new SRP (Kharagpur); Bandana Varun Chandra Sekhar will be the SRP (Sealdah).

Several new police superintendents are set to take charge in the new year state-wide. While Debarshi Dutta will be the new South Dinajpur police superintendent, Ajeet Singh Yadav and Abhishek Gupta will be police superintendents of Murshidabad and Jangipur, respectively.

Title: Cops to seek compensation for damage from rioters
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Vadodara: The police is likely to seek compensation from the rioters who damaged their vehicles in Hathikhana area of the city on December 20. Dozens of rioters had resorted to stone pelting in Mahavat lane and even attacked the cops. Four police vehicles parked in the area were damages during the violence.

“The damages were to tune of Rs 40,000 as the vehicle’s windshields were broken due to stone pelting. The assessment of damages was done by our team. We will now take up the process to recover the compensation from the key persons accused in the rioting,” said Jaydeepsinh Jadeja, DCP (crime). The cops are trying to ascertain the process of recovery and they will also write to the state government.

“We didn’t suffer much damages but the plan to seek compensation is to put pressure on the rioters and send them a message that they won’t get away if they damage public property,” said a police official. Though the police have booked dozens of men in the rioting case, compensation will be sought from eight to 10 key accused.

The cops seem to have taken a cue from the Uttar Pradesh government that has decided to seal the properties of those involved in damaging public property during riots against the CAA.

Title: CAA Protest in Delhi: Here’s why Delhi cops need reinforcements
Content:
Delhi Police is estimated to have around 52,000 shields, 85,000 ballistic helmets with visors, 38,000 polycar... Read More

NEW DELHI: Over 300 policemen were injured in the violent protests against the new citizenship law in the capital some days ago. Most of them were not wearing anti-riot gear and those donning old body armour returned home with injuries. The paramilitary forces and the frontline of Delhi Police , protected by proper gear, saved the day on these occasions.The Indian capital, where around 15,000 protests and demonstrations take place every year, seems to have a police force that is ill equipped to handle violent mobs. Riot police in western countries are not only dressed in modern full-body protection, but also have advance equipment to disperse large crowd. Many forces use long range acoustic devices or sound cannons that produce a high-pitch sound causing excruciating pain in the ears, tasers that paralyse people with electricity for a few seconds and flash bangs that blind protesters for some time.While Delhi Police has discarded wooden sticks for polycarbonate canes and shields, it still makes do with outdated body protectors and helmets and basic knee and elbow pads. Delhi Police is estimated to have around 52,000 shields, 85,000 ballistic helmets with visors, 38,000 polycarbonate canes and 41,000 old body protectors.The cops have been contemplating the purchase of advanced riot control tools, but have been unable to experiment with modern equipment because almost all major protests have taken place in habited areas. Delhi Police was planning to buy five sound cannon guns in 2013, but the plan never took off. They got a few for trials, but have not used them, according to officers.“During the protests in Jamia Millia Islamia, there were occasions when some subordinates suggested the use of flash bangs, sound cannons or other devices when the situation seemed to be spinning out of control. However, we desisted from using them because it was a residential area and it was night time,” said a senior officer.Police say that most policemen are injured when protesters throw stones at them. Even though the cops are provided ballistic helmets, most of them are not designed to take the impact of heavy stones. They only protect the face and head from close range attacks with sticks or batons.According to policemen, a bulk of the body protectors used by Delhi Police is archaic and of little help when attacked on the sides. “Moreover they are bulky to wear and impedes chases after protesters,” said an officer who was injured in one of the riots last week. “In most cases, a policeman who gets attacked either falls back due to the weight of the jacket or loses his balance and falls down.”Officers feel the procurement of advanced full-body protectors should be expedited. Last year, Delhi Police procured 1,500 such protectors, all of the type worn by forces in the West. Alongside the old inventory of 960, the cops now have 2,460 protectors, which is roughly just around a quarter of the total requirement.The advanced kit, which has a strong shock-absorbing capacity, is divided into eight parts. While a specially designed vest guards the chest, other protection include elbow pads, guards for the shin, upper arm, groin and thigh and shoulder pads for all-round protection.Last year, Delhi Police also procured around 800 new, differently designed barricades. The side facing the protesters has a plain and slippery surface, while the other side has provisions for policemen to stand on it to interact with or watch the protesters. These barricades are designed to prevent anyone from scale it except from the side the policemen are standing on. To prevent any hand grip on the barriers, they are fitted with a thick wire mesh.

Title: 2019 report: Cops successfully keep attempt to murder cases in check
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Aurangabad: Of the many serious and trivial offences that have been committed in the city in 2019, there has been a slight dip in the cases of attempt to murder, mobile thefts and attack on government employees.

As per data compiled till November this year from police stations across the city, 42 of the 43 cases of attempt to murder have been detected this year. In all of 2018, 74 cases of attempt to murder were registered of which 72 had been detected.

With respect to cases of attack on government employees, while 73 cases were registered and detected in 2018, the number of cases registered and solved nosedived to 59 cases in 2019.

Commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad said that upkeeping the peace and communal harmony in the city was one of the biggest achievements of the city police in 2019.

Citing that the cases like the Koregaon Bhima violence, garbage-related riots and Rajabazar violence had signed the city, Prasad said, “The number of body offences, especially attempt to murder cases, has dropped significantly. The drop can be solely attributed to how the police effectively carried out preventive action against miscreants and suspicious elements.”

While preventive action under the Maharashtra Police Act and the Criminal Procedure Code was taken against 3,232 people in 2018, 4,499 such actions were inititated in 2019.

Different types of property offences have continued to remain a concern for the police, though there has been a slight dip in the number of mobile thefts in 2019. As against the 35 of the 202 mobile thefts detected in 2018, 32 of the 138 such cases have been detected till November 2019. With respect to vehicle thefts, of the 165 of the 743 cases detected in 2018, 200 of the 836 cases were detected till November 2019.

DCP Nikesh Khatmode Patil said that serious offences like murder, attempt to murder, dacoity, etc have increased by 265 cases till November 2019 compared to 2018.

Patil said that there has been a dip in the number of serious offences in the last two months of 2019 as police arrested bag lifters, bike thieves, chain snatchers and highway robbers.

There was also a surge in chain snatching cases in 2019. While 13 of the 44 cases were detected till November, 10 of the 22 such cases were detected in 2018.

With respect to rape cases, while 76 cases were registered and detected in 2018, 76 of 78 such cases were detected in 2019.

Title: I-T follows the Dishman money
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The I-T department had carried out a major search-and-survey operation on multiple premises held by the pharma... Read More

AHMEDABAD: Following a search-and-survey operation on Dishman Carbogen Amcis Ltd earlier this month, the state income tax (I-T) department has claimed to have found a trail of unaccounted for cash of more than Rs 160 crore. The total cash trail in the case is Rs 327 crore.

The I-T department had carried out a major search-and-survey operation on multiple premises held by the pharma company on December 19. The teams had found and seized valuables worth Rs 1.39 crore including Rs 64.47 lakh in cash and Rs 42 lakh in 16 foreign currencies. The investigators are yet to disclose the details of seizures from 24 lockers.

“The senior management and record keepers of the firm have admitted to dealing in accommodation entries for unaccounted for cash of the group,” said an official aware of the developments. He said that a chartered accountancy firm in Ahmedabad is also under the scanner. “The department has collected evidence of bogus loans and advances, purchase transactions, sales commissions, and capital expenditure,” he said.

Officials said that the investigation so far has revealed net receipts of Rs 600 crore, loan advances given at Rs 700 crore, bogus purchases and sales worth Rs 50 crore, and bogus income and sales commissions worth Rs 90 crore. “No evidence of rendering services could be found to justify the receipts,” said the official.

Sources added that forged transactions and property dealings could connect the company’s finances to a previous case in which two entry operators from the city were found to be providing their services to various city firms. “The concept of base erosion and profit shifting have also been found in the case,” said the official. “About 90% of sales by the city-based company is in the form of exports and of the total exports, 80% was to their own enterprises.” The official said that of the goodwill of Rs 1,326 crore that the company had shown at the time of the merger, it has claimed Rs 900 crore.

Title: Citizens mark New Year amid security
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kolhapur: Citizens welcomed New Year 2020 with great enthusiasm and fervour amid tight security. Police had beefed up their presence in the city, including major market areas, malls, restaurants and national highways, to ensure peaceful celebrations.

Hotels, lawns and resorts in the city were decked up with an array of entertainment activities lined up for the merrymakers. They offered various deals and discounts to attract revellers.

Taking into account the situation and possibility of crowd on city roads during the night, police had increased their presence since the morning of December 31.

“Police have been deployed at various spots including gardens, open grounds and other sensitive areas in the city. The entire police staff is on-duty and different teams have been formed to take action against law breakers and rule violators,” a senior police officer said.

“The emphasis was laid on driving under influence (DUI), rash driving and violating traffic rules on New Year’s Eve. Police teams were deployed at all major chowks and roads connecting bars and hotels in the city,” he added.

Title: Couple dupes man of Rs 18.35L
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kolhapur: Juna Rajwada police have booked a couple for allegedly cheating a 39-year-old man to the tune of Rs 18.35 lakh on the pretext of offering him a government job.

A complaint in this regard was lodged by Ankush Tulshiram Aundhkar (39) of Sahyadri Nagar, Badlapur.

“In January 2014, the victim had come to Kolhapur for some work. At the time, he came in contact with the husband-wife duo. The suspect told him that he works in the Mantralaya in Mumbai and does the work of completing and sanctioning various government projects. He told Aundhkar that the government has published an advertisement for recruitment of officers in the state excise department. He told the suspect that he has close contacts with senior officers in the said department and that he can get Aundhkar recruited. However, Aundhkar would have to pay money for the same,” said a police officer attached with the Juna Rajwada police station, adding that the victim paid Rs 18.35 lakh in instalments.

Title: Gold jewellery cluster may start operations on Vysial Street in August
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The proposed Coimbatore Gold Jewellery Cluster , which will have the latest machinery and infrastructure for jewellery making, is in the final stages of approval.

The state government is expected to give approval in the first week of January, managing director of the cluster S M Kamalhasan said. “The Centre is expected to approve it in two months. The facility is expected to be operational in August ,” he added.

The project is undertaken by micro and small goldsmiths and jewellery makers in the city. They have been working to form a facility that will have cutting-edge technology and facilities for jewellery making for the last two years. They hope that the cluster would equip them to compete with big players.

The total project cost will be Rs 15.3crore, Kamalhasan said. “Of this, the company has put in Rs 1.5crore for the land and Rs 1crore for the building. Through the scheme for setting up industrial clusters, the state government will contribute 10% of the project cost and the Centre will put in 80% of the total project budget and this would cover the machinery cost,” he said.

Of the 6,000 members in the company, 60 have made major investment in the cluster, Kamalhasan said. “The facility will come up on a seven-cent plot on Vysial Street in the city where there is a high concentration of micro gold smithies. The cluster will focus on jobwork for micro and small jewel manufacturers. They can use the machinery for production. Over the last decade, micro and small players were losing out to corporates. The facility will help them produce designs on par with the big players.”

Over the last five years, the number of small smithies in the city had reduced by half due to competition and now only 50,000 remain, the official added.

Title: Tourists flock to hill stations in Uttarakhand on New Year’s Eve
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Majority of the hotels, resorts and guest houses in hill stations like Mussoorie, Mukteshwar, Auli, and Chakra... Read More

DEHRADUN: With cold conditions intensifying in Uttarakhand and the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) predicting snowfall and rain spells from January 1, revellers flocked to popular tourist destinations across the state on Tuesday to welcome the New Year.

Majority of the hotels, resorts and guest houses in hill stations like Mussoorie, Mukteshwar, Auli, and Chakrata remained packed to capacity on Tuesday night.

Devendra Belwal, a hotelier from Dhanaulti, told TOI, “There is a heavy tourist rush in the town and hotels are reporting around 90% occupancy. Hotels in Kanatal (another hill resort located 16 km away from Dhanaulti) also witnessed around 80% occupancy.”

Similarly, the ski town of Auli, which had witnessed good snowfall in December, remained choc-a-bloc with tourists who wanted to usher in the New Year amidst a blanket of snow. According to an estimate, over 5000 tourists reached Auli to celebrate New Year and all the hotels and guest houses in the town remained full on New Year's Eve.

In Kumaon, Corbett Tiger Reserve and Ramnagar witnessed a similar tourist rush. “Most of the hotels in our area had around 90% occupancy. We hope to recover the losses we suffered due to anti-CAA protests,” said Hari Mann, president of Ramnagar hotel association.

Even the hotels in Binsar and Mukteshwar in upper Kumaon reported more than 70-80% occupancy. "Tourists have started coming to the state after the news that snowfall is expected around New Year," said Anil Kumar , a hotelier.

Hotels and home stays at Harsil, Dharali, Raithal, Barsu, Sankri, and at many other high-altitude areas of Uttarkashi district also remained packed with tourists.

Chain Singh Rawat, a hotelier from Sankri village, told TOI, "This year, Uttarkashi region received early and heavy snowfall as compared to previous years. Consequently, we saw many tourists coming here to celebrate New Year."

Meanwhile, Nainital town remained an exception with tourist arrivals below expectations which hoteliers of the area attributed to the fallout of the CAA and NRC protests.

Title: UP govt selects 5 alternative plots for Ayodhya mosque
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

File photo

LUCKNOW: The UP government has identified plots of land outside the periphery of the “panchkosi parikrama” to be offered to the Sunni Waqf Board as an alternative site for a mosque as mandated by the Supreme Court in its verdict in the Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid case.

“Panchkosi parikrama” is the 15-km-long circular route taken by devotees within Ayodhya to pay obeisance.

Top government sources told TOI that as many as five potential sites close to highways passing by Ayodhya have been identified and sent to the Union home ministry for clearance.

Plots have been identified on the Ayodhya-Faizabad Road, Ayodhya- Basti Road, Ayodhya-Sultanpur Road, Ayodhya-Gorakhour Road, along with one more spot.

Sources said land has been identified beyond the “panchkosi parikrama” periphery so that devotees are not inconvenienced when Muslim and Hindu festivals are held simultaneously. Sources also said a mosque closer to highway will ensure easy access to Muslims.

Most part of the temple town, with a major portion of its population, is situated within the “panchkosi parikrama” route.

On November 9, the Supreme Court had asked for allocation of five acres of land to Muslims to build a mosque as a compensation for the Babri Masjid . While the Sunni Waqf Board is yet to decide on whether to accept the alternative land, other Muslim parties have openly rejected the offer.

Title: Shiv Sena MP and BJP MLA booked for attempt to murder in Maharashtra
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The rivalry between the Shiv Sena and the BJP has surfaced during the on-going elections for Kalamb panchayat in Osmanabad district as both Sena MP Omraje Nimbalkar and BJP MLA Rana Jagjitsinh Patil have been booked for attempt to murder in a cross complaint registered against each other.

Nimbalkar is Lok Sabha member from Osmanabad and Patil is the MLA from Tuljapur seat in Osmanabad.

“As per the complaints registered with us, the supporters of Nimbalkar brought three BJP panchayat members to Solapur on Monday. Patil followed them with his supporters and the activists of both parties had quarrelled with each other. A Shiv Sena activist lodged complaint against Patil stating that he threatened the Nimbalkar’s supporters with revolver,” said a police officer attached with Akluj police station.

“Following this a case was registered against Patil and ten supporters under section 307 of IPC,” he said.

“Later, the supporters of Patil lodged complaint against Nimbalkar and based on the complaint, Nimbalkar and three others were booked under section 307 of IPC,” he said.

Title: Three ministers to bring development to district
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Kolhapur: The three ministers — one each from Congress and NCP and an independent — from Kolhapur district are expected to boost the chances of the Congress and NCP in the local elections in 2020. The three ministers from three different parts of the district will bring overall development, locals said.

Senior NCP minister Hasan Mushrif , a Sharad Pawar loyalist, has made it to the state cabinet once again and will most likely get to be the district guardian minister too. A prominent Muslim face of the party, he has significant clout in the district through the sugar mills and the cooperative bank.

Political observers said Mushrif’s unbending loyalty with the NCP chief and his ability to subvert anti-incumbency has made him a formidable force in the loal politics.

Congress MLC Satej Patil has returned to the cabinet as minister of state. He held the same position in the 2009 democratic front government and handled the key home department. Though he belongs to the dominant D Y Patil family, he faced defeat in 2014 assembly constituency.

Over the past five years, he worked hard and stitched some unique alliances to ensure Congress win in the recent assembly polls. In 2014, the Congress was totally wiped out from the district; however, in 2019, Congress won four seats. Considering his contribution to the party win, he was hoping to be appointed a cabinet minister this time around. However, the MVA has decided not to appoint two cabinet ministers from one district.

Inclusion of independent MLA from Shirol, Rajendra Patil-Yadravkar , came as a surprise to even the Shiv Sena activists. He has won from a constituency that is considered a Shiv Sena and Swabhimani Shetkari Sanghatana chief Raju Shetti’s home turf.

Yadravkar has sought a nomination from NCP but after the results, announced his support to Shiv Sena. He is known to be close to Sharad Pawar.

Political observers said his inclusion was a bid to tame Shetti, who was not even invited for the cabinet expansion ceremony despite being an ally of Congress-NCP. Locals said Yadravkar would help Shiv Sena build its base in Shirol and nearby constituencies.

Title: EDM deaths: Goencho Avaaz slams Sawant
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Panaji: Goencho Avaaz has blamed the government for the death of three young men at Electronic Dance Music ( EDM ) festival Sunburn . The whole country is now looking at Goa as some sort of a drug haven, the organisation said.

Founding member of Goencho Avaaz Viriato Fernandes came down strongly on chief minister Pramod Sawant stating that he chose give more importance to the revenue that will be generation from the festival that is widely suspected to be drug related rather than maintaining the law and order.

He also criticised tourism minister Manohar Ajgaonkar for taking part in the festival and giving it official patronage and stated that Goencho Avaaz will organise a massive awareness drive to highlight the failure of the minister and government on this front.

Title: Curbs extended in Ayodhya third time
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Now, prohibitory orders have again been extended till February 25 in Ayodhya. (ANI File Photo)

AYODHYA : After terror intercepts by intelligence agencies and apprehension of violent protests against the citizenship law and NPR, the Ayodhya district administration extended prohibitory orders in Ayodhya for the third time this year on Tuesday.

Curbs were put in place before Diwali and extended before the Supreme Court verdict on Ayodhya, when the temple town was turned into a fortress. Now, prohibitory orders have again been extended till February 25.

In a tweet, Ayodhya district magistrate Anuj Kumar Jha said prohibitory orders were being extended in view of intelligence input of a terror strike and protests against CAA and NRC. “Agami samay mein atankwadi gatividhiyon, vibhinn dharmik, rajnaitik karyakramon, pratiyogi/shaikshanik parikshaon tatha CAA-2019 va NRC evam NPR ke virodh ke drishtigat lok/shanti vyavastha evam jansuraksha banaye rakhne ki drishti se sampoorn janpad mein dhara 144 tatkal prabhavi, jo 25/02/20 tak prabhavi rahegi (In view of terrorist activities, various religious and political programmes, competitive/other examinations and protests against CAA, NRC and NPR, existing prohibitory orders in the district will remain effective till February 25 to maintain peace and order),” the DM tweeted.

Talking to TOI, Ayodhya SSP Ashish Tiwari said, “There is always a threat of a terrorist attack. There have been incidents in 1992 (Babri Masjid demolition) 2005 (terrorist attack on Ram Janambhoomi) and 2012 (communal riots in Faizabad ).”

The order warns people against collecting stones or empty bottles on rooftops or holding programmes or meetings that may breach communal harmony.

No person will be allowed to install idols of any god or goddess and electronic media will not be allowed to hold debates without permission. No person will be allowed to hold any programme on the Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid issue, the DM’s order stated.

Title: Gujarat: Class X, XII board exams from March 5 to March 21
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Class X and XII board exams will be conducted from March 5 to March 21 by the Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSHSEB).

The exam committee of the GSHSEB met on Tuesday to finalize the examination schedule, which has been posted on the board’s website. The main exams for Class X are to be held between March 5 and March 16.

The Class XII science stream main papers will be held from March 5 to March 14, while the exams will end on March 16. The Class XII general stream exams will be held from March 5 to March 21. Some 18 lakh students had taken the 2019 board exams which had begun on March 7.

About 17.4 lakh students are expected to participate this year, according to the figures available so far, a GSHSEB official said.

“This is 30,000-40,000 fewer than last year. The decline is due to the number of repeaters and external students, which has fallen,” the official said.

Of the 17.4 lakh students, 11 lakh are in Class X, 1.4 lakh are in Class XII science stream and 5.3 lakh are in Class XII general stream.

The board decided to bar as many as 25 centres where exams were held last year, due to malpractices, sources said.

“Some 41 new centres have been approved. For Class X, of 42 applications for new exam centres, 29 have been cleared. In the case of Class XII science, two new centres of seven have been approved. For Class XII general stream, 10 new centres of 25 applications have been given the green light,” a source said.

Title: Minor fire breaks out in Sampatrao Colony, internet provider’s office gutted
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The office located on the second floor of the building, in which the ground and first floors had residential h... Read More

VADODARA: An office of an internet service providing company at Sampatrao Colony was gutted on Tuesday morning after a short-circuit in the air-conditioner in the office on second floor sparked a fire which soon engulfed the office.

According to fire department sources, the security guard of the building noticed the smoke coming out of the window of the office and alerted the fire brigade.

The office was located on the second floor of the building in which the ground and first floors had residential homes. As the residents learnt about the fire, they quickly evacuated the building. “With no human presence in the building our work had become easy, but thick smoke inside the office made us struggle initially,” said fire officer Digvijaysinh Parmar. He added that the fire was completely doused within 30 minutes.

However, the electronic equipment including computers, LED television and air-conditioners were gutted. “Other office equipment including furniture was destroyed,” Parmar said. “The air-conditioners were probably switched off, but overload in the wiring may have caused the short-circuit,” he added.

Title: Satara residents stage rasta roko for new road
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The residents, led by activist group Banjara Brigade, demanded that the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC)... Read More

AURANGABAD: Residents of Satara and Deolai areas staged a rasta roko on Monday to press for their demand for the construction of an approach road to Satara Tanda.

The residents, led by activist group Banjara Brigade, demanded that the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) construct a 1km road from SRPF camp entrance to the Satara Tanda.

Ravikant Rathod of the Banjara Brigade said that the group had given a memorandum on December 23 to the municipal commissioner to take a decision on the road construction. “We had said that if the municipal commissioner did not take cognisance of our demand, an agitation will be launched on December 30. As the municipal corporation did not make any move, we had to hold the rasta roko stir on Monday,” said Rathod. Several residents including Rohidas Pawar, Sanjay Pawar and Raviraj Rathod of the Banjara Brigade had joined the agitation.

According to Sominath Shirane from the Satara-Deolai Sangharsh Samiti, currently, residents have to use the road which passes through the SRPF camp. “The SRPF has prohibited the entry of four-wheelers and allows only two-wheelers, which has to pass through many check-posts. Residents want an alternate road so that they do not have to go through this inconvenience everyday,” said Shirane.

When asked, AMC engineer Vasant Bhoye squarely put the responsibility of the road cosntruction on the district collector. “In order to make an alternate road, the agricultural lands of the farmers have to be acquired. This can be done through the district collector’s office. In addition, the road construction will have to be done with MLA fund or state government’s help,” said Bhoye.

Shirane said the AMC has imposed taxes on the residents of Satara and Deolai but was not providing any civic amenities. “We as residents are not responsible to follow up with different offices. It is the civic body’s responsibility,” he said.

Title: Imposter arrested for posing as police officer
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: City Chowk police arrested a 55-year-old man on Monday who allegedly posed as an assistant commissioner of police and duped scores of people. Cash, baton used by police, a dummy firearm, a police uniform and a few grams of gold have been recovered from the suspect.

The suspect, Khalil Ibrahim Khan, is a native of Kranti Nagar in Ambejogai tehsil, Beed district. He was produced before a court on Tuesday, which remanded him in police custody. Police have also seized four AADHAR cards, voter identity cards of different states and three passbooks of different banks. A car bearing police’s logo has also been seized. Police have slapped sections 170, 171, 464, 468, 471 and 511 of the IPC on Khan.

Sources said that Khan used to live in Naregaon area of the city. While posing as a policeman there, he had allegedly forced a woman to marry his kin. When clashes started breaking out frequently between the woman and Khan’s kin and the marriage was on the verge of collapse, the woman’s family learnt that Khan was not a cop and that he was allegedly cheating people by posing as a cop. After he was exposed, Khan fled Naregaon area.

On Monday night, a relative of the woman spotted Khan waiting outside the Government Cancer Hospital in a car and immediately alerted police. Following the tip-off, a police team led by assistant inspector Mohsin Sayyed reached the spot and found Khan sitting in his car. They checked his car and found his behaviour suspicious.

API Sayyed said, “We suspect that the accused has reportedly duped innumerable people by posing as a police officer. He had parked his car on the roadside and was probably waiting for a gullible target.”

Title: Political tussle on cards to retain hold on local bodies, cash rich co-ops
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Kolhapur: 2020 is going to be a poll packed year for Kolhapur district as elections to several local bodies and cooperative institutes are slated one after the other. The changed political equations in the state are going to make these contests intriguing.

Most MPs and MLAs, who contested the elections this year, have deep rooted links to the cooperative sector. For the past five years, after BJP came to power, almost all of them struggled to retain their positions in the cooperative institutes. In 2020, the elections for Gokul cooperative dairy and Kolhapur district central cooperative bank are going to take place. Both these institutes are prominent establishments.

The first political fight is going to be the election for Gokul dairy in April. The dairy has a fortnightly turnover of Rs 15 crore and is among the largest cooperative dairies in the region. At present, Mahadevrao Mahadik and Congress MLA P N Patil have their majority members elected over the directorial body of the dairy.

Both are likely to contest the election together while on other hand the leaders of Congress, Nationalist Congress Party and Shiv Sena are going to contest together. In Kolhapur, personal ties have more influence in deciding the political outcome.

The Mahadik family will have to face Congress MLC Satej Patil, who has repeatedly alleged corruption in the functioning of the dairy. Mahadik faced a setback after Patil opposed the proposal to turn Gokul into a multi-state entity. It even caused Mahadik politically. His nephew and sitting MP Dhananjay Mahadik was defeated. Now, Mahadik-P N Patil have got the support of newly elected MLA and former minister Vinay Kore.

According to the close aides of Mahadik, Kore’s entry into Gokul politics is deliberate. “Kore stays aloof from Gokul’s politics as he has his own dairy to look after. We are quite clear that owing to new combinations taking place, especially understanding of traditional rivals and new rivals in the form of Sena leaders, we have to compensate the loss. Kore will help fill the gap. We will get adequate votes to get our panel elected,” said a close of aide of Mahadik, on the request of anonymity.

At the start of the year, election for the post of president and deputy president of Zilla Parishad are going to take place. The new alliance of Cong-NCP and Sena are confident of toppling the dominance of BJP, which is in power with the support of Mahadik.

The results will show the extent of trust between the new alliance of the three parties and secondly if it comes in favour of the three-party alliance it will be a big blow to BJP-Mahadik front. The outcome will set the tenor for the Gokul and district co-operative bank elections.

At the tail end of the year 2020, all the political parties will try hard to gain power in Kolhapur Municipal Corporation. The dominance over the KMC is required especially to provide leadership opportunities to the supporters. At present, Congress and NCP are in power and they have always indirect support of Shiv Sena. The Mahadiks will contest the KMC election as part of BJP and Dhananjay will face direct confrontation from Satej Patil. The Congress has ruled KMC for last ten years.

A close of Patil said, “We have power in the state and we will be able to bring in funds to carry out development works in the city. The KMC is cash strapped. Politically, the KMC is important as it’s jurisdiction lies both Kolhapur North and Kolhapur South assembly segments.”

Title: Congress, GFP call for special investigation team
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Panaji: The death of a third person at Sunburn Klassique evoked a sharp reaction from Congress and GFP , with both parties alleging that the three persons died after consuming drugs .

GFP and Congress demanded an inquiry into the three deaths after alleging that tourism minister Manohar Ajgaonkar and chief minister Pramod Sawant were “personally responsible for the deaths”.

Congress called for a special investigation team, headed by a retired high court judge, to be constituted to probe the deaths. “This is another case of suspected drug abuse. We asked the state government to take precautions, but the police did not,” said state Mahila Congress president Pratima Coutinho. Coutinho also criticised Ajgaonkar for dancing at Sunburn Klassique, despite three people dying at the event.

Congress media cell convener Trajano D’Mello said that drugs were flourishing in the state, with the drug trade emerging as the “funding machine of the BJP”.

“Goa’s decline as a prime tourist destination is not only because of the government’s pathetic gutlessness to stop nefarious activities, but also due to its paucity of ideas, incompetence, and its myopic vision of tourism as nothing more than tripping out at a rave party,” said GFP vice-president Durgadas Kamat.

Goa police has registered all three cases as unnatural death. “Considering there is a move to hush up the matter, the chief minister should set up an SIT headed by a retired high court judge within eight days. If he does not do this, then we have to take it that the chief minister has a hand in these deaths,” said D’Mello.

Title: Tally bills with works carried out on ground: Civic chief
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Aurangabad: Municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey has instructed officials to verify the bills produced by the civil contractors by visiting the spots where the civic works are being carried out.

While visiting zone-7 as part of his city-wide inspection on Tuesday, Pandey reminded officers, especially the city engineer and ward engineers, to verify whether the civil works, for which contractors were producing bills, were carried out properly.

Around 200 contractors had ended their 68-day agitation on December 19 after Pandey assured them that AMC would start clearing their dues from January 15th. These contractors have submitted bills ranging from Rs 5 lakh to Rs 3 crore for civil works like water pipeline, drainage line and road construction.

Pandey has asked the civic officials to submit reports of tallying the bills with the civil works before January 15.

Pandey started the visit from Trimurti Colony and covered Vishwabharti Colony, Ulka Nagari, Shanti Niketan Colony and other areas in zone 7 over nearly two hours.

During his tour, Pandey asked all the officials accompanying him to ensure they have the Swachhata app installed on their phones and that they were using it to address complaints of citizens. Notably, the download and use of Swachhata app is a criterion for Swachh Survekshan 2020. Later in the day, Pandey held a meeting of all the staffers of the municipal corporation and asked them to use the app and ensure maximum participation from citizens.

He lauded an elderly couple in the Vishwabharti colony for giving segregated waste diligently to the waste collection vehicle.

Title: Slow demand leaves dealers with Bharat Stage-IV inventory pile-up
Content:
Several two-wheeler dealers are unable to stock up on BS-VI compliant vehicles because of financial crisis, as... Read More

AHMEDABAD: With vehicle demand taking a hit in the automobile sector, two-wheeler dealers are struggling to sell off their Bharat Stage (BS)-IV inventories. According to the Supreme Court order last year, the sales of BS-IV compliant vehicles will be completely stopped from April 1, 2020. Since the automobile demand, especially that for two-wheelers, has taken a massive hit, dealers are struggling with inventory pile-ups.According to data by Union ministry of road transport and highways, the number of two-wheelers registered from December 1 to December 30 this year has gone down by 44.5% against last year. “Two-wheeler dealers are offering massive discounts on all the BS-IV models and yet, the inventory continued to remain piled up. At present, most dealers have inventory worth two and a half months. After sales faring well in October during the Navratri-Diwali season, November and December saw a steep drop in sales,” said Pranav Shah, director, Federation of Automobile Dealers’ Association (FADA) – Gujarat .Overall weakened consumer confidence added to slowing demand in the automobile sector. “With businesses in several sectors going slow, consumer confidence has weakened. While December sales are usually in slow gear, this time around the de-growth is phenomenally high as we hardly see customers walking into our showrooms. The situation does not look promising going forward because the BS-VI compliant models will be priced high by at least Rs 10,000 across all the models,” said Rajesh Patel, a city-based two-wheeler dealer.Several two-wheeler dealers are unable to stock up on BS-VI compliant vehicles because of financial crisis, as many of them have exhausted their borrowing capacity. “Most of the dealers have exhausted their financial limit with borrowings for BS-IV compliant vehicles. Thus, most of them are unable to borrow further for a BS-VI inventory. Moreover, several manufacturers are yet to release BS-VI compliant models, many of which will be available at dealerships by January first week,” Shah said.

Title: Labour office steno caught with Rs 28,000 bribe
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Vadsari Kumaran Suresh

VADODARA: A stenographer of labour commissioner’s office was arrested by anti-corruption bureau (ACB) on Tuesday for taking a bribe of Rs 28,000 for granting labour license.

An employee of a company which had applied for labour license had approached the ACB when the accused Vadsari Kumaran Suresh asked for the bribe to move the application forward. ACB officials said that as the company complained against Suresh through their employee.

On receiving the complaint, ACB sleuths laid a trap and asked the complainant to agree to Suresh’s demand. Suresh asked him to come to his office at Navapura on Tuesday afternoon with the cash. As soon as the phenolphthalein powder-laced cash was accepted by Suresh, ACB officials caught him red-handed with the amount in his office.

Title: Delhi: Metro station as tall as a 7-floor building
Content:
Construction work after the inauguration of Phase IV of Delhi Metro in New Delhi on Monday. (Photo: PTI)

NEW DELHI: With the much awaited Phase IV, Delhi Metro will reach a new height. Haiderpur Badli Mor , where the construction work of Phase IV started on Monday, will be the tallest metro station with platforms at a height of 23.5 metres — as high as a seven-storey building . The station is expected to be completed by mid-2022.The station will be part of the 28.9km Janakpuri West-RK Ashram Marg corridor, an extension of Magenta Line (Botanical Garden-Janakpuri West). On Monday, the piling work started for the station as part of Phase IV’s first civil contract, which was awarded in November for the construction of a portion of the corridor. The entire corridor will have 22 stations.Currently, Mayur Vihar Phase I station on Pink Line (Majlis Park-Shiv Vihar) holds the title of Delhi Metro’s tallest station with platforms located at a height of 22 metres. The Pink Line viaduct is constructed above the older Blue Line (Dwarka-Noida Electronic City/Vaishali). Previously, it was another station on Pink Line — Karkardooma — that was the tallest station at a height of 20 metres. Pink Line also has the highest point on the Delhi Metro network — 23.6 metres — at Dhaula Kuan where it crosses above the Airport Express line.“The platforms of Haiderpur Badli Mor, which will come up above the Phase III Yellow Line (Samaypur Badli-HUDA City Centre) station, will have the highest ever platform in Delhi Metro,” said Anuj Dayal, executive director, corporate communications, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC). “At Haiderpur Badli Mor, the viaduct will also cross the existing Yellow Line viaduct at a considerable height,” he said.“During the construction, we will ensure that services on Yellow Line are not impacted at all. Elaborate monitoring equipment, including high-capacity cameras, will be installed to monitor the construction work above Yellow Line,” Dayal said. “The progress of this work will be centrally monitored by DMRC’s engineers,” he added.Partial work for Haiderpur Badli Mor, which is going to be an interchange station, was completed along with the construction of the Phase III Yellow Line station. “Provisions were kept for the Phase III station’s expansion as an interchange facility in Phase IV. This will help in substantially reducing construction time as well as costs in Phase IV,” Dayal said. The platforms of the upcoming station are ready and DMRC now needs to add a roof and a station building.As part of the first civil contract for Phase IV, three interchange stations — Peeragarhi (with Green Line), Madhuban Chowk (with Red Line) and Haiderpur Badli Mor (with Yellow Line) — will come up. Three corridors of Phase IV have been approved so far, under which 61.6km of new lines will be constructed. These corridors, with 45 stations, are 20.2km-long Aerocity-Tughlaqabad, 28.9km-long RK Ashram-Janakpuri West and 12.5km-long Maujpur-Majlis Park.

Title: Two landslide-hit families to move into new houses on Jan 6
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Kozhikode: It is going to be a dream come true moment for the two landslide-hit families of Karinchola when they will be moving to a new house constructed by student volunteers of the National Service Scheme in Kozhikode on January 6, 2020.

The two landslides affected families at Karinchola, who have been staying in rented houses since the landslide in June, 2018, will shift to their own house at Chembrakunda, Kattippara on the day. Education minister C Raveendranath will hand over the keys of houses to K Sumathi and Ananya Anilkumar.

Thanks to the National Service Scheme (NSS) Higher secondary section’s housing project. Considered to be the first of its kind, an initiative taken by a district NSS unit in Malabar region, the decision to construct new houses to three beneficiaries was suggested by the NSS volunteers who visited the site of Karinchola landslide site. As many as 14 people lost their lives in a landslide which washed away an entire hillock at Karinchola situated in the limits of Kattippara grama panchayat.

A total of 13,900 NSS volunteers from 139 schools in the district raised a total of Rs 16 lakh through fundraising activity conducted over two months. Kanivu gramam donated five cents of land each to the beneficiaries to construct the house. Kattippara grama panchayat authorities have helped the district NSS to find the suitable land at Chembrakunda to construct houses. Work such as leveling the areas, loading and unloading of construction materials and supply of construction materials to the skilled labourers during the concreating and painting was carried out by NSS volunteers. The 500 square feet house has two bedrooms, attached common bathroom for the bedrooms, kitchen, living room and verandah.

K Sumathi (51), one of the beneficiaries of the project, said that the beautiful house was the result of enormous effort put by the NSS volunteers. “The children worked day and night without break and I don’t have words to express gratitude to them for the sincere efforts taken to complete the construction of houses,” said an emotional Sumathi adding that she and her two sons had a narrow escape when the landslide occurred on the morning of June, 2018. “We first ran upward and then downward seeing gushing water and after hearing a loud sound. It took only ten minutes to wash out the entire hillock. Our houses were damaged completely,” she said adding that she is overexcited to move to a new house after staying one and half years at the rented house.

Meanwhile, NSS district coordinator S Sreechith said that NSS took the decision to construct three houses on the basis of overwhelming response received from public for its fund raising initiative. “The NSS volunteers have proved the real meaning of empathy by taking up the construction work of houses. Kattippara grama panchayat and Kanivu Gramam members have also lent their helping hands for the materialization of the houses. The construction of the third house has just begun,” he said.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Special session gives nod to SC/ST quota
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

UP CM Yogi Adityanath

Title: Vadodara turns cleaner, gets fourth spot in second quarter
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Civic body meticulously documented for better results this year

VADODARA/AHMEDABAD: From a very average 21 in the first quarter to the fourth place in the second quarter of this fiscal, Vadodara sprung a surprise in the Swachh Survekshan rankings for the first and second quarter declared on Tuesday.

Three cities from the state – Rajkot, Vadodara and Ahmedabad – have been ranked in the top ten cities in the second quarter of Swachh Survekshan. Rajkot has surprised many by bagging the second position while Ahmedabad was ranked sixth.

Vadodara which was not in the top 20 list of the cities with over 10 lakh population jumped to the fourth position overtaking Ahmedabad and Surat city that was ranked third in first quarter. Surat fell to the 20th position in the second quarter. Rajkot which was ranked fifth in the country in first quarter has been ranked second.

Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) in-charge additional city engineer Shailesh Naik said that the civic body had been meticulous with documentation in the second quarter leading to better results. “We had observed in the previous Swachh Survekshans too that this was a major area where we lacked. This time we were prepared and made necessary improvements,” Nayak who is also the heads the solid waste disposal function said.

What has brought smiles to many in the civic body is the fact that the results of the second quarter when the city was ranked fourth coincided with the floods in the city. A massive drive to clean the city was taken up after the floods on July 31.

VMC sources said that the improvement was significant as the city was ranked 21 in the first quarter and reached fourth rank in the second. They added that in the overall ranking at the end of two quarters, the city was ranked 20.

The VMC has now set its eyes on the last quarter of the year that will decide the overall Swachh Survekshan rankings. “The quarterly rankings are given on the basis of telephonic surveys as well as documentation provided by us. The annual rankings will also include a visit by experts who will see things for themselves,” said Naik.

In both the first and second quarter, Porbandar town which was so far included in the list of cities does not find place in the top 20 in the list of cities with over one lakh population. Even in the In this category only, Gandhinagar was ranked 12th in the country.

Title: 11-year-old Hyderabad girl fires 136 arrows on target in eight minutes, scripts record
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Chandana Sai Anjani Bethu

HYDERABAD: Not quite William Tell, but city archer Chandana Sai Anjani Bethu ended 2019 on a high note, as she etched her name in the International Wonder & Genius Book of Records. In a feat achieved here on Sunday, the youngster set a new mark by shooting 136 arrows in eight minutes to script a new record at the event held in Tatva Global School, Gajularamaramam.

The 11-year-old class VI student of the same school wanted to shoot 76 arrows over 10 metres in 15 minutes and 15 seconds but surpassed her own expectations during her record feat.

Anjani, who hails from Bhimavaram in Andhra Pradesh , trains with coaches Ramesh and Gangaraju at ECLAT Sports Academy in the city. Though she took to archery in June last year, she has made a mark by winning medals in a short span of time.

Anjani finished runner-up in the U-14 category at the 65th district-level School Games Federation event conducted by Pallavi International School at Gandipet in September this year. She also won a gold medal in the U-14 age group 50m category at the Rural Games Federation Cup conducted in Munnar (Kerala) in November and earned herself a ticket to participate in the Asia-Pacific Rural Games to be held in Thailand in 2020.

She thanked her parents, father Satyanarayana and mother Sri Lakshmi, for their support. Anjani is also into badminton , swimming and skating.

Speaking to TOI on Tuesday, a thrilled Anjani said, “It’s a very happy moment for me, as I exceeded the target I had set for myself. Now, I am looking forward to doing well in the Asia-Pacific event. My aim is to represent the country in archery one day.”

Title: New start for this Kolkata transgender couple ahead of New Year
Content:
Tista and Dipan at the marriage registrar’s office in Sodepur on Tuesday

KOLKATA: City’s first transgender couple , Tista Das and Dipan Chakraborty, got their marriage legalized at the registrar’s office in Sodepur on Tuesday.The couple has come a long way since falling in love three years ago during Dipan’s sex reassignment surgery in 2016. It has been a long journey for the couple who has been brave in crossing several social hurdles together. The duo finally tied the knot in August this year while on the last day of 2019, they got the much needed legal stamp on their ‘ Rainbow Wedding ’.Tista said there was a special reason behind choosing December 31 for the registration. “We wanted to start 2020 as a legally married couple and that is why we chose the last day of 2019 for this special event,” Tista added. The couple had to get all of Dipan’s new documents to make the process smooth.“I already had my documents as I had undergone the surgery 15 years ago. It took us a little time to get Dipan’s documents as he underwent the surgery in February,” said Tista, adding that Dipan’s family has finally accepted their relationship.Tista was born as Susanto while Dipan, born as Dipannita, was initially ostracized by his folks for changing the gender. None from his family had attended their wedding on August 5.However, things changed and on December 14, Dipan’s parents had come down to Kolkata to meet the couple. “Initially, they couldn’t recognize Dipan as this was the first time they were seeing him since his surgery in February. However, it was an emotional moment. On January 7, I will be going to my in-law’s place in Guwahati for the first time. I am really looking forward to it,” Tista added. Tista’s maternal uncle and two other friends were the witnesses for their registry.

Title: Odisha govt OKs land acquisition for Dhamra Port airstrip
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The state government has approved a proposal by Dhamra Port Company Limited (DPCL) to acquire 274.41 acres of land to build a commercial airstrip in Bhadrak district.

Premananda Khuntia, additional secretary of the commerce and transport department, recently conveyed the state government’s decision to Bhadrak collector Gyana Das.

The Adani Group-owned DPCL has been asked to obtain necessary clearances from the Airports Authority of India, the Union ministry of environment, forest and climate change and other agencies before building the airstrip. Sources in DPCL said the company had already started the process of seeking approvals.

The airstrip, once built, will provide a big connectivity boost to northern Odisha, which currently does not have an airport serving it. “The DPCL airstrip will not only serve the company but ensure the development of tourism and enhance commercial activities in the region,” said a senior government official.

The state government had given its approval to the project in September 2018; on November 12, 2018, it had inked an MoU with DPCL for the construction of a commercial airport near Dhamra Port.

The airstrip will be developed over 500 acres and used for both passenger and cargo movement. Sources said it would come up 20 km before Dhamra. The DPCL will invest over Rs 500 crore in the project.

Official sources said the state government would take a call on the acquisition of the remaining 226 acres later.

Sources in the Bhadrak administration said it had already identified an area near the town for the airstrip.

The airstrip will also benefit the proposed five million-metric tonne per annum (MMTPA) LNG terminal at Dhamra, the foundation of which was laid in July 2017. The terminal is being jointly developed by the Indian Oil Corporation Ltd, GAIL Ltd and Adani with an investment of Rs 6,000 crore.

A special economic zone and industrial park are also being planned near the Dhamra Port.

Title: Gujarat Police to use brand power to look more arresting
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: More than 70,000 constables and head constables of Gujarat will now have an official wardrobe change to make the parent-force badges on their uniforms uniform. A committee headed by DGP, Gujarat, Shivanand Jha and Additional DGP Harikrishna Patel had proposed to the home department the use the same symbol ‘GP’ (Gujarat police) on the belts and epaulettes of all police personnel below the rank of PSI. The committee had found that the identification of parent force through badges and symbols in Gujarat police personnel below the rank of PSI differed according to the district or city they were deployed in. This caused especial confusion when police teams went outside Gujarat for investigation or other official purposes.“The proposal has been approved and now the from constables to head constables, all will wear the symbol of Gujarat police, that is ‘GP’ on their shoulders instead of the symbol of the district or city police force where they are deployed. The symbol on belts will also be ‘GP’,” DGP Jha said.Lauding the move, a senior police official said, “If constables to head constables wear the same symbol, ‘GP’, it will enhance their feelings of belonging to the same force. The designation of each constable or head constable will be worn on the nameplate on the chest, so that their parent unit can be easily identified.”Confusion in proving identity outside state: Jha“Whenever our police went on duty outside the state, we noticed they faced problems in establishing their identities. If there is ‘GP’ on shoulder badges and belts they can be easily recognized as Gujarat police. The force is also happy with the step, because there will be uniformity with all members of the police force wearing the same logo on their shoulders and belts,” said DGP, Gujarat, Shivanand Jha.First change in police uniform accessories since state was formedThis is the first time since the formation of Gujarat state in 1960 that shoulder badges, chest nameplates and belt symbols of all police personnel below PSI will be changed. The last change to Gujarat police uniforms was made in the seventies when trousers had replaced the khaki shorts.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: BJP widens CAA outreach, to talk to protesters & kin
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

LUCKNOW: BJP in Uttar Pradesh has decided to widen the ambit of its month-long mass contact drive in favour of the amended citizenship law by planning to directly meet protesters and their family to remove apprehensions about CAA, notwithstanding a parallel crackdown and slapping of notices to confiscate property of those involved in violence and destruction of public property.

The party has decided to hit the grassroots and asked booth and sector-level functionaries to identify those engaged in protests and meet them.

Confirming the move, UP BJP general secretary and in charge of west UP, Vijay Bahadur Pathak, said the party’s campaign till January 25 will reach out to those driven by the political agenda of the opposition. “We need to tell them the law is about giving citizenship and not taking it away. There is nothing in it that would harm a particular community,” he said.

BJP sources said the party has decided to reach out to 50,000 villages across the state. “We have a booth and sector list of people. The cadre will speak to these people and explain the finer points of the citizenship law,” said a senior BJP functionary closely associated with the campaign.

BJP’s overdrive is seen as a damage-control exercise and attempt to counter the Opposition’s narrative on the citizenship law being anti-Muslim and against tenets of the Constitution. The Congress leadership, in fact, has been vociferous in its stand, saying the law is in conflict with Article 21 of the constitution that guarantees equality.

The protests have been violent in Uttar Pradesh, claiming 23 lives. The state authorities had taken precautionary measures, including making over 5,500 preventive arrests and snapping Internet in 18 districts and raising security and patrolling. At least 288 policemen were injured and another 61 received bullet injuries.

Title: Lights, lasers, robos — country’s biggest tech fest is here
Content:
IIT-Madras director Bhaskar Ramamurthi addresses a press meet

CHENNAI: Laser shows, robo wars, drone races, reverse coding challenges and hackathons — the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras is set to host Shaastra 2020. The 20th edition of the largest tech festival in the country will be held from January 3 to 6. The Times of India is the media partner for the fest this year.This year’s theme is ‘Parsec to Planck’, focusing on miniaturization of products. For the first time, an assistive technology makeathon will be part of the festival to enhance the quality of life for the visually challenged and the elderly.There will be a defence tech summit and defence expo where the products of nascent defence technology startups will be displayed. There will be live demos and hands-on workshops.The four-day festival will have 40 events and 30 workshops and organisers expect 40,000 students and innovators to attend them. British neurobiologist Colin Blakemore and economist Meghnad Desai will deliver lectures during event.IIT Madras director Bhaskar Ramamurthi said the event is organised by students. “Various parts of the institute are connected to Shaastra and through this event they learn how to go beyond classrooms. This is an event to connect with students across the country,” he said.Professor M S Sivakumar, dean (students), IIT Madras, said engineers can have fun while participating in various challenges at Shaastra.In a novel initiative named ‘Blink’, IIT Madras students have been working with organizations across the city to transform the pedagogy for visually-impaired students, particularly for those in primary and secondary schools. The campaign has reached out to more than 200 students so far and the team is currently looking to expand their reach to other cities in Tamil Nadu .Organisers said there will be a laser harp performance by Spanish artist Heimdall and a techno-entertainment show by IIT students called “Envisage”. There will be open house session during which students will get an insight into the research work done at IIT Madras. Also, illusionist Vivek Desai will also enthral students with his modern magic.

Title: Ahmedabad ranked sixth in Swachh Sarvekshan
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Three Gujarat cities — Rajkot, Vadodara and Ahmedabad — have ranked in the top ten cities for the second quarter Swachh Sarvekshan . Rajkot surprised many by bagging the second position, while Ahmedabad ranked sixth .

The city improved its position by one rank from the first quarter. Rajkot which was ranked fifth in the country in the first quarter is now second. However, Vadodara which was not among the Top 20 cities with populations bigger than 10 lakh suddenly jumped to the fourth position, overtaking Ahmedabad. Surat, which was ranked third in first quarter, fell to 20th position.

In both the first and second quarter, Porbandar, which was so far included on the list of cities did not find a place in the Top 20 cities with more than one lakh residents. Only Gandhinagar figured in this category, ranking 12th in the country

The ministry for housing and urban affairs on Tuesday, announced the results of Swachh Survekshan League 2020 (Quarter 1 and Quarter 2). In the 2018 Swacch Survekshan, Ahmedabad city had leaped into the Top 10, as the sixth cleanest city in the country.

In the first quarter, the city ranked high as it began taking measures to tackle its garbage mound issue. Officials said that in the first quarter, the city took measures to prevent people spitting on the roads and peeing by the roads or in the open.

Municipal commissioner Vijay Nehra said, “It is good that the city has been able to maintain its position in the Top 10. Ahmedabad is the only metro city to find a place in the Top 10 in the country. Mega cities like Ahmedabad have a major problem of a floating population, which the city is trying to address.” According to Nehra, the city consistently ranked among the Top 10 cleanest cities in the country.

Nehra said that the city had recently undertaken a major drive to clean the Sabarmati river. He said waste land where garbage was being dumped was cleaned and converted into green spots under the Mission Million Trees campaign.

Title: Cong alleges Rs 30k crore scam in crop insurance
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Gandhinagar: The Gujarat Congress has alleged that the BJP-led Gujarat government and insurance companies have carried out a scam worth about Rs 30,000 crore in crop insurance schemes in the state.

Gujarat Congress president Amit Chavda, Gujarat Congress Kisan Morcha leaders Rutvij Makwana and Pal Ambaliya and party spokesman Jayrajsinh Parmar organized a press conference and presented data claimed as official data of crop cutting reports for two villages, where 91% crop failure was reported but only 1.48% insurance payouts were made.

“The BJP government was not sharing crop cutting and crop damage survey data, claiming that making such information public would create a national security risk. We don’t understand how details of farmer’s crop damage can be a national security issue,” said Chavda. “We have got details of two villages in Mendarada taluka, where crop damage of 91% and 81% was reported in the survey by the state government officer, gram sevak, insurance company official and these details was approved by the government. However, against the reported damage, farmers received just 1.48% of their reported loss,” said Chavda. State agriculture minister R C Faldu termed allegations made by Gujarat Congress as baseless. “The crop damage survey is being done under the government of India’s technical advisory committee guidelines. The Congress is making these allegations out of frustration from losing badly in the panchayat byelections. I challenge the Congress to prove their allegations.”

Title: VC Kane rolls back move after ABVP’s ill-informed protest
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Nagpur: Nagpur University (NU) vice chancellor SP Kane on Monday rolled back his permission to hold a lecture series on ‘C for Citizenhood’ by former professor of social work Arun Kumar Sinha after the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) objected, mistaking it as an event against the controversial Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA).

On Tuesday, the ABVP started distancing itself from Kane’s move after it became clear to it that the two issues were different. In its memorandum to the VC, the BJP’s students wing had labelled Sinha ‘anti-CAA’ while terming the lecture series an ‘anti-national activity’ which will create ‘doubts’ in the minds of students.

Sinha had approached the National Service Scheme (NSS) director Keshav Walke seeking an awareness campaign on citizenhood, which he says pertains to ethical, existential and behavioural issues.

On December 27, the NSS director had written to all affiliated colleges to hold a lecture for students by Sinha on ‘C for Citizenhood’ after nod from the VC, who was informed about the subject.

Yet, when ABVP opposed it, Kane withdrew the permission without explaining the difference to the delegation of the students’ wing on Monday. This is the third lecture Kane has cancelled after giving permission. In March 2017, Kane had cancelled the lecture by CPI (M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury while a discussion by students on author Nayantara Sahgal was called off in January this year.

With the ABVP changing its stance now, the NU, too, seemed to be in damage control mode.

A day after issuing the cancellation notice, NSS director Walke said the lecture series was not cancelled but put on hold in view of aspersions cast by some students.

ABVP city secretary Amit Patle blamed the VC for rushing with the decision. “Our stand is very clear. We didn’t demand cancellation but only made a request to the university to look into the issue. Later, we came to know that citizenhood is different from CAA. We do not want any anti-Constitution activity to take place. We did not know the content of the lecture. They should have explained the matter to us instead of scrapping the event,” he said.

Professor Sinha, who retired in 2013, has been working on citizenhood since last five years. “Citizenship is primarily a politico-legal idea whereas citizenhood covers the ethical, existential and behavioural aspects. The two ideas are not at loggerheads but they are different. Citizenship is a status granted by the state, while citizenhood is a role that a citizen ascribes to him/herself and tries to live like a citizen. While educating the youth or raising kids, we must lay emphasis on the role of a citizen. The society has been unable to address this issue,” he said.

Through lectures, the social work professor wants to motivate the youth and elders to try to be responsible citizens. “I do not want to talk in context of the formal citizenship concept,” he said.

Title: Thermax Limited bags Rs 431-cr order to set up FGD systems
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Pune: Thermax Limited has bagged a Rs431-crore order from a public-private joint venture power company to set up two flue gas desulphurisation (FGD) systems at their thermal power plant in Jharkhand, hinting that industrial pollution norms in the country are getting streamlined.

By the close of trading, the shares of the company ended about 2.5% higher compared to the previous day Bombay Stock Exchange.

This was the second such order for the Pune-based company within six months, after it bagged a Rs471 crore order from a state-owned power company in July 2019.

“The environment business has had a good run in terms of order intake, and I am happy that we have concluded the year on a high note with this inclusion. It also shows that the implementation of industrial pollution norms has gained momentum in the country, considering that we bagged two large FGD orders within the short span of six months,” M S Unnikrishnan, MD & CEO, Thermax Limited, said.

The company said that the scope of supply includes design, engineering, manufacturing, civil work, construction and commissioning of the FGD systems. The commissioning of the project is scheduled over 30 months.

Title: Capital parties hard, raises a toast on New Year’s Eve
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The city has been decked up to celebrate the New Year in high spirit with people of almost all age groups thronging hotels, shopping malls, clubs and pubs where special arrangements were made for the Zero Night parties.

While hotels of all ranges were lit up and put up special dance and music shows for the Zero Night parties, malls and other institutions dazzled with special decorations to give party like feel to the citizens. The youngsters were seen gathering at several hangout zones to spend quality time with each other.

Nityananda Maharana, manager of a city-based hotel, said they have made arrangements for unlimited food and drink. “We have made some special arrangements for the children. Security has also been tightened for the Zero Night party,” he said.

Hotels, pubs and clubs in the city fixed fees for Zero Night parties. While some of them have made couple and stag entry free, some others have fixed charges ranging between Rs 2,000 to Rs 20,000. Special zones were also created for the elderly at several places.

“We always visit hotels and malls to hang out and celebrate the new year, but this time we thought of doing it in a different way. We called all our friends and first visited our respective homes to get the blessings of our elders and from there we stayed at one place and spent time with each other,” Samiksha Mishra, a resident of Nayapalli, said.

Religious institutions also made special arrangements for the rush. “It is the first day of the year and we need to get the blessings of the almighty. We are partying at home to welcome the New Year and have planned to visit temples tomorrow,” Shanti Lata Rath, a resident of Bomikhal, said.

Several tourist places, including Konark, Jagannath Temple in Puri and several places in Bhubaneswar and Cuttack, saw the rush on New Year’s eve. “We want to see the sunrise at Konark on the very first day of the New Year,” said Sukanya Jena, a city-based college student.

Title: Kalahandi tribals to sensitise people against liquor consumption
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Bhawanipatna: Tribals in Kalahandi’s Pahadpadar panchayat under the Lanjigarh block have vowed to sensitise people of 16 villages to the health hazards and ill effects of consuming alcohol.

It has often been the reason behind early deaths, murders and family fights.

“The government will never agree to shut down liquor business because of the revenue generated from it. We are trying to sensitise people by telling them about the repercussion of liquor consumption,” said British Kumar, who is leading the movement under the banner of Khandualmali Mahila Samiti.

Banalata Majhi, a resident of Bengaon village, who is part of the movement said the country-made liquor units need to be shut down as many unemployed youths and aged are getting addicted to liquor.

She alleged that tribals in hilly areas prepare liquor at home and use it both for personal consumption as well as sell it. They collect mahua, banana, jaggery and sugar and soak it in water for three to four days and then boil this liquid inside the deep forests to make liquor. The steam of this liquid is collected and it is called “dhara mada” or alcohol, she added. “Tribals use traditional methods to prepare liquor and for that reason the alcohol is highly concentrated,” said Sushil Kumar of Lanjigarh.

Former vice-chairman of Lanjigarh block Jagdish Benia said the number of men is dwindling as they consume this highly concentrated forms of liquor over long periods of time and die. “Many women become widows at an early age,” said Benia.

Satya Mahar, the convenor of Niyamigiri Surakhya Samiti, alleged that government is not bothered about the deaths and is only eyeing the revenue generated from liquor. “The government has no record of how many people died due to consumption of alcohol in the last five years,” he said.

Former sarpanch of Pahadpadar Krushna Majhi said alcohol needs to be banned in tribal pockets. “,Tribals who are illiterate start consuming liquor since morning and suffer from liver and kidney-related diseases,” he added.

In these areas, women work as daily labourers to keep the hearth burning at home. They are also beaten up if they do not hand over the money to their drunkard husbands. “The men beat their wives and children after consuming alcohol. Incidents of murders by alcoholics have also taken place,” Lalita Majhi, a tribal, told the media.

Excise superintendent of Kalahandi Dambrudhar Khanda said raids are conducted on illegal liquor sale in the interior pockets and accordingly cases are registered and arrests have been made. But locals continue with their business after being released from jail, he said.

Title: Kolkata: Car owners complain of ‘fake cases’ on police Facebook page
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

In an SMS received from Kolkata Police , Nirupama Banerjee was told that her car had violated traffic rules at Shyambazar five-point crossing in November. “It is interesting to note that I have been residing in Ahmedabad since February 2019. This particular car has not been in use and it is in a garage in my residential complex under 24-hour CCTV surveillance which will corroborate the fact,” she claimed.

Ashok Kumar Modi faced the same problem. “I am away on a vacation since October 6 in Gujarat. My car has been parked in my garage since then. It is impossible that my car was on the AJC Bose flyover around 4am on October 8. Please look into it and withdraw the case against my car.”

“I had sold and transferred my car in 2015. The registration has changed to the new owner and a smart card has been issued in her name. The car has been fined for illegal parking a few days ago. I am getting SMS alerts to pay the fine. Not sure why your app has my name as the owner when Motor Vehicles has issued the smart card in the name of the new owner,” said Anirvanjyoti Sen after facing similar problems.

As Kolkata switches to the most modern techniques of traffic management — from using speed cams and traffic light violation cams to swiping cards at spot to pay fines — complaints of fake cases still haunt motorists. The police brass is now taking steps to ensure that grievances get addressed in the least possible time — say as early as within two hours.

Cops say most of the cases are fake in nature. “We have come across several such cases where people have received fake SMS that look similar to e-challans the traffic police department sends to motorists to alert them about their pending fines,” an officer said. In most other cases, the owners forget to upload details after a car’s ownership changes leading to SMS reaching the first owner.

But there is indeed a bigger worry. In at least a couple of recent cases, duplicate registration numbers emerged, an issue cops are likely to take up with the RTOs in 2020. “The fact that the challans are generated against one mobile number is an indication that this registration number is enrolled with his name in the motor vehicles department records. It can also mean that one registration number is fake. But this needs to be probed,” said a senior officer of the traffic department.

Earlier, Lalbazar had launched a probe after repeated complaints by owners of buses and minibuses that a few sergeants were issuing minor challans (worth Rs 100) to drivers without making any valid entry in the Kolkata traffic police records. In a memo issued on Tuesday, the traffic headquarters asked three traffic guard OCs to explain how sergeants were making entries in the time log of the bus concerned and merely collecting the fine.

“At times, the app refuses to work and the process remains incomplete. It is then that we write out the traffic guard’s name, code number and note down the mobile numbers of drivers.
