Title: Calicut University move to appoint 116 teachers raises eyebrows
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

KOZHIKODE: The decision of Calicut University to conduct one of the biggest mass appointment of teachers in the state at a time when there is no full-time vice-chancellor at the varsity has raised many eyebrows.

The Left-aligned syndicate is fast tracking the appointment of 116 teachers (24 professors, 29 associtate professors and 63 assistant professors) even as the selection process for appointment of a vice-chancellor is underway. The notification inviting applications for the posts is ready and is expected to be published on Wednesday.

But many academics say that it is not proper to conduct the appointments to such large number of posts when the appointment of the vice-chancellor, who is the chairman of the selection committee, is pending. The new VC appointment is expected to take another three months.

Currently, the vice-chancellor of Thunchath Ezhuthachan Malayalam University V Anil Kumar has been given the charge of CU too.

“It is not proper to carry out mass appoitmentsof teachers which have been pending for over 10 years when there is no full-time vice-chancellor. It is morally not correct to carry out the biggest teacher appointment in the history of the varsity without waiting for a full-time vice-chancellor,” UDF-affiliated syndicate member Rasheed Ahammed said. All activities on teacher appointments are being carried out sidelining the recruitment cell, he added.

Pro-UDF Calicut University Teachers Association (CUTA) has written to the governor and chancellor Arif Mohammed Khan urging him to issue a direction to the VC in- charge to stop all proceedings regarding appointment of teachers until a new, permanent VC is appointed by the chancellor.

“We fear that there will be political interference in the appointment of teachers,” Prof T M Vasudevan, president of CUTA, said.

Meanwhile, syndicate member K K Haneefa said that the fears of political interference in teacher appointments were totally unfounded. “As per varsity rules, there is no distinction between a full-time VC and in-charge VC. Around half the teaching posts in the varsity are vacant. This is the reason the varsity has slipped in rankings,” he added.

Title: Hotels in Madurai yet to enroll in hygiene rating
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Hotels in Madurai are yet to get enrolled in the ‘ hygiene rating ’ scheme introduced by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) in February 2019. The rating is aimed at allowing consumers to make choices while eating out. Under the scheme, hotels and food production units will be audited by an external agency and their hygiene standards are rated.

It will encourage food businesses to improve their hygiene standards. Hotels are rated between one and five stars, with five being the maximum.

While hotels in some of the districts have already started getting the ratings, hotels in Madurai are yet to make a mark. As many as ten hotels in Chennai have got ratings of four-star and five-star. Four hotels in Tirunelveli, three in Salem, two each in Coimbatore and Dindigul and one each in Tuticorin and Tiruvallur have got ratings so far.

“We conducted two separate sensitization programs for hotels in Dindigul and Kodaikanal. In all, 85 food business operators took part in the meetings. Two hotels from Dindigul applied for it and got five-star rating. We have learnt the rating system and can get ratings for more hotels. Hotel owners will be encouraged to get involved in the process,” said the designated officer for food safety, Dindigul district, Dr K Natarajan.

He said various parametres are taken into consideration during the assessment by a specialized team. They include medical fitness certificate of employees, cleanliness of hotel premises and surroundings, infrastructure and safety gears used by workers. Food will also be tested in a laboratory to ensure quality, he said.

The process starts with self-assessment from the food business operator (FBO), which is verified through physical inspections and validation. FBOs, which get four and five ratings, will be declared as ‘responsible place to eat’ in addition to hygiene rating. Five-star rating is given for scores between 81 and 100 marks. Similarly, four star (61-80 marks), three star (41-60), two-star (21-40) and one-start (20 and below) will be given.

President of Madurai District Hoteliers Association K L Kumar said that they are not aware of the scheme and would get in touch with the food safety officials to get it done, he said.

When contacted, an official from the food safety department said that it is being rolled out in many districts in a phased manner. Those, who have not taken it up so far, will start popularizing it, the official said.

Title: 380 kg ganja seized in coastal village
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: A team from the customs preventive unit from Rameswaram seized 380 kgs of ganja stockpiled at a hideout near the seashore in a village in Ramanathapuram district in the early hours of Tuesday. The ganja packed into small bundles were stuffed into 11 gunny bags. It was the second major seizure of ganja in a week, after Ramanathapuram district police seized 81 kgs of ganja from a coastal village on December 25.

The ganja was seized from SP Pattinam village near Thondi. A team led by superintendent of customs preventive unit M Joseph Jeyaraj was acting based on a tip-off. Officials said that the consignment was meant to be smuggled into Sri Lanka in exchange for gold biscuits.

Explaining the modus operandi of the an official said that the ganja was planned to be taken to midsea after which an alert is made to the smugglers in Sri Lanka, who would reach the place by tracking GPS location.

Title: Illegal colonies: DDA modifies FAQ answer
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: A single-line answer to a “Frequently Asked Question” regarding conferment of ownership rights to residents of unauthorised colonies on the DDA website , which resulted in a war of words between AAP and the Centre, has now been modified .

Earlier, question number two in the FAQs on PM-UDAY (Prime Minister – Unauthorised Colonies in Delhi Awas Adhikar Yojana) was, “Is this regularisation of unauthorised colonies?” The pithy answer was, “No. This is neither regularisation of unauthorised colonies nor the structures therein.”

AAP had said that while BJP was putting up hoardings near unauthorised colonies saying they were being regularised, the DDA website clearly said PM-UDAY was not about regularisation. On Tuesday, Union minister for housing and urban affairs Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted the modified answer saying that things had now been simplified on the DDA website to make AAP understand the issue.

The modified reply is now much more comprehensive. It says that PM-UDAY is for conferment of property rights to residents of 1,731 unauthorised colonies. “The regularisation entails approval of layout plans of the colony, which in turn requires fire clearances of the colony and the properties therein from Delhi Fire Service,” the reply now states.

DDA added that conferment of property rights would allow residents to sell or purchase properties without any hindrance, take loans, get building plans approved, if they want to change anything in the current structure, or construct a house on a vacant plot.

The conferment of ownership rights would also open the possibility of redevelopment. “DDA will come out with relaxed development control norms and incentives in terms of higher FAR so that new development can take place,” DDA added.

Deputy CM Manish Sisodia reiterated that the Centre should make it clear whether it really wants to regularise the unauthorised colonies. “The new 20-sentence explanation on the DDA website is not different in substance from the earlier statement. People will not be happy with empty promises, meetings and hoardings. They should get the registration papers in their hands. The misleading claims amount to deceiving the people,” Sisodia said.

Sisodia also locked horns with Puri on Twitter. “Thank you for such a long answer. Sir, I want to know in brief whether PM-UDAY Yojana is for regularisation of unauthorised colonies or not? Earlier your website made it clear that it is not regularisation of colonies or houses. Now you are also not responding,” he tweeted.

Title: Gold price passes Rs 40k
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Continuing its weeklong rally, the price of gold crossed Rs 40,000 per 10g again, settling at Rs 40,435 including 3% goods and services tax (GST) in the Ahmedabad market. The last time it settled above Rs 40,000 was on August 28, 2019. Analysts said gold prices have risen due to the weakened US dollar. “The US dollar has weakened and usually gold prices remain on the higher side at this time as it is the financial year-end in other countries. Moreover, the quarter-end economic indicators do not look promising and as a result, gold prices have risen,” said Haresh Acharya, director of the India Bullion and Jewellers’ Association (IBJA).

Title: Supporters of Bhor MLA vandalise Congress Bhavan in Pune
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

A policeman keeps vigil outside Congress Bhavan on Tuesday night (top) after a mob threw out chairs and broke ... Read More

PUNE: The historical Congress Bhavan in Pune was vandalised by a mob of 20 men, all supporters of Congress MLA Sangram Thopte, on Tuesday.

They were angry that he was not given a ministerial berth in chief minister Uddhav Thackeray’s cabinet expansion on Monday.

The building has a deep connect with the freedom movement. Its construction started on October 2, 1938 and the structure was inaugurated by Mahatma Gandhi on January 26, 1940. It has remained the hub of Congress activity in Pune since then.

Sangram, and his father Anantrao Thopte, have been among the most loyal supporters of the Congress, representing Bhor constituency, some 40km from Pune, for 40 years.

His supporters said Thopte deserved a ministerial berth as his performance in the election had helped the party retain the seat against all odds.

Assistant commissioner of police Sudhakar Yadav, senior inspector Balasaheb Kopnar and other police officials rushed to the spot after a call was made to the police control room.

A police team rounded up 19 men involved in the violence at the spot. The Shivajinagar police were in the process of registering a case of rioting and mischief against all 19.

“They came to Congress Bhavan in cars and SUVs. They had stones and small rocks which they used to damage the doors, window panes, and furniture. We have detained them for questioning,” the police added.

A group of women Congress workers was present in one of the rooms when stones hit the door and landed on the floor of the room.

Popat Patole, a clerk in Congress Bhavan, told TOI that he was at his desk when a stone landed on his table.”It came through the window’s glass pane. It missed my head by a couple of inches,” he added.

The workers pulled out chairs from the rooms on the ground and first floor of the building and threw them on the open ground in front of the large building. All the detained men are from Nasrapur, Bhor, Velhe, Mulshi and other adjoining villages and affiliated to the Congress Party, the police said. A group of local elected members of the Congress, who represent Zilla Parishad and local self-governing bodies, had resigned on Monday. They protested in Bhor city and put up posters condemning the Congress leadership. They also burned Congress banners.

“Action against those who damaged the party’s office will be taken. There can be no violence. The party’s culture does not permit it. The supporters could have approached the high command to resolve the matter,” Ramesh Bagwe, Congress’s city unit chief, said.

Congress functionary Gopal Tiwari said a communication gap between the senior leadership and the local party workers should be filled. “The anger of loyalists should have a mature approach. They have toiled for the party. Communication channels between different levels of party functionaries should be opened so that such reaction from the workers can be better controlled,” he said.

Title: Petroleum ministry allows Vedanta to explore hydrocarbon in Shahjahanpur, Kheri districts
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Bareilly: Ministry of petroleum and natural gas has granted permission to Vedanta Limited to explore hydrocarbon in 14 villages of Shahjahanpur and Lakhimpur Kheri districts. ONGC had done a survey in the said villages nearly 30 years ago and a recently concluded lab test in Russia has suggested that there is 95% chance of the presence of hydrocarbon there. If this turns out to be a commercial discovery, it will be the first time for the land-locked state.

A team of experts from Vedanta recently met the villagers in Nahil village of Shahjahanpur district after which they have agreed to give their land on lease for exploration.

The villagers have agreed to give their land for exploration and sign a contract. The villagers have been promised payment for their losses. If the crop of any villager is damaged because of exploration process then he would also be entitled for compensation, officials said.

Vedanta has spotted 10 villages in Kheri while four villages in Shahjahanpur district where they would be exploring the possibility of the presence of natural oil or gas. Nahil, Hardua, Bilsi and Billauri village fall in Shahjahanpur where Vedanta would dig oil wells.

The officials camped in Nahil village on Sunday and shared the details about the project. Jitendra Lal, project officer from Vedanta who camped in Nahil with administrative officials, said, “ONGC had earlier attempted to explore the presence of hydrocarbons but the project was dropped after drilling for nearly 15 days in a few villages, including Nahil of Powayan tehsil, in 1988-89. The samples collected during that time were sent for lab tests. Now after recent test reports from Russia, Vedanta has decided to take up this project and we will do our research work after completing all the formalities. The selected piece of land will be taken on rent from the farmers and they will be compensated for their losses till the time hydrocarbon exploration is done. In case hydrocarbons are not discovered then the land will be returned to farmers in the same condition as it was acquired. The exploration will start after seeking all the necessary permissions from all the departments.”

Ashok Trivedi, a 56-year-old resident of Nahil village who had given his land to ONGC earlier, told TOI, “We are ready to give our land for exploration but we need more clarity on what will happen if oil is discovered from our land. We are definitely very happy that this could be life- changing for each and every individual of the village. We have been promised better life if hydrocarbons are discovered here after digging oil wells.”

ADM (finance) Amar pal Singh said, “The company will select sites within the village where they would start digging wells in the next few months. They have agreed to compensate for losses during the exploration process.”

In 2013, Oil India Ltd (OIL) had found presence of hydrocarbons in the first exploratory well drilled by it in UP under its Ganga Valley Project. The well was being dug near Bilaspur in close-by Rampur district. However, nothing much was heard about it after that and OIL officials were tight-lipped about the results from the well.

Title: Madurai: Nellai Kannan booked for speech against PM Modi, Amit Shah
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

PM Narendra Modi

MADURAI: Orator and writer Nellai Kannan was booked by the Tirunelveli city police under three IPC sections for hate speech against Prime Minister Narendra Modi , home minister Amit Shah , Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami and deputy chief minister O Panneerselvam at an SDPI meeting held at Melapalayam in Tirunelveli city on Sunday.

Melapalayam police booked him under IPC sections 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace), 505(i)(b) (intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public, or to any section of the public whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the state or against public tranquillity), and 505 (ii) (statements creating or promoting enmity, hatred or ill-will between classes).

As this failed to appease BJP cadres, they protested in front of his house on the Gandhimathi Ammal Sannathi Street and the private hospital where he was admitted on Tuesday afternoon as he complained of chest pain. They demanded to book him under The National Security Act (NSA). The protests were so strong at the hospital that he had to be discharged in an hour. His relatives said he would be taken to a private hospital in Madurai. Tension mounted as DMK, Congress and SDPI cadres gathered in support of Kannan. The police pacified the protesters and also conducted preliminary inquiry with Kannan prior to his hospitalisation.

AIADMK cadres petitioned police commissioner Deepak M Damoor and also beat Kannan’s portrait with slippers and brooms for defaming the CM and deputy CM. A senior police officer said that Kannan was in the hospital last month too and he would be quizzed after he is discharged. “We will take the next step (arrest) if needed,” he added. BJP’s senior leaders in Tamil Nadu will stage a sit-in protest in front of Gandhi Statue on Marina Beach on Wednesday demanding his arrest for instigating Muslims to “finish off” Modi and Amit Shah.

Title: Action Replay 2019: RTR flyover finally sees the light of day, but other infra projects crawl
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

RTR flyover has cut travel time by up to 20 minutes for commuters coming from south Delhi and heading towards ... Read More

NEW DELHI: After a decade-long wait, the Rao Tula Ram ( RTR ) flyover was finally thrown open, bringing relief to lakhs of commuters from snarls that were made worse by the construction work that was under way since 2009.

On July 16, chief minister Arvind Kejriwal inaugurated the flyover, which cut travel time by up to 20 minutes for commuters coming from south Delhi and heading towards Gurgaon and the airport. Apart from this, the LED streetlights installed on the flyover have also been saving up to 35% electricity.

The new flyover, emerging as an arm of the existing Munirka Flyover and extending up to Central Base Post Office, not only decongested the Poorvi Marg junction, Vasant Marg junction, RTR junction and Benito Juarez Marg junction, but also facilitated the to-and-fro traffic movement from Munirka to the airport. The old RTR flyover reverted to being one-way for traffic coming from the airport and going towards IIT.

The flyover was the first part of the project and the second half of the project includes an underpass at Benito Juarez Marg and the longest skywalk of the city, running alongside the underpass. Officials claim that they would complete the construction work of these two structures by mid-2020.

Construction work of a few projects could not be finished in the year gone by, and they are now estimated to be completed in different months of 2020. One of such projects is the Pragati Maidan Redevelopment Plan, which was hit hard by construction ban.

On the underground parking at Pragati Maidan, a lot of work still needs to be done. The tunnel and the underpasses could not be constructed by December 2019, as officials concerned had claimed earlier. Construction ban also proved to be a hurdle in the smooth implementation of Chandni Chowk pedestrianisation.

Another project that could not take off in 2019 was the streetscaping project. Kejriwal has already announced the names of nine stretches that PWD would be redesigning as per international standards. However, in view of the construction ban and developments so far, it seems unlikely that work on all these stretches will be over even by 2020.

Title: Delhi: Man cooks up story after shooting self by mistake
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: A 25-year-old man who was trying to impress his girlfriend by brandishing a pistol, sustained a bullet injury after he accidentally fired at his leg. The man then cooked up a story and told police officers that two people had fired at him when he was in the park.

Police said that Sonu Sharma alias Gandhi was released from jail around a month ago, after three and a half years in a rape case. On December 27, at 11.45pm he was with his girlfriend Priya (name changed) at a park in Tilak Nagar. Sharma was trying to show off his pistol and was waving it when it fired and a bullet hit his leg. The two then rushed to DDU hospital for treatment but did not inform police. Hospital authorities then informed police.

Later, cops questioned Priya and Sharma separately. Priya then told officers that Sharma was drunk and carrying a pistol. On the basis of her statement a case was registered and Sharma was arrested. The weapon was recovered from his friend Manoj (26) who was earlier arrested in an Arms Act case.

Title: Delhi: 2.2-acre plot used as dump now a multi-use park
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The park in Shivpuri will have 500 trees, 15,000 plants, two open gyms and a playing area.

NEW DELHI: For 55 ,000 voters of west Sagarpur ward , this new year awaits a green surprise — a newly-developed park in the middle of a congested Shivpuri . The park with 500 trees, 15,000 plants, two open gyms, a walkway, playing area and gazebos will be inaugurated by lieutenant governor Anil Baijal on Tuesday.

South Delhi Municipal Corporation has converted a 2.2-acre vacant DDA plot used for dumping C&D waste and garbage into a multi-purpose recreational activity zone. “We have provided around 51 acres of gram sabha land to the three corporations and they have developed 33 beautiful, lush-green parks in their areas,” Baijal said.

Mukesh Suryaan, area councillor, said the gram sabha land in west Sagarpur was taken over by DDA in 2003. “Over time, it was encroached from all sides. Since 2017, we have been pursuing DDA to at least transfer a portion of the land before it gets totally encroached upon,” he said.

After several rounds of correspondence, in February, the authority agreed to give 2.2 acres of 11 acres for developing the park.

“We started the process of reviving the place after removing at least 55 trucks of malba. Later, we levelled the place, planted grass, shrubs and trees,” said Gyanesh Bharti, SDMC commissioner.

“There was a long-pending demand for a park in the area. Earlier, there was no provision for a space for recreation activities. Most people were using open grounds in the neighbouring areas,” said a senior SDMC official.

The park has something for all age groups, claimed the official. “For kids, we have developed a playing area and installed swings. We have also made tracks for joggers, two open gyms and gazebos where senior citizens can sit,” said the official.

This is not the first time that a civic agency has developed vacant land into a park. In the past three years, civic agencies have taken over gram sabha land at 14 places, including Jaunapur, Najafgarh, Dwarka and Govindpuri, and developed parks .

Next in the pipeline is Khel Parisar at Aya Nagar, where the development work is almost complete. It will be thrown open to the public in the first week of January.

Title: ‘Haryana government plans to cut ambulance arrival time to 3 minutes’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: The average time of an ambulance to reach an accident spot is seven minutes in Haryana. The state government was working to bring this down to three minutes by mapping all ambulances, Haryana transport minister Mool Chand Sharma said on Tuesday. He has directed the health department to compile a data of private ambulances and make it available to the lead agency. He said every ambulance should have a standard format and data bank and exhaustive mapping of ambulances should be done.

Addressing officials during the ‘State Road Safety Council’ meeting here, the minister said level-I services should be provided by the trauma centre, hence the services provided by them should be periodically examined and mapping of private hospitals should also be done.

At the meeting, an action taken report of all the stakeholder departments regarding the decisions taken in the last meeting of the council held on July 9, 2019, was also presented. The minister said that in many places, due to non visibility of the road safety signage, many vehicles are driven on the wrong lane due to which many accidents happen.

Ensuring road safety was the responsibility of everyone and for this it was important to ensure that the necessary signage and boards related to speed limit and nearby trauma centers should be installed in such a way that they were visible from a distance, he added. He said that several signages should be installed on the roads, so that the commuters could be made aware as to where they had to take an accident victim for the treatment. The minister also directed the officers to stop illegal road cuts.

He said in 2020, the government had set a target of reducing the graph of road accidents and casualties. He directed the officials of Haryana State Industrial and Infrastructure Development Corporation to put signage and reflectors on the KMP expressway to reduce accidents .

Title: Indore on course to retain #1 Swachh tag, Bhopal improves
Content:
Swachh Survekshan League 2020

BHOPAL: Indore is on target to retain the tag of India’s cleanest city, while indications are that state capital is on course to make a rebound in Swachh Survekshan League 2020, according to result of quarterly ranking released by Union government on Tuesday. Bhopal had slid 17 places to 19th position in last Swachh survey.Indore was adjudged India’s cleanest city in the first two quarter results declared by Union Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs in New Delhi on Tuesday. Bhopal stood second in first quarter results (April to June), while Rajkot grabbed the second spot in second quarter results (July-September). The third position was grabbed by Surat in the first quarter and Navi Mumbai in the second quarter.Jamshedpur bagged the first position in category of cities having population of less than 10 lakh, according to agency reports.In overall ranking, Indore scored a 100% score in both quarters. Bhopal got 197 and 174 league marks (out of 200) in first and second quarter rankings respectively. Effectively Bhopal was ranked fourth in first quarter and 27th in second quarter rankings.The results of “Swachh Survekshan League 2020” for the 1st and 2nd quarter were announced. It carries a weightage of 25% in overall score of 6,000 points. The evaluation of the different cleanliness parameters has been done based on monthly updates by cities on the SBM-U online MIS. The performance of cities is crucial for their overall rankings. Main Swachh Survekshan 2020 will start from January 4 to 31, 2020. It will access, monitor and sustain the on-ground cleanliness performance of cities across India. 4,276 cities, along with 8 Special Development Authorities (SDAs), will be surveyed in the Swachh Survekshan 2020.“Bhopal has improved on all fronts, it is reflected in quarterly ranking. It cannot be possible without support of all residents,” said Bhopal Municipal Corporation (BMC) commissioner, B Vijay Datta. This year, taking citizen feedback a notch higher, the progress made by cities would be validated on the 12 service level progress indicators collected through direct responses from citizens.“The results are based on service level progress. Rankings are through citizen feedback received in the first quarter and direct assessment in the second quarter. We expect to do much better in the upcoming survey,” said BMC additional commissioner, Rajesh Rathod.Overall indications are that Bhopal is set to improve its position. The cleanest state capital, is vying to be adjudged the cleanest city.Last week, the state capital applied for ODF++ and Water+ Plus certification. A tag that would place it in seven star rated cleanest cities in the country.SS League 2020 is being conducted in 3 quarters, i.e. April- June, July – September and October- December 2019 and has 2000 marks for each quarter evaluated based on monthly updation of SBM-U online MIS by cities along with citizen’s validation on the 12 service level progress indicators through outbound calls.Bhopal has improved on waste collection, segregation, institutionalization of good practices like source segregation, scientific processing of waste, dumpsite remediation, penalties and spot fines for littering, and compliance of bulk waste generatorsBhopal is way ahead of other cities in reuse of plastic waste. Its material recovery facility has been applauded by Central Pollution Control Board. Plastic waste recovered from Bhopal has been used in road construction of over 12,000 km.

Title: Smart City PAPs to receive house rent till they get new flats
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Nagpur: In first-of-its-kind initiative in Vidarbha, the board of directors of Smart City special purpose vehicle — Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited (NSSCDCL) — on Tuesday decided to pay monthly house rent to project affected persons (PAPs) of the scheme till they are given new flats.

The move is likely to expedite works being carried out under the Smart City project.

The NSSCDCL board headed by BMC commissioner Praveen Pardeshi approved monthly house rent of Rs5,000 for PAPs whose residential structure is below 700 sq ft. PAPs owning residential structure above 700 sq ft will be given an additional amount of Rs7.5 per sq ft along with Rs5,000.

In case of commercial structures, monthly house rent will be Rs10,000 for below 700 sq ft and an additional Rs7.5 per sq ft.

Under the project which covers Pardi, Punapur, Bharatwada and Bhandewadi in East Nagpur, NSSCDCL has started to develop road along with all types of basic amenities like footpath, streetlights, storm & sewage water network, and duct for laying cable under tenderSURE concept at a cost of Rs650 crore. As many as 476 structures need to be acquited for the works.

NSSCDCL has offered compensation to PAPs or new flats with all types of facilities in its housing scheme. Most of the PAPs rejected the compensation offer and demanded new flats. It will take over a year for completion of the housing scheme.

To resolve the issue, Pardeshi directed NSSCDCL officials to interact with PAPs and offer them monthly house rent till completion of housing scheme. PAPs have reportedly accepted the offer.

Accordingly, the NSSCDCL board amended its Rehabilitation and Resettlement (R&R) policy and made provisions of monthly house rent in the meeting.

The NSSCDCL board also approved development of city’s first solar power-based electric vehicles charging station inside Mor Bhavan bus stand at a cost of Rs4.07 crore. It will have the capacity to generate solar power of 120 Kwp. NMC has seven platforms inside Mor Bhavan. Under the new project, 10 more platforms will be constructed. Solar panels will be installed on 17 platforms.

The proposal is part of central government’s plan to run 30% of total vehicles on electric power by 2030. In city, there are 200 electric cabs followed by 1,200 e-rickshaws and five electric-run buses. NMC is planning to procure 40 more electric-run buses.

NSSCDCL will develop the station at Mor Bhavan as a pilot project. Later, NMC will operate and maintain it and develop more stations on the same lines.

The NSSCDCL board approved development of one garbage transfer station in Dharampeth zone on pilot basis. NMC had proposed to develop 10 such stations, one in every zone. NSSDCL took the task to develop one which will be replicated by NMC in remaining nine zones.

The station will be free from garbage and also comprise a material recovery facility (MRF) for transfer of dry waste to recyclers. Garbage collected from households will be brought to the station in a segregated manner and will be transferred into heavy vehicles directly for transport up to Bhandewadi dumping yard.

Board’s other decisions

Funds approved for executing compensatory afforestation scheme under the Forest Act, 1980, for diversion of 2.22 acres forest land for other usage in Smart City area

NMC suggested to replicate tenderSURE in other underdeveloped localities to provide all types of basic amenities at a time and save regular digging of roads

Company secretary will be appointed on permanent basis

Mayor Sandip Joshi, collector Ravindra Thakre, ruling party leader Sandip Jadhav, Vaishali Narnavare, central government’s representative Deepak Kochar inducted into the board

K&D Associates appointed as statutory auditors of the company

Financial statements for 2018-19 approved

Title: Ahmedabad News - Times of India
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Ahmedabad: Former deputy superintendent of police (DSP), Jetpur division of Rajkot, J M Bharwad, was suspended on December 23, officials of the anti-corruption bureau (ACB) said on Tuesday.

The ACB had on August 3 registered a case under the Prevention of Corruption Act against Bharwad, after a constable, Vishal Sonara, was caught accepting a bribe of Rs 8 lakh on his behalf. ACB officials said Bharwad’s suspension was due to technical reasons and had become final last week. Bharwad’s headquarters will now be the Chhota Udepur SP office.

After evading arrest for three months, Bharwad appeared before the Rajkot ACB on November 8. Earlier, a sessions court in Dhoraji taluka had declared hhim an absconder in connection with the bribery case. Bharwad allegedly demanded Rs 10 lakh to not torture a suspect.

Title: DMK demands Tamil Nadu government pass resolution against CAA, NRC
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The protest in the city, which was organized by various Muslim outfits and multiple jamats,, got support from ... Read More

MADURAI: DMK president M K Stalin on Tuesday demanded the state government pass a resolution against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CA) and the National Register for Citizens ( NRC ) when the assembly meets on January 6. In a Facebook post, Stalin welcomed the resolution passed by the Kerala assembly asking the Centre to withdraw CAA.

“People in the country want our Constitution to be protected. For this, all state assemblies must pass resolution against the CAA,” said Stalin. In a letter, Stalin has asked party cadre to keep a close watch on ballot boxes when the votes for the rural local body elections will be counted on January 2. Stalin said the DMK legal wing would provide support to the party cadre.

Based on a case filed by the DMK legal wing, the Madras high court had directed the state election commission to provide CCTV cameras in counting rooms and submit a report, he added.

In Madurai , thousands of people took part in a protest against CAA and NRC that took place at Obula Padithurai on Tuesday. Shops remained closed in Khajimar Street, Southgate, Obula Padithurai and Nelpettai till noon.

The protest, which was organized by various Muslim outfits and multiple jamats, got support from DMK and its alliance parties. They protesters occupied the roads and raised slogans against CAA, NRC and the ruling parties at the centre and the state. The protesters carried Indian flags and placards with anti-CAA slogans. Leaders of outfits and political parties addressed the gathering and explained why both CAA and NRC should be opposed. A large number of police personnel were deployed to make sure there were no untoward incidents.

Leaders who took part in the protest include DMK district secretary G Thalapathi, MPs Su Venkatesan (Madurai) and Navas Kani (Ramanathapuram), SDPI leader Nellai M Mubarak, PFI state general secretary A Khaled Ahamed and May 17 Movement leader Thirumurugan Gandhi.

Traffic was affected at many places including the busy Kamarajar Salai. V Shankar, an auto rickshaw driver from Munchalai, said that while it usually takes 10 minutes to reach Teppakulam from Vilakkuthoon, it took 45 minutes on Tuesday afternoon. Traffic police personnel were deployed in large numbers at junctions to ease traffic congestions.

Title: Cyber fraud worries police despite 6% dip in crime rate
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: In what comes as encouraging news for the safety situation in the city, the overall crime rate declined by 6.67 per cent this year compared to 2018. Property offences have come down drastically. Moreover, the overall number of crimes against women has come down, even though cases of rape have gone up.

However, the number of cognisable offences as well as white-collar offences has increased. In terms of cognisable offences, there has been an increase of 3.6 per cent. A total of 1,747 cases of cognisable offence were registered in 2019 . Last year, the number of cases of cognisable offences was 1,686.

Cases of abduction have also increased to 81 in 2019 from 50 in 2018. Murders though have gone down from 30 cases registered in 2018 to 18 cases in 2019.

Speaking to TOI, city police commissioner RK Meena said that white-collar offences have increased by 7.5 per cent in 2019 for which 874 cases have been registered. Many of these were cases of cybercrime, he informed while adding that 813 such cases were registered in 2018.

“We have observed that cyber crooks are turning increasingly tech-savvy and have been coming up with new means of duping people. We are chalking out various measures to mitigate cybercrimes in Visakhapatnam . The city has been witnessing a large number of cybercrimes over the last few years,” said the police commissioner.

On the other hand, property offences have seen a 32 per cent decline in 2019. The number of registered cases reduced from 1,256 cases in 2018 to 959 cases this year. Property offenders are alleged to have made away with Rs 6.06 crore in 2019. Of this, 46 per cent was recovered (nearly Rs 2.77 crore). Detection rate was 50 per cent.

In 2018, Rs 9.27 crore worth of propery was lost of which Rs 5.02 crore was recovered registering a 54 per cent recovery rate and 60 per cent detection.

Meanwhile, crimes against women decreased by 3.2 per cent with 959 cases registered this year. Last year, the number of cases registered was 991. But the number of rape cases registered has gone up to 99 in 2019 from 82 in 2018. “Of the 99 complaints of rape, 84 were deemed to be rape cases technically,” RK Meena informed.

In terms of road accidents, the city police managed to bring down fatalities in accidents by 2.1 per cent this year compared to the previous year. A total of 314 people died and 1,483 people suffered injuries in 1,661 road accidents this year. Last year, 323 people had died and 1,426 people were injured in 1,746 road accidents. On an average, at least six people die in road accidents every week, say police officials.

Title: For 4th time in a row, Indore is cleanest city
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

File photo

NEW DELHI: Indore was ranked India’s cleanest city for the fourth time in a row while Kolkata and Howrah came at the bottom of the heap among cities with population of more than 10 lakh in the quarterly Swachhta survey, announced on Tuesday.

In this category, Bhopal stood second in first quarter results (April-June) of Swachh Survekshan League 2020, while Rajkot grabbed the second spot in second quarter (July-September).

The report was released by urban affairs minister Hardeep Singh Puri . The government has launched the Swachh Survekshan League with the aim to ensure that municipal authorities continue taking steps to improve sanitation round the year rather than focussing on only few months to improve their ranking in the Centre’s annual survey.

This time a total of 4,372 cities participated in the league, which included municipal areas with population in the range of less than 25,000 and over 10 lakh.

Interestingly, even in the overall ranking of all cities and towns, Indore emerged as the cleanest during both rounds of the survey. However, while in the first quarter Sursand (Sitamarhi) and Harnaut (Nalanda) in Bihar came last, during the second quarter Kurdemukh in Karnataka and Bedangpet in Telangana finished last in the list. Puri said as more and more cities and towns participate in the Swachhta rankings, now it’s clear that people have started accepting the rankings and every urban area is trying hard to make it to the list of cleanest cities and towns.

Talking to reporters, urban affairs secretary Durga Shankar Mishra said he was confident that all urban areas in West Bengal will be declared open defecation free (ODF) before the New Year (Wednesday) and the state administration has come on board to participate in the next round of Swachhta survey. Highlighting the importance of citizen participation in the survey, Mishra said survey will be conducted from January 4.

“A major thrust of Swachh Survekshan has been on citizen engagement, be it through citizen feedback or indicators involving citizen participation. This year, the citizen-centric focus has been enhanced substantially through verification of the progress made by cities on Swachhata through direct responses from citizens,” he said.

Title: 2020 the year of women’s safety: DGP
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Tackling crimes against women should be the top priority in 2020, said city police commissioner RK Meena. He added that the Women police station in the city will be strengthened further.

Speaking to the media on Tuesday, Meena said that the police are chalking out plans to increase the strength of the police station by adding four sub-inspectors and a good number of constables.

He also mentioned that as per the Disha Act, investigation into crimes against women must be completed within seven days and trials should be completed within 21 days.

Andhra Pradesh DGP Gautam Sawang said that the state government has declared 2020 as the year of woman safety. “All police stations in the state will be women-friendly police stations,” he said.

Taking cue from the DGP’s statement, Meena said that not only will the city police prioritise all cases booked under the Disha Act, but will also have a designated special team to investigate such cases.

Meena added that chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy has sanctioned a forensic laboratory in the city and a special court to handle Disha Act cases.

Title: GVMC hopes to reclaim top-10 spot in 2020 Swachh rankings
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation ( GVMC ) wants to leave no stone unturned to put the city back in the top-10 league in Swachh Survekshan 2020 after its disappointing performance in the 2019 survey when the city was at the 29th spot.

SS-2020 is going to be the first litmus test for the civic body in the New Year as survey teams will arrive between January 4 and 31 for observation and to collect feedback from the public on the city’s cleanliness and sanitation levels.

Contrary to the one-time annual survey in January which used to take place earlier, the league component was added to SS-2020. This time, it was conducted in three quarters, April-June, July-September and October-December 2019.

The performance of cities at the league level is crucial to their final ranking as it has 25% weightage in the annual final survey (the second stage of the survey) scheduled to commence from January 4.

The GVMC has lost most marks in the star-rating component as well as the source segregation of garbage in the 2019 survey. Now the GVMC has applied for a five-star rating under the garbage-free cities component of SS-2020.

The total maximum marks set for the star-rating are 1,000. The GVMC has focused more on segregation of garbage at source, which had affected GVMC’s rank in the 2019 survey.

The GVMC UCD wing took resolutions against open defecation and use of single-use plastic from thousands of women self-help groups in the city. The written resolutions covered segregation of waste and home compositing. The major objective of these resolutions is to start a discussion about best sanitation practices among women.

On the other hand, the GVMC will launch 10 selfie booths on Wednesday to create awareness on SS-2020 among the public. It will also set up 50 roll-up standees at shopping malls, restaurants and movie halls. The civic body has made noted personalities of the city and celebrities part of the SS campaign. The SS campaign also covered several educational institutions of the city apart from the campaigning in colonies.

Title: Civic body chief seeks people’s support, appeals to Vizagites to download app
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: GVMC commissioner G Srijana on Tuesday asked the public to take an active part in the SS 2020.

“A major thrust of Swachh Survekshan will be on citizen engagement, be it through citizen feedback or indicators involving citizen participation. We have placed a special focus on door-to-door collection, garbage segregation at source, composting, bin clearance and sweeping activities over the last six months,” Srijana said.

Ahead of the final assessment, Srijana conducted a meeting with the Swachh Visakha ambassadors and representatives of various resident welfare associations (RWAs) of the city on Tuesday. The commissioner appealed to residents who own smartphones to download the Swachhata app and use it to complain about their grievances and get them resolved. tnn

Title: Amma Vodi to benefit around 6 lakh students
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Visakhapatnam district education officials have identified about 5.79 lakh eligible students (class I to class XII) under the Amma Vodi scheme.

Out of 7.66 lakh students in the district, 3.17 lakh students are in rural areas, of which 2.74 lakh have been declared eligible for the Rs 15,000 annual financial assistance under the scheme.

In urban areas in the district, 2.14 lakh students out of 3.25 lakh were declared eligible. In tribal areas, 90,605 out of 1.22 lakh students will benefit under the scheme.

Under the scheme, Rs 15,000 will be deposited in the bank accounts of mothers sending their wards to schools or junior colleges. District officials have said that candidates with rejected applications can approach the education officials in their mandals with a request letter and documents to be included under the scheme.

Amma Vodi is one of the nine schemes under the YSR Congress’s Navaratnalu mentioned in its election manifesto.

Title: Every year, govt to roll out one N-reactor: DAE
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Union minister Jitendra Singh (file photo)

NEW DELHI: To boost the commercial use of civil nuclear energy in the country, the Modi government has decided to commission a nuclear reactor every year.

A 700-MW pressurised heavy water reactor at the Kakrapar nuclear plant in Gujarat is likely to be commissioned by April, Shrikrishna Gupta, a senior official of the Jitendra Singh-led department of atomic energy announced in front of the Union minister here on Tuesday. “Kakrapar-3 is likely to be commissioned in mid-2020. Kakrapar-4 by mid-2021 and RAPP-7 by mid-2022 in Rajasthan ’s Rawatbhata,” he said. The Nuclear Power Corporation of India Ltd’s (NPCIL’s) 22 reactors with an installed capacity of 6780 MW are operational, he said.

The DAE official said, “In nuclear energy programmes, Kaiga-1 (KGS-1) reactor has set 962 days of continuous and non-interrupted operation, which is a world record.” He said the Tarapur atomic power reactors — units 1 and 2 — completed 50 years of operation this year. The two boiling water reactors — the first in the country — were commissioned in October 1969.

“We have also facilitated the use of atomic energy in non-power sectors like agriculture, healthcare, water and environment. In the health sector, Gupta said, “Seven cancer hospitals are being set up across the country. Of the seven, two —in Varanasi and Guwahati — are already operational. We are also making use of spin-off technologies for tuberculosis and oral cancer detection,” Shrikrishna Gupta said. Around 46 varieties of seeds have also been developed and distributed among farmers, he said.

Title: Mumbai: Day after, legs of beheaded woman found in bin nearby
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A day after the headless body of a woman was found near the Naval Gate in Vidhyavihar, the Mumbai police crime branch on Tuesday recovered her legs from a public waste bin around 100 metres away.

In an eerie reminder to the recent murder of Vakola musician Bennet Rebello, the investigators found the chopped limbs packed in a blue colour plastic cover. Sources said the pair of legs below knee almost matched with the headless body. The legs have been sent to Sion hospital for tests to verify if they match with the body found on Monday. The torso, wrapped in a bedsheet, was spotted by passersby, who alerted police.

“We hope to soon find the head, which will help us identify the deceased. Once the deceased is identified then it would not be difficult for us to crack the case,” said a crime branch officer.

While Ghatkopar police have registered a case of murder and destruction of evidence against unknown killers, the crime branch unit 7 is conducting a parallel probe.

It appears the woman was killed at another place and the body was then brought to Vidyavihar. Ghatkopar police said they are scanning CCTV cameras to try to find who dumped the body there.

Police are also awaiting the postmortem report to know the cause of deathwhether she was poisoned or stabbed to death. “There are injuries all over her body as if she had struggle with the killers. The left middle finger is broken badly. The doctors have said she should be around 40 years. As the stomach was swollen, it was initially suspected that she could be pregnant, but doctors at Sion Hospital have ruled it out. We are taking the help of social media and are circulating the images in the nearby slum pockets as the woman appears to be from lower middle class,” the officer added.

Title: Combing ops weaken Maoists’ hold along AOB
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The combing operations by AP and Odisha security forces and losses to the cadres through encounters, arrests and surrenders, have left Maoists in the Andhra Odisha Border (AOB) region much weakened.

According to police sources, the Maoists central committee member Ramakrishna alias RK in a letter to the Maoist central committee said they were facing repression from security forces.

Around 84 companies of BSF or CRPF in Odisha and 10 companies of CRPF in Vizag, besides another 12 companies of security forces in Vizianagaram and Srikakulam are continuing combing operations on both sides of the AOB limits.

“After we killed the ruling party MLA and former MLA at Livitiputtu near Araku last year, the security forces have intensified their raids. We are not getting support from some pockets in the Visakha agency. We need to strengthen our forces. There are chance to regain the lost glory as we have committed cadres,’ RK wrote in the letter. Sources said that he also mentioned that veteran leaders were becoming a liability for the party.

Title: ‘Exe capital proposal welcome move’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The GN Rao-led expert committee proposing Visakhapatnam as the executive capital is a welcome move, said D Srinivas Rao, the chairman of the Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority ( VMRDA ) on Tuesday.

Speaking to the media, the VMRDA chairman said, “If Visakhapatnam does become the executive capital the VMRDA is poised to play a vital role in the development of the region. Decentralisation of governance will lead to decentralised development.”

Srinivas Rao further said that the master plan for 2041 is already being prepared to propel growth in north-coastal Andhra Pradesh. “Chief Minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy recently laid the foundation stone for VMRDA works worth Rs 379 crore. We have been taking up the master plan roads in a phased manner,” he added.

Further, VMRDA metropolitan commissioner P Koteswara Rao explained the urban development authorities’ vision for north-coastal Andhra on the last day of the year.

He said, “The proposed Natural History Park and Museum Research Centre is coming up with Rs 88 crore. The planetarium will come up with Rs 34 crore. The integrated museum on the beach road which will come up with a cost of Rs 40 crore will become one of the landmark projects of the city.”

“The NAD Flyover works are likely to be completed by April. It will be the first major facility created by VMRDA for the public. The draft master plan will be prepared by March 30,” added the metropolitan commissioner.

Rao added that the draft master plan will be prepared by March 30 and the VMRDA will receive suggestions from the public for the following two months and later incorporate those changes to finalise the master plan.

Title: AP public transport department gears up to meet Sankranti rush
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Andhra Pradesh public transport department is gearing up to meet the increased rush of passengers in view of the Sankranti festival.

APSRTC (Andhra Pradesh state road transport corporation) is going to be renamed the AP transport department from January 1, informed MY Danam, regional manager of APSRTC Visakhapatnam.

Discussing the plans ahead, Danam told TOI, “We are planning nearly 100 special buses for the Hyderabad route. Around 150 buses are being planned along the Vijayawada and Kakinada routes.”

Sources informed that around 1,000 additional buses will be operated from Vizianagaram zone of the department covering four districts— Srikakulam, Vizianagaram, Visakhapatnam and East Godavari.

Meanwhile, railway sources said that the price of passenger tickets may be hikes this time.

The department will operate buses for Sankranti from January 9-13 and in the return direction from January 15-18.

Railway officials said that nearly 3.5 lakh passengers travel to and from Visakhapatnam during Sankranti and the railway earns nearly Rs 2 crore during the period.

The railways will operate nearly 50 special trains. For the first time, the railways have decided to operate a special express train to Araku to meet the rush of tourists.

Railway officials further said that coaches will be augmented in some trains like Visakha Express and LTT Vizag to Mumbai.

Title: ED attaches Rs 52 crore worth properties of Pappu Singh
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

VISAKHAPATNAM: The enforcement directorate (ED) has provisionally attached movable and immovable assets worth Rs 51.45 crore belonging to Kumar Pappu Singh , his family members and his firms under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA, 2002) in a case where he is alleged to have obtained loans fraudulently from IDBI Bank, Visakhapatnam.

The attached properties include house sites, fish tanks and poultry farms worth Rs 35.7 crore, bank balance held in the name of Kumar Pappu Singh and other items worth Rs 15.73 crore.

An investigation was initiated under PMLA on the basis of an FIR registered under sections 120B, 420, 468 read with 471 of the Indian Penal Code , 1860 and Section 13(2) read with 13(1)(d) of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 by CBI, Anti-Corruption Branch, Visakhapatnam against Kumar Pappu Singh and others for fraudulently availing Kisan Credit Card (KCC) loans from IDBI Bank for fish farming.

Investigation revealed that Pappu Singh had availed KCC loans in the name of 87 borrowers who were his family members, employees and acquaintances from IDBI Bank by listing his properties as collateral securities and misappropriated the loans sanctioned to borrowers.

The loan amounts which were sanctioned to the borrowers were diverted from their bank accounts to Singh’s savings account and bank accounts of his firms.

His residence and offices were raided on July 16 this year and several documents were recovered.

The total loan amount of Rs 69.46 crore was reportedly used to fund his poultry and fish farming business as well as to acquire property.

Title: Mumbai breaks into top 10 in Swachh League
Content:
In the first quarter (April-June), Mumbai was ranked 13 among cities with population above 10 lakh

MUMBAI: After a disappointing 49th rank in the 2018-19 nationwide Swachh Survekshan , civic authorities are hopeful of a top 10 finish for Mumbai this year, with the metropolis emerging eighth in the second quarter (July-September) SS League 2020 results declared on Tuesday. In the first quarter (April-June), Mumbai was ranked 13 among cities with population above 10 lakh.In the second quarter, Navi Mumbai was ranked 3 (up from 8 in Q1), while Thane was 22nd (up from 24 in Q1).While the survey was an annual affair till last year (2018-19), this year the Centre launched Swachh Survekshan (SS) League 2020 with quarterly cleanliness assessment of cities and towns. The quarterly scores will be taken into consideration in 2019-20 survey rankings.Mumbai civic officials credited the improvement in the rankings to BMC implementing the plastic ban and asking big societies to process their waste on their premises. “We are focusing on implementing the plastic ban and waste segregation drive, which is playing a major role in improving our ranking. We are improving in the quarterly results and we hope to get better ranking in the final survey,” said additional municipal commissioner Kiran Dighavkar, nodal officer of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan.Officials said Mumbai’s ranking was badly affected last year due to technical reasons like not collecting user fee from citizen for garbage collection, poor citizen feedback and not providing adequate public toilet. Officials said they have fixed those loopholes. Civic officials said that besides imposing plastic ban, they also penalised defaulters and also appointed registered recyclers to collect plastics from them. Besides, process of closure of Mulund dumping ground started and BMC provided required toilets across the city.According to officials, the rankings for these two quarters were based on documents submitted to the government and online compliances. From January, experts will start asking public opinion on the details provided by the city authorities and conduct surprise checks to verify the BMC’s claim before preparing the final ranking list.

Title: MLA accuses Pawan Kalyan of ‘acting’ in politics
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

VISAKHAPATNAM: YSRCP official spokesperson Gudiwada Amarnath on Tuesday said Jana Sena president Pawan Kalyan was acting in politics.

Amarnath, Anakapalli MLA, said the Jana Sena leader has come into politics to earn more money than in movies.

Speaking to media , Amar alleged that Kalyan has been opposing setting up of the executive capital in Vizag because the people defeated him in Gajuwaka. With that grudge, he has been opposing the proposal, said the MLA. He termed Amaravati as TDP Private Limited Capital, but Vizag as Public Limited Capital. He said Kalyan was losing his respect by making unnecessary comments over the capital city. He asked why Kalyan has not raised any question when Chandrababu Naidu mooted proposals of capitals at Nuziveedu and Guntur.

He alleged that Naidu has been provoking Amaravati farmers unnecessarily. He should make his stand clear whether he is the leader for the entire AP or a region, Amarnath said.

Title: Girijan Varadhi to help tribals access govt welfare schemes
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Civil society organisations, in association with Integrated Tribal Development Agency (ITDA), will launch Girijan Varadhi programme on Wednesday to enable tribals living in remote inaccessible pockets of Araku and Paderu get the benefits of government schemes.

As a pilot model, this tri-partnership project started functioning since a month, reaching out to 300 villages covering around 15,000 households in neglected areas of the district. The ‘bridging the last milestone’ project — taken up by ITDA, Azim Premji philanthropic initiative and Nature NGO — will focus on welfare and empowerment of tribal and rural community.

“Through this initiative, we are raising awareness among tribals residing in remote hilly areas and enabling them to access various government schemes, social security measures, rights and entitlements including the MGNREGS, Recognition of Forest Rights Act, Rhythu Bharosa, Amma Vadi, public distribution system (PDS), PM Matritva Vandana Yojna etc,” S Balaraju, founder-director of Nature, said.

“Since these areas do not have mobile networks, we are facilitating community mobilisation and business correspondence through banks. Grama sabhas are being strengthened and support extended to village secretaries or grama sachivalayas in the tribal areas,” Balaraju said.

He added, “The facilitation of linkages will enable the tribals to access central and state flagship entitlements including the Navaratnalu. A public sector bank will also help villagers living in no-network areas to avail government schemes through online seeding of demographic details, Aadhaar correction and other technical support.”

Title: Big rush for UGC-NET in Kashmir
Content: NEW DELHI: Despite an internet clampdown, Jammu and Kashmir registered 83.5% attendance of candidates registered in the UGC-NET December 2019 exam, second only to 84% in Kerala , and also recorded a 10% qualification rate as against the national average of 8.2%.The UGC-NET test was the first exam held post abrogation of J&K’s special status under Article 370 and its redesignation as a Union Territory. The test saw a significant jump in attendance as against the June 2019 or December 2018 tests held in the UT.In a first, the eligibility test was also held in Leh and Ladakh region. Another first is that the national testing authority (NTA) will issue certificates of assistant professorship and fellowship letters within four days of the results, which usually takes four months to be issued.The results declared on Tuesday saw a record number of over 79,000 candidates qualifying. The National Eligibility Test (NET), also known as UGC-NET, determines eligibility for the post of assistant professor and junior research fellowship (JRF) award in Indian universities and colleges.Among the five states which recorded 80% plus attendance, J&K is second only to Kerala (84.08). In June 2019 test, J&K registered 77.12% attendance. Interestingly, Baramulla district , which has often witnessed terror attacks, registered highest attendance of 94%. In all, a total of 31,147 aspirants appeared for the test in J&K of which 3,243 qualified which is 10.4% and second only to Uttar Pradesh where 13% aspirants qualified.“This shows the aspiration of youth of Jammu and Kashmir and the government has created an environment where they can come out in large numbers. Our focus will continue to improve so that we can offer more opportunities to youth of J&K. I commend their motivation levels and wish them well and urge them to be torch bearers of progress,” said Ramesh Pokhriyal , union minister for human resource development.In general, the total number of candidates increased by over a lakh, up from 6,81,718 in June 2019 and December 2018. Of 65,239 successful candidates, 31,095 are women. The three states which have more than 10,000 qualifications are Uttar Pradesh (20,877), Rajasthan (14,554) and Delhi (12,364). There are total of 17 transgender candidates who took the test and one qualified.Quick issuance of eligibility certificates will cheer candidates. “This used to take around three to four months. From this year, the certificates will be issued immediately without any delay to help the candidates. NTA will issue the certificates this year,” said a senior HRD official.

Title: Kolkata: Fake note seizures peaked in 2019
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: It is not often that Kolkata Police seizes over a crore of fake Indian currency in a single year. But the Special Task Force did exactly that in 2019 — the seizures was almost 1.5 times that of 2018 and around six times that of 2017. The face value of total seized notes stood at Rs 1,00,63,000 as against Rs 64,46,000 in 2018 and Rs 17,26,000 in 2017.The corresponding arrests have been phenomenal too. As many as 41 FICN racketeers were arrested in 2019. “This is almost double the number of people arrested in 2018 (22) and eight times that of 2017 (5 arrests),” said Subhankar Sinha Sarkar, joint CP (headquarters), who was earlier in charge of STF.But, there is one striking feature this year. Amongst the 41arrested this year, 13 are from outside Bengal. This is the highest number of people arrested from outside the state this decade. These include not only men from states like Bihar and Jharkhand, but also from FICN dens located in Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan. The other states where FICN from Bengal made their way into were Maharashtra and Haryana.“Three years after demonetization, the city police have made so many FICN arrests, which indicates that the old networks working from across the border are rearing their heads again,” said a top STF official. “We have found watermarks of a neighbouring country on these notes. Besides the 2,000 notes, features of which have been heavily compromised, this year we found even fakes of Rs 500 notes in abundance,” said an STF officer.The STF is also worried of FICN dealers dealing in illegal firearms in a direct tradeoff. The cops believe that certain criminals from both sides of the border between Bengal and Bangladesh are contacting Munger-based workers to assemble parts of weapons made in the two Parganas and paying them with fake currency printed in Bangladesh.“This is a win-win situation for both. While the FICN dealers could escape the glare of security forces at the border, those operating here could release the FICN received in smaller lots. This minimizes their chances of getting caught,” said an STF official.The features replicated were the transparent area, watermark, Ashoka Pillar emblem, the letters “Rs 2000” on the left, the guarantee clause with the RBI governor’s signature and the denomination number in Devanagari on the front. The trend was noticed since 2018, said STF sources.Sources in Lalbazar claimed that the notes — all of them Rs 2000 ones — carry the security thread. “The security thread is still not that fine. But these are definitely much better than what was coming to the city since December 2017. Most of the earlier catches were mere photocopies. These are actual prints,” said a senior investigating officer. “However, it is up to experts to tell us the extent to which the various security features have been compromised,” said an investigating official.

Title: No fare hike: Indian Railways’ New Year gift for suburban commuters
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

A Mumbai suburban train (File photo)

MUMBAI: In a New Year gift for Mumbai, Indian Railways has announced that there will no hike in fares of suburban train tickets and season passes.

“The railways has decided to marginally affect an increase in fare only over the non-suburban sections-...there shall be no fare hike for passengers over suburban sections and season ticket-holders. This class constitutes 66% of total passenger segment over Indian Railways,” said a senior railway official.

From January 1, for the non-suburban section, the fare increase will be 1 paise/ km for ordinary and non-AC class trains, 2 paise/km for mail/express non-AC coaches and 4 paise/km for AC class fare of all categories, which includes AC chair car.AC 3-tier, AC 2-tier, and AC First class coaches. Those who have bought tickets prior to January 1 will not have to pay the fare difference, officials said.

“It is a good beginning for the new year for suburban commuters as lakhs of people depend on the railway lifeline daily for commute,” said Central Railway chief spokesperson Shivaji Sutar.

Title: Ahmedabad zone FRC gets fee hike proposals from 266 schools
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Ahmedabad: The Ahmedabad zone fee regulatory committee (FRC) has received 266 proposals for fee increases from self-financed schools in Ahmedabad city and district.

The committee has also received 1,644 affidavits from schools that do not want to raise their fees or whose fees are lower than the cap fixed by FRC, said sources privy to the development.

The last date for submitting proposals or affidavits to the FRC was November 15 but was later extended to December 31 after school managements approached the FRC for an extension.

“These proposals and affidavits were received till midnight on December 31. Schools that have not participated in the process will get notices from the district education officer (DEO) and action will be initiated against them according to the FRC’s directives,” a source said.

The FRC will initiate punitive action against schools that do not participate in the procedure to get their fees for the next three years approved by the FRC.

The district education officer (DEO), Ahmedabad city has so far received 95 proposals from self-financed schools for fee revision and 1,133 affidavits where the fees remain unchanged or are lower than the prescribed limit. For Ahmedabad district, the DEO has received 89 proposals for fee increases and 145 affidavits. The district primary education officer (DPEO) received 82 fee increase proposals and 366 affidavits.

Title: West Bengal governor removes New Year’s Eve tweet after ‘Partition’ backlash
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Jagdeep Dhankhar (Photo: ANI)

KOLKATA: The West Bengal governor’s tweet on New Year’s Eve drew sharp responses from writers and politicians, prompting Jagdeep Dhankhar to remove it along with a photograph from his Twitter handle.

On Tuesday, the governor, while recording his New Year message to the people, uploaded his photograph sitting at a table captioned: “Recording of New Year Message for the people of State of West Bengal in the historical Raj Bhawan Library while sitting on the iconic table from which Lord Curzon signed first Partition of Bengal in 1905.”

The tweet hurt the sentiments of noted Bengali citizens, reviving the pangs of the “first Partition” order against which Rabindranath Tagore had written the song ‘Banglar mati, Banglar jol’. Tagore didn’t stop at that . He proposed celebrating Rakhi-bandhan against the partition on September 27, 1905 in a meeting convened at Sabitri Library Swadharma Samiti on Akrur Dutta Lane.

Dhankhar’s tweet assumed political significance in the light of the amended citizenship law when the opposition and particularly, chief minister Mamata Banerjee has often been reciting Tagore’s songs against the perceived attempt to divide people in Bengal along religious lines.

Author Sirshendu Mukhopadhyay didn’t like the governor using the “iconic” adjective in his tweet. “I think he (Dhankhar) misunderstood the entire thing. The word ‘iconic’ should not have been used. The governor has wrongly used the word,” Mukhopadhyay said.

Writer Prafulla Roy, who suffered the Partition ordeal, said: “Partition was painful. The word wasn’t used in the right context.”

Senior Trinamool leader Subrata Mukherjee, also the Bengal panchayat minister, said the governor’s tweet was “unfortunate”. “We want to forget the episode of Partition of Bengal. The tweet is unfortunate,” he said.

Twitterati erupted in protest. One of them, Rama S, made a tacit reference to the Jallianwala Bagh massacre in his tweet, saying: “Are you collecting General Dyer memorabilia as well?”

Another, Diptansu Chaudhury, tweeted: “Are you celebrating the Partition of Bengal, Mr Governor? Or are you the architect of one more? Only province to have faced Partition thrice and He, the governor is proudly celebrating our agony, our deep pain. Great!!!”

Dhankhar tried to defend himself in vain as tweets came pouring on the governor’s Twitter handle. “The person sitting on this table is humble servant of the people mandated to uphold and protect the Constitution and serve the people of West Bengal. How can we be missing the wood for the trees?” he tweeted.

After some time, the governor realised it was not worth pursuing this debate and removed the tweet along and the photograph. “Responding to the reaction of friends and well-wishers and the respect I have for Bengali pride I have deleted the tweet. I get pride in Rabindranath and the spirit of unity. As governor I appreciate the sensitivity of the people and am sure all will appreciate my bona fide response,” Dhankhar tweeted.

Title: PMK seeks dual citizenship for Sri Lankan Tamils, caste-based census
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

S Ramadoss

CHENNAI: A special general council meeting of the PMK, held in Tindivanam on Tuesday, has urged the Centre to ensure ‘dual citizenship’ for Sri Lankan Tamils by entering into a bilateral agreement. It also sought caste-wise census to determine higher percentage of reservations for the weaker sections. “The Sri Lankan Tamils are keen to retain their citizenship in the Island nation. To enable them lead an honourable life here, until they feel safe to return to their country, the Centre has to ensure dual citizenship for them,” a resolution passed at the PMK meeting said.

Another resolution passed at the meeting, urged the need for undertaking a caste-wise census in Tamil Nadu to increase the reservation limits, in the wake of 10% reservation brought by the Centre for the economically weaker section. Yet another resolution sought the implementation of 27% reservation for OBCs in higher medical education, even while demanding reserving up to 80% of the jobs in private sector for locals.

The PMK meeting passed 18 resolutions in all. These include urging the Centre to abandon the hydro-carbon projects planned in the Cauvery delta districts, linking of Godavari and Cauvery rivers and undertaking a massive irrigation project at a cost of Rs 1 lakh crore, to be funded by the Centre and state - to double the acreage under irrigation in the state. The party also sought the release of the seven convicts undergoing imprisonment in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. If not, at least offer them long-term parole, a resolution said. PMK also sought statehood for Puducherry.

PMK also urged the Centre to do away with collections at toll plazas on highways. “There are 45 toll plazas that are collecting tolls from road users. The agencies operating several of these toll plazas have collected more than the cost of those road projects. Once this happens, the norm is to collect just 40% of the toll amount to maintain the roads,” it said
