Title: After Ayodhya & Rafale verdicts in 2019, SC to decide on CAA & J&K this year
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Supreme Court of India (file photo)

NEW DELHI: At a time when dissent gets traction among intellectuals and social media, the Supreme Court in 2019 achieved the unexpected by rendering a unanimous verdict on the 70-year-old Ayodhya land dispute and putting stamp of approval on the deal to purchase 36 fully-loaded Rafale jets from France.

In achieving unanimity in the contentious Ayodhya land dispute, which was argued belligerently for 40 days, the credit must go to each of the five judges, who hailed from different backgrounds and regions, and to the leadership of then CJI Ranjan Gogoi as those in forefront of the legal battle had predicted a split verdict. The decision was unique as it did not have the name of the author, a gesture by the leader of the bench to acknowledge the contribution of each judge - Justices S A Bobde (now CJI), D Y Chandrachud, Ashok Bhushan and S Abdul Nazeer.

Controversy over purchase of Rafale jets from France, involvement of Anil Ambani ’s firm as Indian offshore partner of French manufacturer Dassault, coupled with incessant reports on select documents by a section of the media forced the SC to revisit its December 2018 verdict giving a clean chit to the NDA government. Petitioners - Prashant Bhushan, Arun Shourie and Yashwant Sinha - tried their best to fly Rafale into Bofors infamy. After a detailed examination, the court came up with the same finding - nothing wrong with the deal. Only one to face awkward situation was former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi, who apologised to SC for having misquoted the court order in public. He was advised to be careful in future.

The SC also revisited its decision quashing the custom that barred entry of women in 10-50 years’ age group into Sabarimala Ayyappa temple in Kerala. If the earlier decision was 4-1, the five-judge bench by 3-2 majority decided to send the contentious issue to a seven-judge bench. The majority judgement said the 7-judge bench must chart out a guideline for the court to decide in future on issues where fundamental rights clashed with faith and custom. The larger bench in the new year could also look into discriminatory practices in other religions - entry of women into mosques, entry of Parsi women who are married outside the community into Agiyari and the practice of female genital mutilation in Bohra Muslim community.

Though it gave judgements on three contentious issues - Ayodhya, Rafale and Sabarimala, the SC would get no respite in 2020, with the first task in hand being adjudication on the constitutional validity of Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), which saw nation-wide protests.

Another Constitution bench headed by Justice N V Ramana will also decide on the constitutional validity of the Centre’s decision to end the 70-year-long special status conferred on Jammu and Kashmir under Article 370 of the Constitution and divide the state into two Union Territories. Justice Ramana-headed bench will also deliver judgement on validity of restrictions imposed on use of mobile phones and internet after the August 5 decision.

The SC also redeemed people’s faith in it by upholding disqualification of 15 Congress-JD(S) MLAs in Karnataka, who played a key role in toppling the coalition government led by H D Kumaraswamy. However, the bench headed by Justice Ramana expressed anguish over Speakers increasingly forgetting their impartial role and dancing to the tune of the party in office.

If prolonged mobile phone shutdown post-August 5 caused hardship to residents of the Kashmir valley, the SC decision allowing government to recover Rs 92,000 crore from telecom service providers pushed the operators to a corner and the sector into a tailspin. It also judicially examined the CBI vs CBI fight erupting from personal differences between then director Alok Verma and the special director Rakesh Asthana and the powers of the Centre to divest the CBI chief of his powers and send the two top agency officials on leave. Though SC reinstated Verma, he was quickly replaced by a PM-led high-level panel.

After lulling the shadow boxing between Verma and Asthana, the SC penalised the West Bengal police for seeing a ghost in the movie ‘Bhobhisyoter Bhoot’ and unofficially pressuring theatre owners not to screen the film. It also granted bail to P Chidamabram, refusing to go by the contents of the sealed cover docket provided by ED about corruption by the former finance minister in the INX media foreign investment case.

The car belongs to the chief minister’s secretary and the official was not in the vehicle when the mishap took... Read More

BENGALURU: Traffic on Yeshwantpur flyover was disrupted after a sports utility vehicle (SUV), which is part of chief minister BS Yediyurappa's convoy , jumped the median and rammed an autorickshaw and a mini-truck coming in the opposite direction on Tuesday morning.

The SUV belonged to the chief minister's secretary Selvakumar. The officer, however, was not in his vehicle and was in Yediyurappa's car when the accident happened around 11am. Police said the CM's convoy was heading to Tumakuru and Selvakumar's SUV was in the rear of the convoy.

"Vinay Kumar, the driver of the SUV, lost control of the vehicle on entering the flyover and jumped the median. The car hit an autorickshaw and a mini-truck before coming to a halt," traffic police said.

Vinay Kumar and two others in the SUV sustained bruises. The auto driver was shifted to a private hospital with injuries on his hands and legs. The truck driver and his assistant escaped unhurt.

Traffic was disrupted for more than an hour as the accident caused a snarl up to Malleswaram 18th Cross on one side and Goreguntepalya junction on the other side.

Title: From P Chidambaram to Pilatus, a busy year for ED
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

File photo

NEW DELHI: It was a hyperactive year for Enforcement Directorate in 2019 when the agency had in its custody some of the most high profile persons like former finance minister P Chidambaram , former Karnataka minister D K Shivakumar, Fortis Healthcare promoter Malvinder Singh and Religare CMD Sunil Godhwani in various cases. It also succeeded in getting three fugitives deported from Dubai -- British national Christian Michel and Dubai resident Rajiv Saxena, wanted in the AgustaWestland VVIP chopper payoffs deal, and corporate lobbyist Deepak Talwar, in the Air India money laundering case.

The agency also interrogated Bhushan Steel CMD Sanjay Singhal and Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath’s nephew Ratul Puri. The agency’s ongoing money laundering cases against Robert Vadra , son-in-law of Congress president Sonia Gandhi , also moved forward. The agency has approached courts seeking cancellation of his anticipatory bail, seeking custodial interrogation. The ED has accused Vadra of links to fugitive defence dealer Sanjay Bhandari and claimed the latter, along with Rajiv Saxena, received payoffs in three defence deals — Embraer, Pilatus and AgustaWetland.

In the Swiss Pilatus aircraft deal, ED alleged that kickbacks of 39,527,070 Swiss Franc (around Rs 254 crore) was transferred to Sanjay Bhandari in his Dubai accounts. The 75 aircraft Pilatus deal was signed by UPA government in 2009-10. After the AgustaWestland VVIP chopper deal, this was the second big defence contract under ED investigation.

The agency has in its investigation reports accused certain Dubai-based shell companies of having received money from Bhandari which was further used to acquire properties in London allegedly by Vadra and his front entities.

But the agency hogged headlines when it arrested Chidambaram in the INX-Media money laundering case in October, after he had already spent 55 days in CBI and judicial custody in the same case. The senior Congress leader got relief from courts after 106 days in custody. The agencies claimed that shell companies associated with his son Karti received kickbacks from INX-Media and Aircel-Maxis besides others in lieu of favours granted by Chidambaram when he was the FM.

Just before Chidambaram’s arrest, ED had in September acted against D K Shivakumar, former Karnataka minister and senior Congress leader, at the forefront of action to protect party MLAs from Gujarat from being poached by BJP. This was when senior party leader Ahmed Patel was contesting a crucial Rajya Sabha poll. The ED investigation in a case involving Sterling Biotech and alleged money laundering to the tune of Rs 10,000 crore was another important case.

Corporate lobbyist Deepak Talwar, deported from Dubai, and still in custody for almost an year, is considered an important catch for the agency which, along with the CBI, has been probing the involvement of former civil aviation minister Praful Patel and some top bureaucrats during the previous UPA regime for alleged kickbacks and money laundering.

The ED’s investigation over the last two years has revealed that Talwar had received alleged kickbacks of over Rs 370 crore disguised as consultancy fees and donation to his NGO from foreign airlines for illegally benefitting them by using his contacts with the then civil aviation minister and senior bureaucrats withdrawing Air India’s services from profitable routes.

Title: Karnataka: Techie looking for US job loses Rs 4.5 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: A 32-year-old software engineer who was trying to land a job in the US was cheated of Rs 4.5 lakh by a job portal. Kshama Senani (name changed) of Nanjappa Layout in Arakere, told Hulimavu police she uploaded her resume on job portal careerindiadice.com on November 24.

"Minutes later, a person identifying himself as Harsh Mishra from careerindiadice.com called me and promised me a job in the US. He told me to deposit Rs 8,106 for registration. The same day, another man, who identified himself as Shivanshu, called me and said I had to pay Rs 3.1 lakh for background verification and profile creation. He promised that I was free to seek withdrawal of services and would get a full refund. I paid them using my HDFC credit card," the complaint reads.

The same evening, Kshama decided not to pursue job opportunities in the US due to personal reasons and called up careerindiadice.com and sought a refund.

"The job portal claimed I needed to pay Rs 1.3 lakh to 'swap' my profile and I paid the same on December 10 with my HDFC debit card. When I checked, I found the money had been transferred to Relfeckt Incorporation and Premium Services. I was told it would be refunded between December 22 and 25. I called up Shivanshu again to check and he claimed the process was almost over and the money would be deposited on December 26. He also sent an email confirming this," Kshama said in her complaint on Sunday.

"When the money was not refunded on December 26, I called Shivanshu and others and none of them answered," she added. "I also went to the address provided on the portal but no office existed at the place. I realised the information published was false," the complaint said. When TOI called the number mentioned on the website on Tuesday, it was temporarily disabled. Police are yet to initiate a probe in this regard.

Title: Bengaluru: 11 held for hacking food delivery boy to death
Content:
Representative image

BENGALURU: Eleven people were arrested on Monday for allegedly hacking a 25-year-old food delivery boy to death at Lakshminarayanapura, off Rajkumar Road, on the night of December 26.The murder was caught on CCTV cameras near the crime scene and police managed to trace the suspects by analysing the footage.Srirampura police said the victim, Manjunath P, a resident of Byatarayanapura Extension, had reportedly taken away a bike belonging to Tilak, a resident of Rajajinagar. Manjun ath recently asked Tilak to pay Rs 20,000 to get back the two-wheeler.An enraged Tilak then contacted his friends and they decided to eliminate the delivery boy."Tilak called Manjunath over phone on December 26 and asked him to come to Lakshminarayanapura. Manjunath's relatives allege he had given a loan of Rs 10,000 to Tilak. As he didn't return the money, Manjunath took away his bike. But Tilak claims he never borrowed any money and Manjunath took the vehicle to extort from him. We are probing both angles," a police officer said.Tilak and his associates hacked Manjunath to death when he came to Lakshminarayanapura. The accused include Manjunath alias Tent Manja, Roshan alias Rakesh, Mahendra, Sanjay, Jeeva, Harikrishna, Akhilesh R, Vighnesh, Vijay alias Gubbi and Deepak alias Stephen, all aged between 18 and 23.In Video: Bengaluru: 25-year-old food delivery boy hacked to death, 11 held

Title: Kerala passes resolution seeking CAA withdrawal
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: In a rare show of unity, the Kerala assembly on Tuesday passed a resolution demanding that the Centre withdraw the Citizenship (Amendment) Act 2019 immediately, making the state the first to oppose the controversial law legislatively. Speaker P Sreeramakrishnan said by passing the resolution, the assembly has ‘raised its status’ and Kerala has led by example, though it is moot that the resolution will have any impact beyond its symbolism.

All members of the serving LDF and the opposition UDF supported the resolution moved by CM Pinarayi Vijayan in the special session, saying the amended law was damaging to the basic values of India’s Constitution and secularism. O Rajagopal, the lone BJP MLA in the 140-member House, opposed the resolution, terming it “illegal and unconstitutional”.

Union law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad , who is in Kerala as part of a campaign to clarify on CAA , dismissed the resolution, saying that the state should have sought proper legal advice before venturing beyond its brief. “It is only Parliament which has got the power to make law in this regard and no other assembly, including Kerala assembly (has the power),” he said.

The resolution said CAA is in violation of the Right to Equality stated in Part III of the Constitution. “Considering rising concerns among majority of people about possible discrimination based on religion under the CAA, which would also destroy the concept of secularism envisaged by the Indian Constitution, the Kerala legislative assembly requests the central government to initiate measures to cancel the Act,” it said. Though UDF suggested an amendment to the resolution asking the Centre to stop all procedures for implementing the CAA until further decision, Vijayan said the Union government could withdraw it immediately through an ordinance and any request for interim measures would weaken the resolution.

Presenting the resolution, he said the CAA has led to nationwide protests besides destroying the global image of the country.

Title: Gujarat: Corruption in home department grew seven-fold in 2 years
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The home department, which includes the police, remained the most corrupt department this year as well. Data from the anti-corruption bureau (ACB) for 2019 revealed the home department had the highest number of employees caught, 80 of 100 accused in 66 cases, involving bribes amounting to Rs 37 lakh.If these figures are compared to 2017, the increase in the bribe value in 2019 was just over seven-fold. According to the figures, the ACB booked 80 employees of the home department and 20 private persons or middlemen in 2019. These 80 accused included one Class I officer, four Class II officials, 73 Class III personnel and two from Class IV.The figures show one home department employee is caught in corruption case every fifth day.In 2019, the value of bribes involving the home department was Rs 37 lakh. These figures were Rs 20 lakh in 2018 and Rs 5 lakh in 2017.ACB personnel recovered a total of Rs 94 lakh of bribe money, for all departments, in 2019. of which Rs 37 lakh or 40% was in cases involving the home department. In value terms, the revenue department remained at the second spot this year too, with Rs 15 lakh in bribes recovered by ACB sleuths.The revenue department had 32 cases involving 65 persons arraigned as accused including 4 Class I employees, three Class II, 25 Class III and two from Class IV, along with 31 private citizens.While a state government spokesperson claimed that the corruption cases lodged by the ACB indicated the government’s intensified efforts against corruption, a Congress leader alleged that these corruption cases are just the tip of the iceberg.

Title: Kolkata Temperature: Temperature likely to go up in Kolkata from today
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Citizens enjoy a cuppa on a chilly Tuesday morning

KOLKATA: Expect warmer nights as the minimum temperature is expected to rise from Wednesday. For the past few days, the minimum temperature has been below 12°C. On Tuesday, it was 11.6°C, two notches below the normal mark. By Wednesday this could jump up 12°C mark or a little over it.

Met office, however, sounded good news for people heading to Darjeeling stating they might get snowfall on January 3 and January 4.

“Due to two weather systems, a western disturbance and a deep trough, there is a fair chance of snowfall in Darjeeling,” said GK Das, director (weather) at Regional Meteorological Centre Kolkata.

In Kolkata the minimum temperature is expected to shoot up to around 14°C by Thursday and further more the next day. But due to a cloud cover the maximum temperature could be pushed down as low as 20°C on the Jan 3. With the maximum temperature at 22.5°C on Tuesday, the mercury was three notches below the normal mark.

“The difference between the maximum and minimum temperature will be very narrow during this phase. Even though the chill could go missing, the cold feeling will persist,” added Das.

As predicted by the Met office, Kolkata is expected to lash by light to moderate rain on Friday and Saturday. An interaction between a western disturbance and lower level easterlies have already started causing moisture incursion into the land. Even though the early part of Friday could be dry, rains could strike any time towards the evening.

“The mercury will start slipping again after this phase. But how much it goes down will depend on the intensity of the rain and other weather systems prevailing around that time,” said Das.

Title: Hyderabad: Winter packs late punch, chills promised in January
Content:
Children enjoy an ice-cream and a view of the Hussainsagar, during a cold evening at Necklace Road

HYDERABAD: After a delayed winter, January is expected to begin on a cold note. The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD), Hyderabad, predicted a gradual drop in minimum temperature after January 3.If the IMD figures are anything to go by then 2019 was perhaps the warmest New Year’s eve that the city has experienced in the last decade. The last year ended on a cold note as Hyderabad witnessed its coldest day of the season on December 31, 2018, registering a minimum temperature of 9.5 degree Celsius and maximum temperature of 27 degree Celsius. However, this year, the minimum temperature was double than what it was last year—at 18 degree Celsius and the maximum temperature stood at 27.5 degree Celsius— indicating a delay in setting of winter.Meteorologists claim that the north-easterly winds, which should have ideally hit Telangana by the first week of December, was delayed due to winds from Bay of Bengal.“This year, it has been relatively cloudy due to blowing of south-westerly winds, which have higher moisture levels instead of northerly winds,” said Raja Rao, meteorologist at IMD, Hyderabad. “Cloud formation restricts morning heat that is absorbed by the earth. Due to the clouds, heat is reflecting back to the earth resulting in rise in night-time temperature,” he added.While meteorologists predict that rains are likely to continue till January 3, there will be a drop in mercury level after that as clouds fade away. “From January 4, weather activities will start to clear up and minimums will once again fall in Telangana,” read a report issued by Skymet, an independent weather forecasting agency.According to IMD, the mercury levels are expected to drop two to three degree Celsius below normal by January 7. Mornings are expected to be foggy and misty with mainly clear sky during later part of the days.

Title: Gujarat: 10,000 cameras to be used for 2020 lion census
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

File photo

AHMEDABAD: Around 8,000-10,000 cameras will be used to carry out the 2020 lion census in Gujarat , the last abode of the Asiatic lion . As against 15,000sqkm area surveyed in the last census, lions will be counted across 25,000sqkm area spanning seven districts.

For the first time, the expertise of Wildlife Institute of India (WII) will be perused in the census, scheduled to take place in May 2020. “The WII has sent a proposal to the Gujarat government and two rounds of meetings have been held for finalizing the modalities of the census,” WII scientist and lion expert YV Jhala said.

The 2015 lion census had counted 523 lions in the state. The number is expected to have risen phenomenally with internal assessments of the forest department indicating that the population may have crossed the 1,000-mark.

Sources said the government will adopt the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA)’s technology for the lion census. “Forest department is in process of finalizing details for lion census. We are considering emulating tiger census methodology,” Shyamal Tikadar, principal chief conservator of forest (wildlife) said.

As per this model, the census area will be divided into a three-km grid each. Field officers will first carry out human surveillance to recover hair, teeth, nails etc. of the animals in a scientific method as laid out by NTCA. Physical forms will also be filled out noting the description of the lions. Around 1,500-2,000 field personnel will be employed for the exercise.

“In the second phase, 8,000-10,000 cameras would be installed to capture the movement of lions,” said a senior official.

Title: Man arrested for attacking film-maker in Salt Lake
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: A young photographer and film-maker from Salt Lake was allegedly assaulted by an acquaintance, who brandished a knife, following a difference in opinion over Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC). The trigger was apprently something that the photographer had posted on his social media page.

The accused, Avijit Dasgupta (51), was arrested within 21 hours of a complaint being lodged. He will be produced in a Salt Lake court on Wednesday.

The incident took place at EA Block in Salt Lake, opposite Bidhannagar College on Monday night, when the filmmaker, Ronny Sen, along with a group of friends, allegedly went to confront Dasgupta outside his home.

Sen alleged that a scuffle started and Dasgupta made to attack him with a knife even before he could start a conversation. Sen, however, stepped back and escaped being stabbed. Later, he lodged a complaint at the Bidhannagar North police station.

Cops have accepted the complaint and said they had started a probe. “There were some discrepancies in the initial complaint but later, we changed the complaint and arrested the accused from his house,” said a senior officer at the Bidhannagar Commissionerate.

Sen, a resident of HA Block in Salt Lake, said Dasgupta had abused and threatened him several times earlier over his views on NRC, CAA and nationalism that he posted on the social media. That, sparked a difference between him and Dasgupta, whom he had known for years, Sen said.

“We had become so different in our views that I had blocked him on my social media profile a year ago. Still for the past few days, be began abusing me on WhatsApp and calls. On Monday, I decided to confront him and asked him to meet me. He first called me at Ultadanga but later, asked me to come near his home. When I went there, he attacked me,” said Sen.

On being asked, Dasgupta admitted before TOI that he had been carrying the knife but for “self defence”.

“When I saw five men approaching my house, I was scared and carried a kitchen knife for my own protection. But I didn’t attack him. I know Ronny for several years and I didn’t like his comments on social media. But I offer an unconditional apology for the things I said to him. I did not have any intention to hurt him,” said Dasgupta.

After the incident, Sen made a Facebook post on the incident, alleging he was attacked by a “right-wing lumpen” and that the attack was unprovoked. He even mentioned in his post that he was attacked because of his views and opinions against NRC, CAA and NPR. After he made the post, it was shared several times by hundreds of Facebook users.

Title: Hospitalisation is 6 times more expensive in private sector: Study
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Hospitalisation for any ailment in a private hospital costs six times more than the expense incurred in a government institution, a study by the Union ministry of statistics and programme implementation has revealed.

The report, ‘Key indicators of social consumption in India: Health’ compared the average expenditure incurred per person for a hospital stay in government and private institutions. It put the cost at Rs 4,452 in a government hospital and Rs 31,845 at a private facility.

The pan-India study looked into nine categories of ailments and found the cost went up eight times in case of musculoskeletal and cardiovascular conditions. It covered 1,13,823 households and the data were collected between July 2017 and June 2018.

With the study not specifying the duration of hospitalisation and type of treatment and stopping short of going into state-wise specifics, TOI did a random check of comparative costs of treatment in private and government hospitals in Bengaluru. It was found that hospitalisation in private establishments was 2-20 times costlier than in government institutions. For example, a one-day stay in ICU in a government hospital costs Rs 1,500, while private hospitals raise a Rs 30,000 bill for the same.

An uncomplicated open heart surgery in a private hospital costs Rs 2.8 lakh and around Rs 95,000 in a public hospital like Sri Jayadeva Institute of Cardiovascular Science and Research. The cost of a knee replacement in a government hospital is Rs 65,000 and four times more in a private facility.

“Treatment in a government setup is highly subsidised. A procedure like mastectomy (surgical removal of breast) costs Rs 4,500 in Kidwai Memorial Institute of Oncology for a general ward patient. It’s Rs 25,000 if the patient prefers a single room accommodation,” said Dr C Ramachandra, director. In a Bengaluru private hospital, the same surgery costs no less than Rs 3.2 lakh.

Hospitalisation for cancer treatment is the most expensive in private hospitals compared to any other category of ailments. It costs Rs 93,305 in private hospitals as against Rs 61,216 in trust/NGO/charitable hospitals and Rs 22,520 in public hospitals.

The medicines, package component, diagnostic tests, doctor’s fee and bed charges make up for most of the cost at private hospitals. The package component introduced by private hospitals in urban areas is more than that in rural areas.

Experts said the need of the hour is to strengthen government hospitals and increase dependability on public health services.

However, Dr Alexander Thomas, president, Association of Healthcare providers India (AHPI), said compared to the global scenario, treatment cost in India’s private hospitals is not steep but realistic. Ideally, treatment in public hospitals must be free. “In private hospitals, income over expense is just about 15-20% and it does not come from the lab and pharmacy,” he said, adding that technology and resources are major differentiators in the private healthcare sector.

According to Dr Devi Shetty, renowned cardiac surgeon and member of the vision health group, Government of Karnataka , major reasons for the present situation can be traced to mistakes the government committed 3-4 decades ago.

“The worst thing that the government did was that it surrendered public health and medical education to the private sector. There’s a lack of skilled manpower and huge vacancies of specialists in government hospitals, making citizens opt for private hospitals. Ideally, 60-70% of the population which is not in position to afford treatment in private hospitals should be taken care of by government hospitals, but that’s not happening,” said Dr Shetty.

Title: Bengaluru: Underpass flooded by lake breach still unmotorable
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The underpass is littered with mud and dotted with potholes.

BENGALURU: Nearly two months after Hosakerehalli Lake in southwest Bengaluru breached, an adjacent underpass that was flooded remains in a deplorable condition.

Spread over nearly 53 acres, the lake in Banashankari Stage III breached on November 10, inundating over five houses in its vicinity.

The 50-metre underpass had been closed to enable speedy execution of work to seal the lake breach. Nearly two months later, it resembles a dust bowl and is littered with clumps of mud and pockmarked with potholes. Lack of streelights only adds to residents’ worries at night. The stretch is a crucial link for people commuting between Hosakerehalli and Rajarajeshwari Nagar.

“When the lake breached, officials visited the spot and promised to fix the underpass. But no one has bothered to do so,” said S Sadashivaiah, who lives near the lake. “We are unable to keep our doors/windows open because of the dust kicked up by vehicles. We feel suffocated even within the confines of our homes,” he lamented.

Hosakerehalli Resident Welfare Association has raised several complaints but to no avail. “We have decided to hold a protest and block roads until BBMP fixes the underpass,” said a member of HRWA. “Even water cans are getting dusty and are impossible to use,” said Ravindra K, a resident.

Another resident, Shymala (name changed), blamed the civic agency for the mess. “When the lake breached, officials got JCBs to stop the water flow, but they ended up damaging the road by throwing debris on the sides,” she said.

A senior BBMP official said marshals and officials have been informed about the road condition but the problem hasn’t been resolved due to lack of funds. “At present, we don’t have funds to take up any development work. We will soon call for a tender to fix underpasses across the city,” said the official.

Title: 2 sailors arrested from brothel in Karwar
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

KARWAR: In an embarrassment to the defence forces, police arrested two navy personnel from Karwar base and rescued a woman after raiding a brothel in the outskirts of the city late Monday night.

The arrested personnel are sailors from INS Kadamba Naval base.

Police rescued a woman from West Bengal and arrested Prabhavati Naik, who allegedly runs the brothel. Her husband Pandurang Naik, 69, took to his heels seeing the police team.

Wracked by controversies like honeytrap incidents, the defence ministry had on Monday issued a circular, banning smartphones on warships, dockyard and other sensitive defence installations.

The defence ministry's note comes close on the heels of Andhra Pradesh police arresting three persons from INS Kadamba base on December 20 on charges of espionage. The arrested sailors had allegedly been honey-trapped by Pakistani intelligence agencies and had transferred sensitive information to Pakistan agencies.

According to police, Pandurang Naik and his wife had been arrested in the past for similar offences. The arrested persons have been produced in a court here and remanded in judicial custody till January 12.

Title: BJP ex-min calls Congress MP’s criticism of CDS appointment ‘ill-informed’
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

NEW DELHI: Taking a dim view of the Congress’ criticism of the appointment of Gen Bipin Rawat as the country’s first Chief of Defence Staff ( CDS ), former Union minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said it was “ill-informed” and intended to create a divide between institutions critical to national security.

“Being an erudite lawyer and MP I thought @ManishTewari would argue on facts and logic but alas, that is not to be. I hope he had at least seen the press release before tweeting on an important issue like the institution of the CDS,” Singh tweeted referring to Congress MP Manish Tewari questioning Gen Rawat’s appointment.

“The roles of respective Chiefs, Defence Secretary and CDS are well defined... Please do not trivialise the issue or try to divide,” he said. He took dig at Tiwari saying if the “tweets of @ManishTewari are a CV for better role in Congress, they are excellent”. “But, if it is to add to discourse on national security, they are misleading and harmful,” Rathore said.

Tiwari had tweeted, “Why is appointment of a CDS is fraught with difficulties and ambiguities? What implications does nomenclature Principal Military Advisor to Defence Minister have in relation to the three service chief’s in terms of Military advice tendered to the government?” He added, “Will the CDS as Permanent Chairperson of Joint Chi- ef’s of Staff Committee outrank the three service Chief’s?...”

Title: Happy birthday Vidya Balan: From ‘Parineeta’ to ‘Mission Mangal’; here are FIVE characters that she portrayed effortlessly
Content: Bollywood actress Vidya Balan is one of the most versatile actresses we have in the industry. She has, over the years, left every one of us impressed with her impeccable and effortless performances. Right from her debut film ‘Parineeta’ to now the latest ‘ Mission Mangal ’, the actress has proved her spectacular and flawless talent. The National Award Winner’s work also proves that if she chooses any project, it has to be substantial.On her birthday today, we decided to note down some of her characters which will go down in the history of Indian cinema. Check it out:Vidya played a scientist with the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) and her character Tara Shinde is one of the major highlights of the film. She is delightful and is quite natural as always. Her character in the film stands out amongst everyone else. The actress was lauded for her performance and referred to as the star of the film. She delivered her role with great conviction and gave Bollywood yet another strong female character to rave about.After doing films like ‘Parineeta’, ‘ The Dirty Picture ’ and others, who would have thought Vidya doing a film like ‘Tumhari Sulu’. She played the role of a radio jockey who gives a sexy twist to her voice for a late-night show. Her character Sulochana Dubey aka Sulu is a housewife begins her journey of living her dream. She simply nails her character with such ease.‘Parineeta’ traces the life of Lalita who is a poor young girl who falls in love with her childhood friend Shekhar. It portrays Vidya as a determined and dignified girl for whom the well-being of her family holds the utmost importance. Her character had the option of submitting to her lover, but she chooses otherwise and goes for another man who respects her and her family.With this, Vidya proved that there’s nothing that she can’t do. She surprised everyone with her role of sex-siren Silk Smitha. Vidya broke all the stereotypes about having a perfect body and she chose to do this film at the time when a lot of actresses were being careful about their images. Vidya as Silk Smitha set a new benchmark for herself and this one proved to be a path-breaking film for her. She even won the National Film Award for the Best Actress.The film's narrative and Vidya’s performance had the audiences on the edge of their seats. Vidya played a pregnant software engineer in the Sujoy Ghosh directorial. Though the film didn’t focus much on her profession the story smartly incorporated her engineering skills in her quest.

Title: Happy New Year 2020 Memes, Wishes, Messages, Status, Photos and Images: 10 hilarious memes on New Year that will make you laugh out loud
Content: 2020 has arrived and we can't wait for the New Year to fill our lives with joy and cheer. While New Year is the time or day at which a new calendar year begins and the calendar's year count increments by one, the day's meaning and importance has evolved over the years. Since it's the beginning of a new year, people across the world wish everyone good luck for a new beginning and the same is done by exchanging greetings, wishes and gifts. If you want the New Year to begin on a joyful note, share some funny messages and memes with your friends and loved ones to start the year with some much needed laughter.Here are some funny New Year messages for your folks as well!A new year doesn’t come to change your life. It comes to remind you that one more year has gone and you’re still the same useless moron who thinks he can make his resolutions come true!New years are like restart buttons. You think you can push the button and start things all over again but then realize your life is too messed up to be restarted fresh!Sorry for all the annoying behavior I did throughout the year. May you give me another chance to do that in the next New Year!No resolution for the New Year, as I like my love in the state it is- criticizing and annoying you will go on the high range!May this upcoming year actually bring change in you – not just all your old habits wrapped in a new package, Oh God! Happy New year, anyways.Here’s a new year wish from a wise fellow asking you to donate more of your wealth so they can be spent by the right hands. Happy new year!Though I am wishing a very happy New Year, but remember you still have the same old husband!Happy new year! How’d it be if instead of bringing happiness, joy and peace, new year’s brought cash, fame and champagne?I was going to quit all my bad habits for the new year, but then I remembered that nobody likes a quitter.A new year doesn’t stop the ghosts from your past mistake coming back to haunt you. So, if you think you’re over it, you’re wrong. Happy new year!The funniest part of a new year is making new resolutions. I am pretty sure you have one too. Let me know about your resolution and I’ll try not to laugh as I did in the last year.Here’s a new year wish for you before the network gets jammed. I hope you’re having great fun. Wishing you a successful year ahead!God is kind enough to give you a new year but not so kind to give you a new life. Happy new year 2020!

Title: Greater Noida: Man pulled into car, robbed at Pari Chowk
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Hemant Bhardwaj

GREATER NOIDA: A 35-year-old bank manager was allegedly robbed of his belongings at gunpoint by four armed men inside a moving car near Pari Chowk on Monday. The crime took place at 8.50 am when Hemant Bhardwaj from Khurja in Bulandshahr was on his way to his office. He works as a deputy manager in a Delhi-based bank.

“I got down from a bus for an interchange at Pari Chowk. I was walking on the service lane of the expressway when a man pushed me inside a Hyundai Verna car that had no number plate. There were three more men sitting inside the vehicle. The miscreants took me at gunpoint and asked me to part with my belongings,” the victim said.

Bharadwaj added that the accused pointed a pistol at him and asked him to surrender everything he had. “The man on the front seat snatched my bag and two others kept checking my pockets. They kept the gun pointed at me all along. They took all the cash that I had, along with a gold chain and a ring. They also took the battery of my mobile phone,” he said.

After about 15 minutes, the accused allegedly threw Bharadwaj out of the car. He then informed the police and an FIR was registered against the four men under sections 342 (wrongful confinement) and 392 (robbery) of the IPC.

The station house officer of Beta 2 police station, Sujeet Upadhyay, said they were checking CCTV footage. “CCTV clips are being checked to identify the criminals. The arrests will be made soon.”

Title: Ban PFI for violence during anti-CAA stir, UP police tell govt
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

File photo

NEW DELHI/LUCKNOW: The Uttar Pradesh police has written to the state home department seeking a ban on Popular Front of India (PFI), a “radical” Islamic outfit with notable pockets of influence in western UP and which is accused of being behind incidents of violence and vandalism during recent protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act.

According to a senior police functionary, the UP police has, in its communication to the home department, pointed to PFI’s strong presence in select towns and districts of western UP — particularly Shamli, Meerut and Deoband — and its alleged role in fanning violent anti-CAA protests. Its purported UP chief Wasim and other activists have been arrested by the UP police in this regard.

In Shamli district alone, 28 people, including 14 members of PFI, were arrested for allegedly attempting to incite violence in the name of anti-CAA stir. Around 150 people were also taken into preventive custody recently, based on intelligence inputs received by UP Police about PFI “planning unrest” in Kairana and Kandhla towns of Shamli.

“We have submitted the various case files relating to PFI activities in UP to back our request for a ban on the outfit under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act,” a senior UP police official told TOI.

PFI on Tuesday, however, denied the state police’s allegations linking it to violent anti-CAA protests and alleged that the proposed ban is an effort to suppress “one of the largest popular agitations since Independence against the anti-Constitutional CAA.” Pointing out that only BJP-ruled states were suppressing protests, PFI accused the Yogi Adityanath government of bloodbath and destruction.

Condemning the move to ban it, PFI in a statement said: “It is nothing but a face-saving act. The move against PFI is yet another authoritarian step by the UP police against democratic activism.”

Deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya too told newsmen that PFI was allegedly behind large-scale damage to public property and anarchy during anti-CAA protests. “Such organisations will not be allowed to flourish. PFI is an incarnation of the banned Students Islamic Movement of India (SIMI),” he said.

Additional director-general of police (Kanpur Zone) Prem Prakash had emphasised on an alleged Kerala plot in Babupurwa and Yateemkhana violence. On Tuesday, he told TOI, “Some PFI members have been detained for interrogation and incriminatory and anti-national literature was seized from their possession in Kanpur.”

A senior police official in the intelligence wing of police said all local intelligence units across districts have been asked to share information on recovery of material from PFI members.

The alleged Kerala link in the violence during anti-CAA protests across the state was first shared by UP deputy chief minister Dinesh Sharma with arrests of PFI members on December 25.

An NIA dossier submitted to the Centre in 2017 — making a case for banning PFI under UAPA — had termed as “radical” the outfit’s policy of recruiting only committed Muslim youth “who assiduously follow Islamic tenets”.

NIA said PFI cadres are encouraged to act as guardians of “Islamic values” and cited four of terror cases involving the organisation cadres. These include chopping of a professor’s hand in Kerala’s Idukki district; holding of a training camp in Kannur from where NIA allegedly seized swords, country-made bombs and ingredients for making IEDs; murder of RSS leader Rudresh in Bengaluru on October 16, 2016 and the Islamic State Al-Hindi Module case in which IS-inspired youth from Kerala and Tamil Nadu were recruited to target prominent persons and places in south India.

NIA had claimed PFI pursues a strategy aimed at communalising Indian polity, enforcing Taliban brand of Islam, heightening existing social divisions and maintaining a trained bank of volunteers for physical actions. PFI, however, had strongly refuted the allegations made by the agency.

The dossier also pointed out that many of PFI’s founding leaders were associated with SIMI before it was banned in 2001. This includes former PFI chairman E M Abdurahiman, who was all-India general secretary of SIMI in 1980-81 and 1982-93, PFI national vice-chairman P Koya who was with SIMI in 1978-79 and SDPI president E Aboobacker who was Kerala state president of SIMI in 1982-84.

Title: Noida bought more vehicles in 2019, but cheaper ones
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

The city is a green shoot in the slowdown smog that has shrouded the automobile industry in India.

NOIDA: The city is a green shoot in the slowdown smog that has shrouded the automobile industry in India. Despite the issues plaguing the sector, the number of vehicle registrations in the city continued to grow.

But the growth in percentage terms showed a downward trend in 2019. The number of luxury vehicles registered in Noida also reduced.

Even though the total tax collected from vehicle registrations by the transport department increased marginally, officials said the reduction in the number of new luxury vehicle registrations caused a tax loss of nearly Rs 15-20 crore last year. Registration of vehicles priced over Rs 50 lakh increased from 396 in 2017 to 431 in 2018 and then saw a decline to 399 again in 2019.

“Usually, the number of vehicles registered increases every consecutive year in Noida in all categories. However, last year saw the number of luxury vehicles dropping. Even in the four-wheeler category, there were more number of smaller vehicles registered than the bigger sedans and SUVs,” said A K Pandey, the ARTO.

He added that even if the number of vehicles registered is higher, the value of the vehicles is less. It reduced the tax collections and also showed people’s unwillingness to invest in costlier vehicles.

“If there are around 50 luxury vehicles less than the previous year, we have a revenue loss of Rs 15-20 crore. So, while there has been a 30% increase in revenue from 2017 to 2019, the rate of growth has reduced in 2019,” said Pandey.

The total number of vehicles registered in 2019 in the city was 89,625, which is marginally higher than 85,628 in 2018 and 66,582 in 2017.

The number of four-wheelers registered in Noida increased from 21,135 in 2017 to 23,761 in 2018 and grew further to 25,537 in 2019. Meanwhile, the number of two-wheelers increased from 39,811 in 2017 to 51,657 in 2018 and increased only marginally to 55,000 in 2019.

This means, the growth in the registration of two-wheelers was 29% in 2018, but came down to 6.5% in 2019. The officials say that the two-wheeler sales show the purchasing power of most of the middle-class population.

The number of commercial vehicles registered in Noida also increased from 4,966 in 2017 to 9,157 in 2018 but reduced to 7,999 last year. The tax revenue for commercial vehicles, however, continued to increase from Rs 13.4 crore in 2018 to Rs 13.6 crore in 2019.

Title: UPSRTC offers rebates on buses to Lucknow
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

GHAZIABAD: The Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation ( UPSRTC ) is offering rebate in fare for passengers on Lucknow-Delhi route via Ghaziabad that will be effective from Wednesday, on the first day of the New Year.

The rebate will be on high-end buses of the UPSRTC, like Volvo and Scania.

“In a recently concluded board meeting, a decision to offer rebates on bus fares on the Lucknow-Delhi route was taken, primarily to stay competitive with the private players,” said A K Singh, the regional manager, Ghaziabad zone, UPSRTC.

“The new fare will come into effect from the first day of 2020. The rebate will be on the basis of telescopic fare structure, which means that the fare decreases proportionally with the increase in distance,” he said.

Fare will be decreased by 1.5% to 15% depending on the length of the journey.

According to the fare structure, for the first 100 km, the rates have remained unchanged, however, for up to 50 km, there will be a reduction of fare by 1.5% per kilometre.

“In absolute terms, the fare from Lucknow for a Delhi-bound passenger will come down from Rs 1, 260 to Rs 1, 071,” said Singh.

The official also said that after three months, the plan will be reviewed and it could be extended to other routes, like Bareilly, Varanasi and Gorakhpur .

Title: Ghaziabad: 5 steal money from ATM, held
Content:
This story is from January 1, 2020

Representative image

GHAZIABAD: Five men were arrested for allegedly stealing money from an ATM in Kavi Nagar on Tuesday. They were nabbed after a brief exchan ge of fire, police said.

During patrolling in Govindpuram, police saw five men standing outside an ATM kiosk. As soon as the team started approaching them, one of the accused allegedly fired at them and they all started running. The police team finally caught them at 2am and seized three country-made pistols, a hammer and other items.

SP (city) Manish Kumar Mishra said the men confessed to robbing several ATMs in the city and nearby areas.TNN
